title: Fantastic hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Wonderful stay
review: Recently returned from a truly memorable trip to Istanbul, made all the more enjoyable because of our stay in this lovely hotel. Rooms are of the highest standard of comfort, cleanliness and charm. A special word of thanks to the staff who were so helpful, professional and knowledgeable - with many suggestions and recommendations which further enhanced our stay. Sincere thanks also to our guide, Peri.

title: Big nice rooms with perfect location
review: I would like to give a warm thank you to the staff and management who went above and beyond to help us as we experienced some difficulties and were always there for us; it really felt like they cared. So we did have a wonderful stay. A few pieces of advice for travelers who might have more difficulties moving: this hotel has stairs so if you really need an elevator you should look elsewhere. The same goes for the streets to the main square: it's a steep uphill climb. Of course, for us it was all part of the fun, getting our exercise and what a great reward when you get there! Some rooms have a view to the sea so the stay is all the more beautiful. Again, we left with wonderful memories.

title: Perfect location
review: Very friendly staff and location. Can absolutly recommend this hotel. Its only a few hundred meters from sultanachmet.g Really gppd for families with kids.  Nice restaurants very close but the hotelrestaurant is really good do most nights we had them there.

title: Istanbul
review: The hotel is about 200 metres from Sultanamet Square and main touristic sites, as well as sites not as much visited but worth a look - such as archaeology museum(s), and Islamic and Turkish Art Museum. From Sultanamet Square, easy access to tram for getting about the city. The hotel met our needs very well. The rooms are somewhat dated, but it is clear that work is begin done to improve and update the facility. The lobby opens onto a very nice treed courtyard, with resident cat and kitttens, and a restaurant with indoor and courtyard seating. We ate evening meals there twice and greatly appreciated the mezes and lamb dishes. A large and varied Turkish breakfast buffet was included in our reservation. It was very good. The hotel is in a relatively residential rather than commercial area. It was very peaceful. The hotel has a customer relations desk which provides a lot of information on visiting touristic sites, connecting with tours and guides, etc. But you are also in a good location to just strike out on your own if you want.…

title: Great location, clean and comfortable
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Stunning Hotel in a stunning location
review: We found the Rose Garden Suites to be very comfortable with nicely appointed rooms which were very clean. The hotel is in Sultanahmet which is a great location as it is walking distance to most main attractions. The main reception staff were always very helpful and willing to organise taxi’s etc for us. Breakfast was an assortment of salads and fruit but was lacking in cooked dishes such as a variety of eggs (just provided boiled eggs). The restaurant meals were ok.  Overall I would recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again.

title: Charming Hotel Old City
review: Great location for a great hotel. Was lucky enough to be shown around the hotel and really liked that each room had a different historic significance. Such wonderful service from the staff who go above and beyond their call of duty. Highly recommended to anyone who wants a relaxed, stress free holiday!

title: Great Place and Location
review: This comfortable, relaxed and friendly hotel is very close to the Blue Mosque, Haghia  Sofia, and The Topkapi Palace. It’s a lovely oasis in a quiet street off the main areas. The rooms were all tastefully furnished with thought to detail.  The staff were all so attentive and very pleasant- nothing was too much trouble, and effort was made to engage with us to make our stay as interesting as possible. We dined in the garden restaurant a few times, as the menu was great , and cuisine good and well presented. All in all would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

title: Great place to stay
review: We found the Rose Garden Suites to be a great place to stay in a great central location to all that Istanbul has to offer. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, to the point that nothing was a bother. We found the room to be very clean, spacious and comfortable. The breakfast is a very delicious and traditional assortment of dishes. As for the location, everything you need is within easy walking distance of all the must see attractions, restaurants and public transport. We would definitely recommend the Rose Garden Suites for either a short or extended stay in Istanbul.

title: Rose Garden Suites / Garden Hiuse
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great hotel in the  heart of Istanbul
review: This hotel covers a number of buildings so can be confusing if you are using Google Maps to walk from Sultanahmet bus drop off from the airport. The rooms are of varying configuration but interesting Turkish decor, clean and comfortable. The greeting at reception was fantastic, offering a sit down orientation with a service person to book any tours you may want to do. The hotel is in walking distance from Blue Mosque, Sofia, Hippodrome and 12 minutes walk to the Grand Bizaar. It is also an original building in this part of the old city.

title: Amazing stay in Istanbul
review: I stayed in Rose Garden Suites for 3 days during my trip to  Istanbul and I dam recommend it wholeheartedly.  Room was clean and c beautiful, bathroom had private  turkish bath and the garden was  an amazing place to chill and drink coffe.  Stuff of this hotel was politle  and helpful, location is  outstanding, 10 minutes from historical  centre of city and my overall  experience  is definetly  positvie. I can   recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Top location!!
review: We had a really great experience at Rose Garden! Nice location in the city center, helpful staff and pleasant, clean rooms made us feel comfortable from the first moment of our stay. The garden where breakfasts are served is really calm and relaxing, perfect to enjoy a cup of coffee. And they have a free wine tasting on Fridays and Saturdays! Would really recommend this hotel.

title: Fantastic stay
review: A great location! I like to walk, so this place was a great choice. Everything is really close and easy to reach. The staff was super friendly. We become a lot of useful information, tips and suggestions. Are wishes was always considered. The breakfast was delicious and huge, and also one love was born: gözleme!! To recommend ;) Thanks for everything! We have had a wonderful time!

title: Staying in lovely Rose Garden
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Tourist
review: A beautiful place to stay just as the name Rose Garden, it was a beautiful experience with beautiful staffs, the rooms were really big, the people working there very friendly, special mention to Mustapha Kemal the cheerful employee. Kudos, don't miss a chance to stay in this lovely place if u're in Istanbul. Kudos to the place for its hospitality and ambience.😎

title: thanks from my heart
review: Nice and cosy hotel. Very friendly staff. Convenient location  ... nearby grand bazaar and other tourist attraction.  Free flow coffee and water.  I visited during summer with my friends and everyone enjoyed the stay.

title: Relaxing hotel
review: This hotel and its staff helps us to spent 5 great days in Istanbul. Of course many hotels have 3, 4 or 5 stars... But this hotel has its amazing atmosphere. Great inside yard. Clean and big rooms with marble floor in baths. Great location in old city near to most famous places in Istanbul. I am sure it is great choice to travelers. Managers can help to arrange any excirsion  I am sure I will stay here again at my next visit to Istanbul .

title: Great hotel
review: It was a relaxing and quiet place to escape Istanbul traffic everything was good the room was romantic,clean with a very nice balcony, the staff was friendly and helpful and the garden where the restaurant located was charming,the food was tasty and delicious!

title: Lovely place
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A true gem in the heart of old Istanbul
review: Found this location by chance, when we decided on short notice to go to Istanbul for a long weekend. And it was a great decision. The hotel is located within walking distance from the main tourist attractions in Sultanahmet (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar, Egyptian Bazaar, etc). So, if you're going to Istanbul to visit or just to have a good time, this is the place to go. We opted for a Traditional Turkish Room, which was amazing. The room was pretty big, with a large bed. The bathroom was Turkish style, with waterfall. Cleanliness was top notch. There's one drawback though, but not really an inconvenient. Since the bathroom has the drain in the floor, there is a mild smell of mould sometimes. But like i said, no inconvenient, since it's not persistent. TV,…

title: excellent
review: We spent 4 nights in Rose Gardens hotel and it was AMAZING , the location is perfect , as you will find Sultanahmet Blue Mosque ,Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, the broken column and even more historical sites in a walking distance less than 10 mins and you can reach all other sites easily with public transportation. As for the hotel itself , the room was clean and spacious and clean , the view from our room is amazing as the room was facing the beautiful garden of the hotel, the staff is very helpful and the food is Delicious, we would like to thank all the staff specially Mr Yousef in the front desk , if you stay there and needed any help just ask them and they will go the extra mile to make you happy .  The area is quiet and totally safe , we could walk in the neighbourhood even…

title: A Rose in the Heart of Istanbul
review: the first hotel I stayed in Turkey, a nice starting good location, near to Aya Sofia and blue mosque the hotel is a historical building, my room contains a Turkish bath nice breakfast and dinner the staffs are awesome and helpful a nice hotel

title: The hotel is like home and we felt comfortable but some how noisy in the night and also a bit expensive but very good
review: I stayed here with my husband at the beginning of a long trip through Turkey, Israel, and Georgia. I needed to travel back to Istanbul to return to the U.S. and decided to come and spend a few extra days, specifically at Rose Garden Suites. The location is great, a short walk to Sultanahmet Square. The rooms are beautiful and the property is well-kept. The breakfast was good and plenty and the restaurant on-site had some of the best Turkish food I had my entire trip (I'm still dreaming about that fresh pita bed). All of the staff were absolutely lovely and wonderful, from helping me set up tours and transfers to suggesting museums and even books for me. Everyone went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and happy. I would definitely recommend Rose Garden Suites and…

title: Very nice place to stay in

title: Best place to stay while visiting Istanbul
review: Actually this is the first time I have stayed in Fateh area. However, in this hotel I feel like I’m at home.  The guys in the reception make you feel that they are hosting at their homes with a great joy and happiness.  I highly recommend to stay in this hotel.

title: Amazing Hotel in an Amazing Location & Amazing staff.. Highly recommended
review: Our stay at Rose Garden was a real pleasure. Staff were excleent in assiting allround. Location is perfect walking distance to the main attractions in Istanbul. Getting a taxi from here to further locations was arranged by hotel staff. Breakfast was scrumptious every morning. Yusuf was a great help with information as well as going beyond his duties to assist us.

title: Wonderful stay
review: I stayed with my family at the hotel recently between 8th June 19 - 14th June 19. This hotel is a beautiful place to live in central Istanbul. The hotel is close to all the historic buildings and amenities. The hotel management and staff were amazing, very helpful, cooperative and they make sure you are having the best time ever. The hotel has a beautiful garden and restaurant. The restaurant offers amazing and delicious food. The restaurant staff was very friendly with great service. I would highly recommede

title: A cozy oasis in old Istanbul
review: With my friends I visited Istanbul for 3 days and stayed in Rose Garden Suites. All the staff was amazing, cooperative and working with smiling faces. Room service was really good. Breakfast was fresh always and lot of choice. Very excellent service in all aspects.

title: Gem of a Hotel in Sultanahmet
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. title: perfect hotel
review: This is a great hotel tucked in just behind the Blue Mosque (5-7 min uphill walk). The Location enabled us to travel all over the city by tram from Sultanahmet Tram Station. The Staff lent us an extra Istanbul Card which they had and we were good to go. We stayed stayed here for 10 nights and it was amazing. Special mention for Yusuf at the Reception, who always had great recommendations and was always smiling. Bulent, the guest relations was always available to help us out. In fact all the staff of the hotel was always smiling and very warm. The Restaurant onsite was fabulous, though the breakfast was limited and pretty much the same everyday. There are a lot of restaurants and bars in the vicinity and walkable, gave us a lot of options. All in all it was a fabulous stay and I…

title: Great location & value for money
review: To Rose Garden Hotel I complement you having such nice stuff that made our four night wonderful we felt as we are with our family with their nice smile which never separate their faces and many thanks to the receptionist Mr Yusuf who was all ways there to help with nice smile and kind I will recommend all my friends and  anyone  that reads my comment  try it and I am definitely sure you be going back as for the room s very clean and breakfast  is VIP breakfast

title: Excellent food and service
review: Rose Garden suites is a lovely haven with its garden setting making a lovely change from most accommodation styles of “very little or no” outside/garden space  The staff are friendly and the breakfast setting (& all meals) is pleasant, a choice of inside or out  The breakfast spread is a wonderful assortment of juices, fresh fruit, cheeses, meats, yoghurt, Turkish treats too many to mention, eggs of your choice prepared to order and coffee variations to please anyone plus tea. If you have the capacity after there is a great range of pastries to finish off breakfast   Our room was spacious and comfortable with a little balcony overlooking the garden PS the roses were in bloom so that was an added little bonus  Without being critical the room was perhaps a little dated but a great…

title: Best hotel in Istanbul?
review: Great place to stay close to Blue Mosque and Hippodrome. The hotel and rooms are clean and the service is excellent from the moment you arrive until you leave.  Very nice garden and terrace for breakfast and a late dinner. An extensive Ottoman menu absolutely worth trying. Go for it!

title: Perfect Location! Comfortable Hotel w Friendly and Professional Staff!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Enchanting
review: The Rose Garden Suites far exceeded our expectations from check in to check out.  My dad and I arrived in Istanbul Sunday May 12th and took the bus from the airport. Once dropped off at the main bus stop in Sultanahmet, we were having difficulties w mapquest because of our cell carrier (Verizon). We called the hotel and within minutes they were there to escort us. This was the beginning of our wonderful experience.    We didn’t have set plans for our week however knew we wanted to see and do as much as possible. After sharing this with the hotel staff, they offered, as a courtesy, to plan and coordinate our adventures and I’m so glad we let them! We took a Bosphorus cruise, private guided walking tour of the city and 2 days in Cappadocia. I didn’t have to stress over anything!…

title: Perfect
review: Absolutely lovely. Very friendly staff and a charming room. All are distinctive. We had a room with a sultan bed and a Turkish bath. Breakfast was great and the courtyard filled with roses. This is not suitable for the disabled. Lots of stairs and everything is uphill to the main Sultanahmet sites but you are near to everything

title: Friendly staff
review: This is my third time in this hotel. As always - staff is fantastic, breakfast just went better with a new team operating the restaurant. Rooms are large and very nicely decorated, This is the perfect place for first timers who want to be close to all the old-city highlights, the Grand Bazaar. They can "bundle" a cab from and back to airport.

title: ❤ 5 star Food Experience 😎
review: My wife & I stayed for 4 nights. The staff is very friendly & helpful in advising you about Istanbul. They are happy to arrange any requests on short notice. The room was cleaned daily. There is complimentary water, tea and coffee all day.

title: Highly recommended
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent hotel in The heart of Istanbul
review: I love istanbul so much.. This is my second time there.. With same hotel.. Nice hotel.. Nice services.. Nice staff.. And its near almost all historical place in istanbul such as blue mosque.. Hergia sophia.. Topkapi palace.. Grand bazar.. Just 5min by walking from this hotel to thats place.. Superb hotel.. Ill recommended this hotel for those want travel to istanbul.. Also we took cruise for whole day with good price.. And at night there is cruise also for entertainment.. Gosh.. Such a huge experience there.. All of thats arrangements by this hotel.. So helpful.. Gosh.. I miss istanbul.. Will come and come and come again there... Till we meet again istanbul... From malaysia with love.. 💕💕💕

title: NO LIFT
review: Hi  We came for the first time to visit Istanbul. We stayed in Rose garden suites. The hotel is very well located, near all the important touristic spots. The service is excellent, staff is very kind and professional. The rooms are very clean and the ambiance is very good. We will recommend this hotel to everyone. Price is also not very costly.

title: Exceptional hospitality
review: The hotel has no lift which is hard if your not fully fit.We were update to the top floor which i think was because of building work at the hotel.Getting up and down from the 5th floor 3or 4 times a day was hard.As you leave the hotel you will find your on a steep hill and even more hills to get to the tourist areas.Hotel  was clean .if not a little dated,Breakfast was ok,nice garden if you like cats.

title: Highly recommended
review: Stayed here for 6 nights and couldn't have had a better experience. Where this hotel truly shines is in the hospitality and warmth of the people working there. It is not a faceless chain hotel, but one where everyone greets you with a smile, asks about your day, and is happy to help you with anything you need (recommendations, arranging transport or excursions etc.).   The location is great -- a short walk from all the attractions in Sultanahmet, but tucked down a quieter side street so you're out of the chaos and crowds.    Our room (the executive suite) was lovely -- exactly as it appeared in the pictures, and  very well cleaned everyday. There's also a nice courtyard/garden to sit in outside when the weather is nice -- and there's the occasional cat that comes to say hello! …

title: 3 nights in Istambul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A respectful and good service hotel
review: Plus:  You are close to attractions 5min. Good restaurant in hotel area. Very kind personnel.   Rooms very clean.  Minus: We take suite with jacuzzi and it's next to road which is noisy. There was crack on door and you can see through it.

title: Awesome!
review: We stayed for 4-5 nights at the Rose Garden, we did like the service and the approach of the Hotel and we liked our room (warm as it was January and spacious, very clean as my fiancée is quite demanding in this context). In January you wouldn't benefit of the garden that much and some construction took part, but we understand that it is a low season and some refreshments should be done exactly at this time, rather than in Summer.  So we are all in all satisfied and grateful for our stay. Thank you.

title: Great hotel at great location
review: My stay was great! The room was so beautifully decorated to give you an ottoman feeling with extraordinary cleanliness.  Great experience!  And the restaurant that is in the hotel is a mustttt! With great taste and presentation of a wide variety of authentic ottoman and turkish dishes.

title: Comfortable room, top location
review: Rose Garden is really nice. The staff were very helpful and willing to accommodate my special request - I wanted to check out in the afternoon around 4 pm after their check out time, they were ok with that.  I stayed on the third floor although they do not have an elevator, the staff helped me with my suitcase when I checked in and checked out. The room was very nice, spacious, with a balcony overlooking the garden, and clean. Breakfast was delicious. Great location, walking distance to major sites such as Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia Museum, I also walked to the Grand Bazaar.  Would stay here again and recommend this place to my friends.

title: Best Hotel in Istanbul !
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: My third stay at this hotel.
review: I had an excellent stay with my family at Rose Garden Suites , the staff is nice and very warm, the rooms are beautiful and the breakfast very hearty . the hotel is located in a very quiet place and close to the main tourist sites 👌🏻

title: Do not stay there
review: Being able to walk to most of the attractions is a huge plus.    The buffet breakfast is bountiful and this time I had a huge room with my own hammam.    Management and staff were very helpful as usual.     The hotel is very clean and cleaning ladies are friendly.

title: Great boutique hotel, with a lovely garden and a good location!
review: A worst place to stay, disrespectful staff with bad attitude, smelly rooms probably have mold or something, booked with Hotwire three rooms for 9 nights. They hotel manager was so rude and tried to scare us by saying that since it is a prepaid reservation we will not get our money back . Also hotel guests gets free breakfast but if you have booked through Hotwire you have to pay for the breakfast . They have put us on 3rd floor and hotel have no elevator.

title: A lovely stay
review: I absolutely loved this small boutique hotel! Great stuff from reception to cleaning ladies and the girls at breakfast. Many thanks to Ayhan, the hotel manager ! Always with a smile on his face, he upgraded our room from a queens to an executive suite. Bigger and better and i do recommend it! Lovely garden, and even thought i came to Istanbul in december it was still okay to sit outside for a cup of tea.I can't wait to visit this place when it's warmer and really enjoy the garden!   The rooms are big, and look better than in the pictures. I loved the marble bathrooms with heated floor, the huge bed with a great foam mattress and good pillows. Slept like a baby, and let me tell you i am peaky when it comes to pillows! The room was always cleaned and the slippers and towels…

title: Best service with wonderful location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Best hotel and even better staff!!!
review: The Hotel is located on the southern side of the old district peninsular. Very close to most of the historical sites and yet still in a quiet area. 5-10 mins walking to the tram station and train stations. 15 mins away from The Grand Bazaar. Ideal for holiday travellers as well as business people. Very reasonable price compare with others in the same area. The room is a bit small but very nicely organised and cleaned. All staffs are helpful and friendly. The STYLISH MANAGER knows the area and can provide all kinds of info and bookings include events and airport pickups. Very nice gentleman to talk with, and bit shy in front of his boss😱😱😱. (No, I lied on that one just to make this feedback looks real)

title: Good hotel
review: We booked a last min trip to Istanbul and with all the options for hotels, were so lucky to find this place. The hotel staff was amazing, the location was amazing and the restaurant inside the hotel was probably the best food we have ever had. The rooms were really nice, clean, warm, cozy and the price was even better! The free breakfast every morning was so fresh and delicious. This hotel is a couple min walk from everything you could ever want to do in old city. I could go on and on for days about how amazing this place is. Do yourself a favor and stay here. We loved it so much we decided to stay an extra three days!! We will be back and will recommend this hotel to all our friends and family.

title: Comments on hotel
review: Hotel is very nice and cozy. Rooms are clean, warm and have air-condition that work for heat at wintertime - very important :) Good breakfast and complimentary water, tea and coffee in lobby. A bit hard to find a location by yourself but after few times no problem to find hotel. Super-awesome view from rooms on 5th floor, and a lot of seagulls 👍🏻. Will be happy to come back and stay in this hotel again. Thank you for good 3 days

title: Amazing stay
review: I’ve have really enjoyed during my stay in this hotel. Very comfortable place and very cooperative staff, very beautiful garden and restaurant. I really have unforgettable experience and recommend for everybody

title: I think this hotel is the most beautiful and suitable hotel in Ïstanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great hotel
review: I came to this hotel with my project group.We were from 6 countries.French,Spain,Poland,Romania, Iceland and Turkey.We were really happy about our hotel rooms,Breakfast,place and staffs.I will stay here again whenever I come to Ïstanbul.

title: Nice hotel in the very center of the old city.
review: We stayed here for our 20th anniversary and it was great. A mishap upon arrival meant we had to stay at the hotel next do or first night but the staff were exquisite, nice and polite and made our stay memorable. Can recommend this to anyone visiting Istanbul.

title: Nice hotel
review: I have attended a professional meeting that took place in the very hotel. My experience there has been really perfect. Services are ok, people are absolutely helpful, everybody speak - at least - English, breakfast is great, the atmosphere is quiet and the place is beautiful. Ten minutes to Aya Sofia. Rien ne va plus.

title: Boutique Hotel in the City Centre
review: I came with my mother and we stayed for an weekend, it was so nice, we will sure come back, breakfast, lunch, and dinner is very good and is near to a lot of places which you can visit, very very nice!

title: Good price, good location, good staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Mrs Suraiya rahman
review: Stayed 4 days for business.  Good location, from just hundreds of meters from the Blue Mosque and main touristic atractions. Although when you enter, it looks simple, rooms are quite nice, beds are comfortable, and well equipped. Throughout cleaning every day, free to consume tee, water and coffee. Minibar, own restaurant. Caring staff and most of all: reasonable prices. Would be happy if I would be able to spend thefd some time with my family as well.

title: Great value!!
review: Superb hotel and great management. Great location excelant gourmet food of highest standard. I will recommend this hotel to friends. Definitely we will stay here in our next transit.i will came back this hotel again

title: Return Visitor
review: We loved the charming location of this charming hotel in the heart of old Istanbul. The service was amazing!!! I read a recent review about cats being everywhere. While this is true, one must be aware that this is just a part of being in Turkey. There are street dogs and cats everywhere. If you leave them alone, they won’t bother you in the least. Two thumbs up for this charming hotel. We loved our stay here!!!

title: Bede
review: Rose Garden is my favourite spot to stay when I’m in Istanbul. This was my third stay, and each time leaving becomes harder, because I feel very much at home there with the comfort and cleanliness of the accommodations, the polite, helpful staff, and the delicious food I enjoy on premises. Breakfasts are a feast of fresh ingredients, Turkish tea and coffee, eggs made to order, variety of cheeses, cold cuts, yogurts, cold Turkish dishes and more. The garden, quiet and tastefully decorated with greenery surrounding one is a quiet haven in the midst of Istanbul’s hustle and bustle. Situated at a good proximity to many of the city’s attractions, such as the Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, etc. Rose Garden is a wise choice for any visitor to consider.

title: Rajesh thangappanzakarieva sapiiat
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Super Hotel!
review: Really warm welcome,generous, courteous,  good support, guide us,  I fell as I was in my home, more over I could see more places as they give us basic travel information,i enjoyed my food,   Many many regards Rajes

title: The most friendly staff and most beautiful environment!
review: The staff was very kind, our room was clean and it looked exactly like on the pictures. Even in november we could still sit outside and drink tea or eat breakfast in the beautiful garden of the hotel.

title: Extremely unhealthy hotel at good location
review: The staff really made our stay in Istanbul amazing. They were the most helpful in arranging transportations for us and delivering dinners to our rooms for free. The room came with a full bath where you can literally make your own Turkish bath. Plus, a beautiful garden to have brunch and a wonderful walking distance to the beach as well as all the historical sights you might want to visit.

title: 5 stars
review: I booked two rooms. When we arrived we had to listen the totally irrelevant stories of the receptionist-front desk manager, but after around 20 minutes and paying the hotel bill, we could go to the rooms. Both were mouldy, especially in my room the air was almost not breathable. The electrical wiring of the hair dryer was almost destroyed, so there were serious health and safety issues with the rooms. Immediately  made the complaint, the receptionist instantly forgot English language but after mentioning Trip Advisor he understood the problem, and told me they are going to change our rooms to a nicer and bigger one. I underlined that I am not complaining about the size but the mould. He did not answer. Next day we were given new rooms mould was not visible but the electrical…

title: We loved it and will be back next time we are in Istanbul!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Vacation
review: + We both felt welcomed and the staff are both nice and service minded. We love both the hotel's interior and facade. The room we received is cozy and also has a balcony with view over the hotels inside area with restaurang and garden. It is relaxing to sit on the balcony with a glass of optional drink and listen to the birds song, read a book or just be! We came from a hectic journey in the big city of Cairo and it was perfect to get a rest two days at this hotel! -The location is very central but with a steep uphill, not so good for bad knees or hips.

title: Very romantic hotel at convenient location
review: A nice family hotel, with great home made food, very clean, personal es diligent,friendly and helpful,every visiting place and shoping is near.it was a very good stay we would like to come back some day

title: everything was good
review: To start with I would like to say that before booking our room I contacted hotel in order to clarify some questions regarding setup in the room. I’ve got reply immediately and moreover it was promised that specific room will be hold for us. Upon arrival everything was as promised. We were warmly met by hotel’s manager Ayhan and followed to our suite. Need to say that we together with my wife had a special occasion and wanted to get some romantic atmosphere. We’ve got it for full 100%! Very quite hotel, old styled, cozy, romantic. Staff every day was asking whether all good or some improvement required. Manager not sitting in his office, but always somewhere in the yard talking with guests - very personal attitude.  Now about location - it is also perfect. Very close to…

title: Great hospitality, friendly staff, high professional service.
review: very good hotel definitely recommended. walking distance to the old town. good spacious and clean rooms. ayhan and bulent thank you for your great service. and my special thanks to meryem, ali and ihsan (restaurant) I'll be back!

title: Wonderfull!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A Good Stay.
review: Excellent hotel - very friendly staff, clean and cosy room, nice balcony, wonderfull turkish bath! In walking distance for the most important touristic atractions. Also, the resturant with terase was amaising - excellent food and service! We will come again when in Istanbul for sure!

title: Recommended hotel near the main sights.
review: Great location, very courteous and helpful staff. Very clean and the restaurant is good too. Additionally the hotel itself is beautiful and cozy and the rooms also have the old ottoman vibe and all this is made special by a very reasonable price. All expected amenities are present for use.

title: Surely to come back for the third time!!!
review: The reception and staffing service were excellent.  We intended to eat at the attached restaurant on arrival and dine out on other evenings. In the event, we ate at the hotel every evening of our stay. It was that good. The surrounding streets are roughly cobbled and it's an uphill walk to the main street. Good to shed some calories gained in the restaurant though.

title: very good hotel
review: We stayed in this hotel already two times and it is really in a nice place, next to the historical part of Istanbul. The staff is really  friendly and  very helpful. Breakfast is good and we suggest to try also restaurant.

title: Holiday
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Cozy Place & Friendly Staff
review: Lovely hotel, in a very good location in the old city Relaxing gardeb.The staff was very helpfull and friendly. Restaurant was outstanding! Clean and comfortable. Will stay here again if i find myself in Istanbul

title: Holiday in Istanbul
review: We stayed for 2 nights. The room was clean and spacious. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The environment while having a breakfast was really stunning as the dining area have the the nice set up and under the big tree and open air.

title: An oasis of quietness and friendliness, right in the center of ancient Istanbul.
review: We have stayed in this Beautiful hotel for 7 days. We leave tomorrow. From the moment we walked through the door late in the evening we were warmly welcomed. From concern on how we had got from the airport and being over charged to organizing our transport to our next destination. We had postage done, laundry organized, bookings made, phone calls made. All done with extreme professionalism and never too much trouble. ALL staff are friendly accommodating and ready with a smile. We had room 311. Highly recommend it. Small balcony over looking the court yard. Very comfortable room, clean, serviced well daily.  There is also a restaurant attached. Don’t think you have to eat out every night. Would be sad to miss out on the wonderful food and attentive service.  Thankyou Rose Garden…

title: Amazing & Cozy Place with Amazing staff
review: The rooms are spacious, clean and have character. The green inner court is a lovely quiet place just to sit and relax or to enjoy a very good à la carte lunch or dinner from the restaurant. The breakfast also leaves nothing to be desired.  The staff of this memorable hotel is extremely friendly and will go the extra mile to make you feel welcome and, if reasonably possible, attent to your every wish.  My fiancee and I stayed here for a long weekend in september. We'd be happy to return here on our next visit to Istanbul.

title: Beautiful
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Very cute, nice staff
review: Hamida was very friendly and helpful. She made us feel at home. The hotel is extremely clean and our stay was very helpful. We had a beautiful garden and the food was great. The staff was friendly. We highly recommend, and we will definifely be returning.

title: Best suites in town
review: People who work the front desk are very nice and helpful. I would come back again the time I am here. The restaurant also has really good food with lots of choices. Plus, there were two cute cats that I liked a lot!

title: Thank you
review: We are still staying here wiht my cousin’s it’s very clean and nice decorations they a nice garden also wiht flowers and rose’s good breakfast in the garden wiht fresh air they have a restaurant also stuff are very friendly and helpfull recommended rose garden suites highly

title: Romantic hotel with comfortable location!
review: We totally fell in love with this beautiful and cosy hotel immediately. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful for example to tell traveling tips for Istanbul and just to chat with you. The atmosphere was peaceful, romantic and warm in the hotel and the room was so beatiful and clean! We would definitely recommend this hotel for everyone who will visit in Istanbul. The hotel is near to sights so that's why it's also perfect. Thank you Uncle Selcük!

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Fabulous, wonderful Staff
review: We stayed here for 6 nights whilst in Istanbul due to the strength of other reviews, and I will say they reviews are pretty spot on.  The hotel staff are very friendly and willing to help you out, although we felt that was the case for some more staff members than others. When we booked we were told we would get a free room upgrade however this didn't materialise, but not the end of the world.  The room we were given was on the top floor and was a standard double; it was spacious, bright and clean. It came with standard facilities (kettle, tv, safe, tea/coffee etc) however irons are borrowed from reception. The bed was a good size double and was comfortable, with good pillows but a very thin sheet style duvet. We had to ask reception for another as it was very thin and small for…

title: Decent room with good breakfast
review: Thank you Rose Garden for a wonderful stay. What really makes this place, is the position, the staff, and our rooms where beyond what we expected. We booked 3 nights for the start of our trip around Turkey then after experiencing the hotel we booked two more at the end before we flew out. The staff were amazing from the manager, the reservations manager who could not do enough to make our stay so enjoyable, the lovely lady that organised Istanbul tours and gave advice on all things Istanbul, the chap that saw to our bags would be an asset to any company he just never stopped working whether it was doing some maintenance, carry bags, helping out at breakfast ( wonderful) they need to look after him he is gold. 5 star service. Lots of restaurants within 100m.

title: Nice Stay
review: We booked Rose Garden Suites for its Ottoman interiors, and specifically booked their Superior Double room. However the room we got did not look like the photos for Superior Double room shown on the booking sites. Maybe they have many room designs under Superior, but it would have been good if they had showed the different photos so that travelers' expectations would be met. Overall, room was still comfortable with clean beds and spacious toilet. The aircon in our room was spewing ice at one point in time, but that was not an issue, only interesting to note. Breakfast was great with a lot of variety, one of the best breakfast we had. Note that there are no elevators in this hotel, but the staff helps with the luggages so i guess that's okay. location of the hotel is rather…

title: Excellent Stay
review: We stayed in Rose Garden Suites nearly for Six nights. The room was not that noisy during night time, but on Saturday in the middle of  night we heard loud conversation from window side. Otherwise it was quiet .The staff are very nice and friendly. Mr Selcuk was very kind  and easy to converstaion. Most of time we had contact with him during our day time. The kind lady at Guest Information Desk give us easy way to get at Maiden Tower ,which not only save our  money but also a very precious time. Whole staff of Rose Garden are nice and friendly . We tried Turkey famous breakfast called  Menemet at Galata Tower, but our Hotel breakfast is far better ,  Kitchen Staff are very nice . Our check out time was on 12pm but Mr Selcuk let us to stayed till 13.00  because of our flight .…

title: Excellent location, nice staff, comfortable
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: It is really nice place
review: Overall, I found the hotel a really nice place to stay. - Plenty of space in the room: king size bed, big bathroom, with a study to work (or study about the city). - Friendly staff: good advices, nice atention (including a cake at breakfast as a surprise for my wife for her birthday), many options for tours, among others. - Relatively low prices for a place located near the historic city center.

title: What a beautiful place to stay at
review: It is really nice place, people on reception are kind. It is only ~15 min from train station to hotel. The rooms are pretty nice, big and comfortable. There is a little fridge inside a room. In the bar you can find "Efes" Turkish beer and a lot of Turkish cuisine with a lot of meat inside. The breakfast is also good. The one thing that you can be alarmed with song from outside's mosque in the morning, but it is ok.

title: Great hotel with an excellent location
review: We went for our honeymoon and had a 1 week stay at the rose garden suites....  The check in went really smooth.  The staff was very helpful. Selcuk and Ercan were really kind to us and available 24.7 to answer any questions we had. They also arranged a boat tour for us on a very short notice for a really good price.  The location is excellent... All the touristy famous places are very close and can be covered by foot. Even the sea can be reached by foot (which is a must do for couples). The restaurant in the hotel is reasonably priced but in case you want to try something else.... There are many restaurants around. Everything is a short walk away.  The food served for the breakfast was excellent. Fresh meats and salads were served each day.  The room was beautiful ... Perfect…

title: Ross Garden House Istanbul
review: We spent a week at the Rose Garden House hotel. A great choice not only for its location close to the Hippodrome square, but for the comfort of the hotel room, good breakfast and great staff who could not do enough to make our stay a pleasant one. Spend time with Mrs Hamide Akmese who will assist you plan your time in Istanbul. Will stay here again on our next trip.

title: Excellent choice
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Lovely hotel in Old City
review: Excellent choice in Istanbul, near everything (provided you resist walking just two blocks up –really up- to get the Hippodrome square and all the best places to know in Istanbul). That is the only drawback, but it is the way the Sultanameth is. Good news is that the way back to the hotel is easier, just down. Rooms are clean and good, not too much spacious but enough, and it is supposed that you are not going to be too much time there. Gardens are nice to stay instead, in the bar or to take the excellent breakfast they serve, plenty of local stuff. Breakfast in the garden was simply wonderful. Coffee and mineral water are complimentary in the garden, and from all the places I knew in a long travelling time, they have the best wi-fi service I got in my room. I will return, for…

title: Nice room
review: We have just had 6 nights here- a small hotel in a great location we knew that,  but what an unexpected treat- we felt so comfortable and the staff were so helpful and friendly. The Turkish breakfast was great with a lovely outdoor area as well. The WiFi was good - very important!  The tram and Blue Mosque etc are all within a short walk through the old cobbled neighborhood  We only had a loose idea of what we wanted with our 9 days but Ayhan the Manager sat with us and planned out our priorities and even made bookings- awesome service. There is a  nice courtyard area for enjoying free tea, coffee or water 24/7 or just relaxing. There is no lift but Istanbul is quite hilly anyway so doesn’t really matter 😀.  100% great service. Thanks for everything!

title: A two night stay at this wonderful quaint place
review: It was great and very clean! The room big and the bathroom was like a sultan room. Very good services and the people very helpful. It was nice the place and was near hagia sofia and near tram station. Great great and great

title: Authentic and soulful place
review: The front facade of the property could be misleading. it's quite a big property and is very well furnished with modern amenities though the property is quite dated. Comfortable rooms, excellent service (always with a smile).. not crowded like other star hotels, a cozy restaurant - which may not have a wide spread but is tasty and the staff are friendly. The Rose Garden is very nicely located close to some of the biggest tourist attractions of istanbul - the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace amongst others.. A great place to enjoy and relax

title: Felt like at home
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice and comfortable room, friendly staff and great location.
review: I found this magnificent place via booking com almost 6 months ago based on following criteria: - Hotel has to be inside of the old city - It has to be affordable money wise - It has to be comfortable and cozy We were so glad to meet Aykhan - the best hotel managers I've ever seen who made our holidays so comfortable and positive. Later this year we missed our flight and had to stay in Istanbul for 3 days. I called Aykhan who immediately organized 2 rooms for us (though hotel was fully booked). My mom said: "I feel here like at home and I'm so glad to return here again". Do you know what is special about this hotel? Early morning. You can hear rooster crowing, feel fresh air in your room, breathe the smell of roses from the garden. You can eat a nice breakfast and enjoy the tea…

title: Pleasant Stay
review: We stayed for 7 nights and there are absolutely no complaints. The room was always clean with fresh towels, the bed was comfortable, air conditioning worked perfectly, breakfast is not the best I've had but still pretty good. The staff is really kind and helpful, always had good recommendations when we asked for it.

title: Very nice..
review: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in October and was really happy with the experience.    Location:  within walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace; in a quiet neighborhood and plenty of restaurants a few blocks away. Staff: staff were courteous and helpful. Facility: room very comfortable; lovely court yard (garden) and balcony view; good breakfast with adequate variety.  The hotel also provides airport shuttle services with good price -- 5 euro to IST.   We had a great time Istanbul and enjoyed our stay at Rose Garden.  Highly recommend it.

title: four night stay
review: The hotel is in the heart of old city. There was a small Turkish Bath instead of shower that is great. As I leared not all the rooms have this. We're lucky. Hagia Sofhia is only 500m away. Sultanahmet Mosque closer that Hagia Sophia. Very good location.

title: Historical Part of Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great hotel with character and a very hospitable staff
review: It was very nice room and space. The area is quite and very safe. Hotel is very close to Sultanahmet and other attraction. It is close to sea side too. The staff was very helpful and provide services with pleasure. The hotel has no elevator.

title: Tourism
review: There are several things about this hotel which are fantastic: firstly, it has a great 'Turkish' feel to it and the interior and ambiance is very modern, yet Ottoman-style. Secondly, the staff is very warm and welcoming and extremely helpful. Thirdly, the rooms and toilets are very clean and comfortable and that's a very important aspect when you're travelling to a place like Istanbul where you know you will be walking a lot. Finally, it's a ten-minute walk from the Blue Mosque and the main Sultanahmet square. We also found out that it's a fifteen-minute walk down south to the coast and the sunset there was absolutely beautiful, amidst the cool breeze and the hot Turkish tea. The breakfast was delicious and the veranda and seating area under an open sky is a nice little touch…

title: Great location and helpful hosts
review: Great Hotel. Great location and the most important the staff of the hotel is very polite and kindness, they will provide you with the all kind of information that any tourists are in needed. Breakfast is very delicious.Thank you very much.

title: Very good hotel and great hospitality
review: Loved this place!  Excellent hosts.  A convenient location and walking distance to many of he the key sites such as the Haggia Sophia.  The rooms.are very xlean and boast a funky ambience.  Highly recommended for your visit to Istanbul.

title: Great place to be. ...
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great location, clean and very comfortable
review: This hotel is the perfect place to stay in Istanbul. Is located in the heart of the city, close to everything. .....just 5 min walking to Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace or Hagia Sofia and max 15min to the famous Grand Bazaar.  The rooms are very clean and comfortable, mine was with balcony wich was amazing, very spacious, nice view to the garden and very quiet.  Very very friendly and helpful staff, they are doing their best to make your stay unforgettable. I highly recommend this hotel, i've stayed already 2 times here and for sure i will come back.  Beautiful place with beautiful people, Thank you.

title: just meet minimum standard
review: Rose Garden is good place to stay in for these reasons: 1. Location - situated near enough to walk to the Blue Mosque, Mosaik Museum, Haiga Sophia, Kucuk Sofya, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi, Carpet Museum, Islamic Civilastion Museum, Science Museum and the Garden.  If you love long walks (30-45 mins) you can walk to the Grand Bazaar where you can get better bargains and more voices for eateries. But if you like better bargains, take the tram near the Blue Mosque to the Spice Market. During Ramadan month, there's rows of little stalls (mini bazaars) set at the square. Plus shows and activities are set up for after breaking fast. Lots of nice eating places nearby the hotel. 2. Breakfast - a good spread of Turkish food. Lots of cheeses, bread, savoury and sweet stuff. Turkish tea and…

title: An affordable gem in Old Town Isanbul
review: the decoration in the room  was old. ceiling in the restroom have big water spot. AC sound was loud over the night make us can not sleep. and the reception trying push to sell overprice useless tour also was very rude.

title: A nice hotel
review: This hotel is perfectly situated near the Bue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and makes a great base for exploring Istanbul. The staff is attentive and friendly, ready to help with any request. The room we had was large enough for a bit to fit a third person. In the bathroom was a large stall shower had a rain head, marble-topped vanity and a bidet option on the toilet were all high quality. Breakfast was abundant and served in a sunny, pleasant patio or glassed in room. I will definitely return next time I visit Istanbul.

title: Rose Garden Suites
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great place in the heart of historical Istanbul. We really enjoyed our stay
review: The location of this hotel is perfect! it's in the centre of everything, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Galata Bridge, the Basilica Cistern are all on a walking distance. The hotel room I was in, had a balcony that looks out on the garden, which was a very pleasant view to wake up to. The staff of the hotel is very friendly and very helpful! Also don't miss out on the breakfast. Overall I had a very pleasant stay, and I would highly recommend it.

title: People who will care for you!
review: Me and my wife have made a booking of Superior Double Room with Balcony but were upgraded to spacious Suite with extra comfortable bed, luxury furniture and sitting area and two balconies. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel is clean, very calm, located in narrow street just few hundred meters from Blue Mosque and other historical places around Sultanahmed area. Hotel occupies beautifully renovated traditional wooden house. Garden that connects two main buildings and restaurant is also worth to mention. So far best accommodation for someone who visits the city quite often.

title: Beautiful and Quiet Place and Excellent service
review: The staff of the Rose Garden Hotel go above and beyond for you. All you have to do is ask. Their service is the best! Our room was quaint and period for a building having been built in 1897. Very comfortable and a nice breakfast. I will miss staying there.

title: Excellent service, attentive staff!
review: We stayed in the hotel for approximately a week.This hotel has the Turkish national style. The hotel is situated at the historical center of the city. It is located at the quiet spot, but at the same time from the hotel to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, The Basilica Cistern nd Top kapi not more than 10 minutes by walk.

title: Great staff, super comfy bed!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Beautiful and Quiet Place to Stay
review: I travel to Istanbul regularly where I spend 24 hours on the outbound journey as a layover. This is the fifth or sixth hotel I have stayed in here. Whilst everywhere I have stayed the staff have been friendly they were especially so here. The rooms are very clean and the beds are super comfy - great pillows too. The courtyard and restaurant areas are also very pleasant. I will be back.

title: Excellent
review: We stayed in the hotel for approximately a week, where we checked out to go to Cappadocia then returned to the same hotel on our return.  The first room we stayed in was small but comfortable.  It had a beautiful street view where one can see the surroundings.  The room was a little dated but still beautiful and clean.  Upon returning, the hotel management upgraded us to the newly renovated rooms which were larger and more modernized.  This room was even more comfortable than the first.  Once you walk into the rooms there is a distinct smell of roses that fills the room.  Even the bathrobes and towels have this beautiful smell.  The room came with breakfast.  The food was tasty but the downside was that there were many flies.  There was a large selection of items that you may…

title: Three days of hospitality
review: Everything was amazing .   Right location ever near everything you need.  The hotel rooms was very clean and quite , food was soo delicious the communication was perfectly done  Right advisor who's suggest for us the right places in the right weather , although the trip was short but the advisor's places recommendation  make our awesome trip , somehow we see many sides of Istanbul . "Really . Thanks hamida"    I would recommend for any body even though family trip for this excellent hotel .

title: Very good indeed
review: I'm glad we picked Rose Garden Suites for our trip to Istanbul. It actually was everything the pics depict, and some more. Room was nice and cozy and the bathroom area was quite spacious and well equipped.   Hamida in guest relations was a treat. She helped clarify any doubts we had regarding our visits to main tourist attractions. Also Selcuck (apologies if I'm not taking the right name) suggested the right Bosphorous tour, and ensured we did it under right weather conditions. That made all the difference.  I would surely recommend this place, not only for room/amenities/location but the amazing people and helpful staff.

title: It feels like home
review: I've spent lovely days in Istanbul at Garden House hotel, it has a good location near Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet, the room is very clean and the breakfast is very good. Staff are kind and very helpful, especially Mr. Bùlent who was always smiling :)

title: really nice place and staff
review: IT FEELS LIKE HOME The hotel is on great location in nice pieceful neighbourhood and again just 5-10 min walking to Sultanahmet and Aja Sofia. The room was very large confertable and clean and we had blast drinking Turkish coffee in our balcony with the view of the garden. Excellent Ottoman style hotel. The breakfast was great with a big choice of food fresh veggies and fruits. 10+ for all the stuff very friendly people who made us felt like home. Very warm ambiance and special thanks to all the management there especially Mr Selcuk and Mr Murat who always welcome us with smile organizing some activities for us and guide us how easily to find the way to some locations that we wanted to visit. And big big thanks to Mr Kemal who always had smile for us and served us fresh Turkish…

title: Great hotel and staff
review: Really nice hotel and great location , I do recommand this place , quiet and the staff was great with me. Free breakfast and the staff provide some good info to visit the city ,like restaurant. love it I do it again if I can

title: AMAZING
review: Lovely hotel with clean and spacious rooms. Breakfast was delicious with a wide range of options to choose from. Good location, within close proximity to public transport and major monuments. Staff (and particularly the owner) were especially helpful - assisting us in planning our trip and arranging transportation to the airport. Overall, we had a great time and couldn't have asked for anything more from the hotel service (5*)

title: realy very enjoy and we like your hotel very much as well as stile also.

title: short visit in Istanbul
review: very excellent hotel and we advice all the people to stay at your hotel and already we send some of our friend there. we like this hotel , location , quite , near by to the mosque , bazar , and station metro , very famous

title: A special place to stay
review: Room location is good .Environment & hospitality is good. we had a lovely time. Nice clean room good breakfast choice. Nice shower clean sheets and spacious room.We  and our collique stayed here for 2 nights, the rooms are fabulous, the first room we had was facing the street so next morning we were moved to a top floor suite overlooking the garden. We has two sofa, comfortable bath with showers, flat screen TVs,very reasonable prices,large bed,tea coffee facilities, in the garden room was free tea, coffee, 24 hrs in the afternoon until 5 pm, fruit juice,and cakes, breakfast was included, very substantial,hot and cold selection,plenty of fruit and cereals, cold cuts and what have you.. Would fully recommend this hotel for facilities, friendly staff, very local for Sultamet Squa…

title: Lovely stay
review: We have stayed many times in Istanbul at different hotels and this was by far our favorite! Warm welcoming staff even at 1 am when we arrived. Lovely Turkish breakfast buffet in the morning. A very comfortable bed and, the best part of our stay, the bathroom! Our own mini-hamam in beautiful marble. What a treat to come back to that after a hard day of being a tourist! The extra treat was the litter of kittens playing on the grounds - so adorable! It is a long steep hill to hike up to the main tourist sites, but at least it is downhill coming home!

title: Midweek break
review: Stayed here with my partner and we had a lovely time. Nice clean room good breakfast choice. Nice shower clean sheets and spacious room. Would of been nice to have a balcony room but that's ok. Nice toiletries given as you come in and also free water from fridge downstairs whenever you like. Situated in a good location. We down our anniversary out there.  Would of been nice of hotel to do something special as my partner had told them that we were out to celebrate our special day. That was the only downside otherwise we had a lovely stay and staff are very friendly. 4 stars

title: The best Hotel i have ever been

title: Excellent Location and Good Value
review: I have been so many hotels around the world.But Rose Garden Suite welcome us so friendly .The Rose Garden is situated near the most attractive sightseeing , it takes so less time to reach the most well known destination.I highly recommend this hotel to everybody

title: Excellent hotel in great location with friendly staff
review: The hotel was well placed but we arrived late evening so it was a little difficult to orientate ourselves for our first walk to the sights.  That said, once we had worked out routes and destinations, the location was perfect. On the advice of the manager, Mr Selchuk (phonetic spelling) we stayed in the executive suite which had a spa bath which was very useful after a day of walking.  The staff were wonderfully helpful and we were lent a travel card which we topped up and used frequently on the trams.  Breakfast was plentiful with Hummus, Meats, Fruit, Cereal and Bread and an omelette made to order if required.  The bed was comfortable and the room safe large enough to hold a full-size laptop and my wife's (large) handbag.  We had a good discussion with the assistant manager…

title: Excellent service & great place to stay
review: Only stayed one night but we were very happy with facilities and staff in the hotel. The lack of a lift currently (one is planned in the near future) is not such a problem  as the staff are happy to carry all luggage up and down the stairs. Our booking included breakfast which was excellent. Hotel is close to many attractions but slightly away from the really touristy areas which provided a nice mixture of locals and tourists. Highly recommended.

title: Great hotel in a great location
review: We stayed at the hotel during the coup in Turkey this summer and cannot tell you how the staff made sure our stay was not only comfortable but also helped us figure out our flights out of Turkey. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay close to Blue Mosque area.

title: Friendly service and Relaxing place
