title: Mr.
review: i stayed in this hotel for three days. It is located just three minutes walking distance to Sultanahmet Square. Breakfast is not spectacular but it is enough for money that you paid. There was no elevator in the hotel but if you would like to change your room with lower floors, staff will be helping you. Rooms are big compared to other hotels in this area. Because of the structure of hotel, staffs are not like an employee. They more like a holiday friend for you. There is a huge garden for relaxing in the morning. And also a lot of kittens that always want to feeding by you :)

title: Cozy, beautiful hotel with a warm turkish heart
review: Very nice cozy and calm hotel. No facilities but in general very nice and very good location. Nice rooms and very comfortable bed. The breakfast also is good but not too much selections. In general very nice

title: Rose Garden is A Gem
review: Cozy, beautiful hotel with a warm turkish heart. In snowy Istanbul, Rose Garden suites was a beautiful, warm haven. The staff were really helpful with planning our outings in Istanbul. We also learnt a bit of recent history of Turkey from the staff. The room was small, quaint, warm and had a lot of Turkish character to it. The room also had a small balcony to view the dining area, garden and the entrance. There was noise due to expansion work of Rose Garden when we had visited the hotel, but should be resolved now. The owner was very nice and also explained to us why turkish coffee is different & so special. The food (breakfast-complimentary) was really homely and adequate. The approach to the Hotel maybe a concern especially when it snows or has snowed as it is at the end of a…

title: Fantastic hotel
review: During a recent trip to Istanbul, my boyfriend and I stayed at the Rose Garden Suites. It is conveniently located in Sultanamet, a short distance from the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, and the Hagia Sophia. The hosts are very friendly and helpful. When we arrived at the hotel, they were very responsive to our questions and assisted us with our luggages. They provided us with various resources to help us navigate the area. The hotel is very quaint and cozy. The walk way to the rooms  is very lovely and scenic. Our room was on the top floor. It was beautifully laid out. The room was large and comfortable. When you walk in there is a desk and a closet to the right. The bathroom is to the left and features a deep jacuzzi and an interesting window with blinds that looks out into the…

title: Charming hotel in the middle of the old city
review: the best i advise this hotel to who looks for best service rooms are charming and well decorated beautifull gardens staff are gentel and ready to help hotel near to city center i will be there next year

title: Lovely Staff
review: I stayed here two nights with my son before starting a cruise that left from Istanbul.  The rooms were beautifully decorated and there was a pretty outside patio.  There was a great Turkish breakfast that came with the price of the hotel.  The staff were very friendly and helped us pick out what excursions to do while we were there.  In addition, the hotel is located walking distance from many of the old city attractions.  My only complaint was the wifi could be spotty at times.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic place
review: We stayed here for 2 nights. The best thing about this place are the staff. They are very accommodating, friendly and attentive to our needs. The hotel itself is clean and well maintained. It is located within walking distance to the major sights. Highly recommended!

title: Great location!
review: The hotel has a really good location, you can reach the city center in a few minutes. And the hotel is so good for the people who looking for a place to sleep in silence. All the staff was very helpfull and friendly. If you think visiting Istanbul this hotel is one of the best options.

title: Rose garden hotel
review: Pleasant staff, clean, tasteful room with a jacuzzi bath, air conditioning, quiet, located in the historic area of the city close to the Haiga Sofia, shops and restaurants. Plus a quality breakfast buffet was included in the price of the rooms. Excellent value. Highly recommended.

title: Pleasant stay
review: Dear guest, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: Fantastic place!
review: Our stay was a memorable one couldnt fault anything the staff was so helpful and friendly. Our room was pristine everyday would defintely stay there again 5 mins to the blue mosque and all the tourist attractions and tramway on the doorstep we loved the rosegarden

title: Fine place
review: Dear Tina, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. It is so nice to know that you were so satisfied with our staff and service. Hope to see you again...  Best regards,

title: Retreat
review: Not for those who cannot climb stairs.  BUT:  very comfortable hotel, well-situated for sight-seeing and cafes / restaurants.  Varied and well-provisioned breakfast, with warm welcome and smile from Nino each morning.  We missed her on her day off. Very friendly, helpful staff, who helped make our first trip to Turkey very memorable.   Cleanliness gets only 4 stars as our private terrace was unsunny and unloved.  Otherwise, no faults. Sheena & Kevin

title: Very nice experience in Rose garden!
review: Dear Sheena and Kevin, thank you so much for sharing your review about us. We are glad to see that you enyojed your stay in our property. Also, it's so nice to know that you are so satisfied with our staff. However we feel sorry that you are not exactly satisfied with the cleanliness and the terrace. Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: Perfection! Fantastic city, Brilliant accommodation, ideal location
review: This hotel is in a great location, walking distance to all the major historic attractions of the fabulous city of Istanbul. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and well furnished. The staff were very pleasant, the hotel provided free cake, tea, coffee, water and juices every afternoon which was much appreciated after the treading the hot streets of Istanbul.

title: Streets of istanbul
review: Dear guest, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: Friendly service, good value, well located
review: I stayed in Rose Garden Suites hotel for 4 days with my wife.  The room was nice and big with an impressive huge bed traditional style. You had to climb a couple of steps to get into the bed. The toilet was made of marble and it also worked as a hamam!  The hotel rooms were located around a garden where you could also enjoy a nice romantic dinner (we did it once).  Breakfast was excellent.  The location of the hotel was great / walking distance from many points of interest.  Overall it was a great stay.

title: Just a gem.
review: We arrived for an extended weekend at eight in the morning after an overnight flight. All we wanted was breakfast and a place to rest. We had prepared ourself for some sort of negotiation. After a quick check in it all came through. We were offered our room and a great breakfast thereafter. By 9.30 a.m we were resting i our beds. No charges were ever asked. The service continued accordingly throughout the extended weekend.  Basically; a comfortable place, clean, very well located, good value, with the best service

title: Excellent hotel in Istanbul
review: Dear guest, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: Comfortable, clean, well located
review: We arrived in Istanbul at a time of warnings but immediately felt welcome and relaxed at the Rose Garden. Our room was great and the hotel is perfectly situated close to Sultanahmet and the Blue Mosque.  We enjoyed eating dinners in the courtyard  looked after and entertained by Yasar, while breakfasts in the restaurant were excellent, with welcoming service by Nino. They both made our stay so enjoyable.  There's nothing not to like about the Rose Garden and we won't be looking anywhere else next time we're in wonderful Istanbul.

title: A quiet hotel close to the blue mosque

title: Nice room and friendly staffs
review: We stayed here on a long weekend visit.  The staff were very helpful they sorted a minor issue with our room quickly and efficiently, and the reception staff were very helpful when we had queries about getting around.  The room was comfortable, spacious and quiet which was fantastic. There are a lot of steps in the hotel so if you have mobility issues I would recommend you advise them of this in your booking so that they can provide an accessible room for you.  The hotel is located fairly centrally so it was easy to walk to all the sights around the blue mosque easily. It is an uphill walk into the sights but its not far at all.

title: It was a great hotel. Good breakfast and friendly staff/personnel. Hotel is in the neighborhood (in walking distance) of
review: Dear Helen, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. It's so nice to see that you were satisfied with our staff and we are so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: Rose Garden is the place to be!!
review: The garden is really beautiful and the room is really cozy. I really enjoyed that big bed and the decorations. The hotel is convenient and locates near most of the places I would like to visit.   The service is perfect. They helped me a lot in transferring and introduced where I can visit in Istanbul.   However, the hair dryer was not that good and the wifi sometimes was not connecting in the first floor.

title: Excellent place
review: Dear Yining, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are happy to see that you enjoyed with our hotel and service. However we feel sorry for the wifi and hair dryer. Hope to see you again...  Best regards,

title: Wonderful!!!

title: I couldn't have chosen a more peaceful environment to stay.  3 day 2 night getaway and this hotel was the perfect choice
review: My husband and I stayed at the Rose Garden Suites for three nights. The front desk staff was warm and welcoming, and were a great source to go to as far as booking tours for Istanbul. We had a standard king bed room on the first floor. The rooms are so cute and quaint! The property itself is picturesque-almost like a secret garden in the middle of a busy city. The breakfast was so delicious with many options to choose from, and the staff were so kind. Everyone speaks English, which is helpful. The location of the hotel was a five minute walk to the Hagia Sophia and close to other places. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family, and would definitely stay here again if I should find myself in Istanbul once more.

title: Good location and super breakfast
review: Dear Kate, thank you so much for your wonderful review about our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. It is so nice to know that you were satisfied with our staff and service. Thank you for recommending us. Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: Rose Garden Suites - no. 1 best value for money hotel
review: The room was superb, outstanding breakfast and Mr Yasar Kartal was amazing with his guitar routine.  Esra and her staff were extremely professional  and accommodating.  I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples that just want a quiet romantic environment to relax away from the noise of downtown.  Two thumbs up!!!

title: A lovely hotel with a gracious staff
review: Dear Anthony, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Many thanks for your great words about our staff and service. We would like to welcome you again :)  Best regards,

title: Fab place to stay in the centre of Sultanahmet!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Quiet oasis in Sultanahmet
review: We were very impressed with Rose Garden House! We were picked up on time from the airport which was really convenient as we'd never been to Istanbul before! Staff are so friendly and helpful, the bed was made and towels changed every day. The room was the perfect size for 2 of us and had a little mini bar with snacks costing extra if you wanted. Free tea, coffee, water and snacks in the lounge area every day. Reception is manned 24 hours a day and feels extremely safe. Plenty of choice at breakfast with lots of different juices to choose from! The hotel was lovely and warm but not stifling like some places cam be. Only a 5 minute walk from the main area of Sultanahmet, Rose Garden House is a little gem tucked in the corner if Istanbul!

title: Perfect hotel with great prices and wonderful staff
review: Dear Emma, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. It's so nice to know that you were satisfied with our staff and service.  Hope to welcome you again...

title: Great hotel with very friendly staff
review: The Rose Garden was the perfect place for our short stay in Istanbul. The most popular sites in Sultanahmet are within easy walking distance, while the hotel itself was on a quiet side street a block from the "Little Hagia Sofya" mosque. The staff made us feel at home right away, and everyone was very helpful. We had 4 rooms in total, and though they were each a little different, they were all very nice. The rooms on the first floor had less natural light, as you would expect, but one had a lovely view into the interior courtyard/rose garden. The room on the 3rd floor was a bit more spacious and also had a courtyard view (which I recommend), and our 'penthouse suite' had a view over neighboring buildings to the water. All of our rooms were in the newer building, so I can't speak…

title: Great location, great value for money, friendly staff
review: Dear Robin, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. It is so nice to know that you were satisfied with our staff and service. Thank you so much for recommending us.  Best regards,

title: Great place for a romantic trip
review: I only stayed for two days and one night. But the place is so cute and cozy. I love my room too:) the staff were very helpful and super friendly. Would definitely recommend:) it is a walking distance to the most famous Blue mosque and hagia sophia and it is also close to the tram station:)

title: Friendly staff, clean and cozy.
review: Dear Willow, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks for recommending us:) Hope to welcome you again ...  Kindest regards,

title: A pearl in the old city
review: Very nice personnel, welcoming and easy to talk to. I had an special request for my wife's birthday and they delivered in better than expected. Thank you very much to all at the rose gardens for making our trip to Istanbul magnificence.

title: Unbelievable
review: Hotel located near the historic city center. Very nice place in a quiet area of Sultanahmet  within 5-7 minutes walking distance to the Blue Mosque. Standard continental breakfast. Housekeeping daily. The bathroom has all the necessary hygiene items. The rooms have heating and air conditioning. Good design rooms. The hotel staff is friendly and always willing to help with any questions.

review: Hotel is fabulous staff very kind and professional location is exactly what I expected thanks for every one for sure I'll be back many times. One more thanks a lot to cooperation of hospitality industry.

title: Highly recommend
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice Stay...!!
review: What a lovely, clean and comfortable place a stones throw away from the blue mosque and all the bazaars and attractions Istanbul has to offer. Welcoming staff, highly attentive on making your stay as pleasurable as possible. The room was beautiful, massive bed, lovely linen and heated bathroom floors, just the most conform able room I have ever stayed in. Can't fault it and would love to return one day

title: Great location, great value for money!
review: Dear Rebecca, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best regards,

title: Rose Garden at Istanbul!
review: It was a very pleasant stay at Rose Garden. The staff were very helpful, has got a nice restaurant. We checked in early around 9 in the morning with no issues. The rooms are very beautiful, with turkish touch. We had a queen room, but the queen bed decoration was missing.

title: Homelike!
review: Dear guest, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: All Expectations exceeded
review: We stayed for 4 nights the end of October-early November. They were wonderful hosts, the breakfast will keep you full till lunchtime. Directions, bookings, suggestions and advise all come part of the deal. We chose here because of the reviews here and they are all correct. Price is very fair, rooms are great, location is very nice and safe. Take concierge's advice on restaurants and bars, they know everywhere you want. Will be back here the next time we come to the eternal city.

title: Impressive Weekend
review: I was looking for a place close to Haya Sofia and found this place and was i surprised by the beauty and service of this Hotel from Housekeeping ,front office maintenance and everyone ,i will definitely go again

title: Romantic hotel right in the heart of Istanbul
review: Dear Nazmey, thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again next time...  Best regards,

title: Istanbul Fall 2015
review: we were looking for a nice beautiful Hotel close to the Hagia Sophia, the blue mosque and the big basar. we found something perfect in the Hotel Rose Garden. We found a beautifull room, termenduosly friendly and helpfull staff and a very good breakfast buffet. we will come back. for sure.

title: Istanbul holiday
review: The best thing about Rose Garden Suites is the location. It is just few minutes walking distance from the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Staff has a great knowlegde about the area. Thanks to them fot their suggestions. Especially for the Bosphorus Tour! It was great! We will definetly visit once again.

title: Wonderful service and rooms
review: Dear guest, Thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best regards,

title: Very charming
review: I'm a student from london, i have stayed in rose garden suites for 3 days. The hotel is very close to sultanahmet. The rooms are quite large and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed turkish breakfast and the free offerings at the hotel. It was an amazing experience for me, and i'm glad i chose this very hotel. I advise rose garden to anyone asking for a place in istanbul.

title: A very good experience in a city with lots of choice,
review: Dear Ezgi, Thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for recommending us. Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best regards,

title: Great place in the old Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Luxury hotel
review: Rosen Garden Suites is just about a 5 minutes walk away from Blue Mosque. And the Blue is next to Hagia Sophia and Topkapi. To the Grand Bazaar about 15 minutes walk along the tramway-route. Down to the seaside not even 5 minutes walk. So the location is excellent. Lots of Restaurants & Cafes in that area. Virtually every few meters you can stop for tea & wine & dine.  The Rosen Garden Suites are at a narrow street with little traffic. If you book a room with balcony facing the inner courtyard you have the feeling of living in a private mansion. The balcony room we stayed in was well appointed, cozy & spacious.   The breakfast buffet is very oppulent with a variety of food hard too match. From muesli to cheese & sausages and many turkish delights. Eggs to order as fried,…

title: Excellent B&B style
review: We stayed two nights in this charming hotel. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was excellent. The hotel is located in the middle of the old city and walking distance from the touristic attractions. Reception and guest relations staff is so professional and they have a great knowledge about the city. They are always happy to give their suggestions. We will definetly stay in Rose Garden Suites again.

title: CENTRALLY LOCATED HOTEL
review: Dear Korhan, Thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay in our hotel. It is so nice to know that  you are exactly satisfied with us.  Hope to see you again...  Best regards,

title: Hotel in center of Istanbul, good value for money
review: This is a very quaint and nice hotel in the old city. The staff are very helpful and attentive to guests needs. My room was extra clean and had a bathroom literally half the size of the room.  Breakfast was very nice and contained a variety of items including fresh pots of coffee and tea, fresh vegetables, cheeses, olives, pastries and eggs made to order in a station right outside the restaurant. My only issue was the terrible WiFi connection in the building I lodged in. The staff promised to relocate me to another room but I didn't have to move my stuff as I only stayed there for a couple of nights.  If you don't mind walking up and down the streets of the old city, I highly recommend this place. Just bear in mind that the location of this hotel is somewhat difficult for taxi…

title: The world is a Rose ... smell it and pass it to your friends!
review: very clean! tasty food and verity sorts! close to main sights by walking! great bathroom they have turkey bath! lovely people ! nice view for the breakfast! very helpful and good location for main sights.

title: My favourite hotel in Istanbul!
review: Dear Jasmien, Thank you so much. We are so  happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: Exceeded All Expectations
review: We chose this Hotel based on the positive reviews on Tripadvisor and once again we were glad we made the right choice. The Hotel is very comfortable and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Some who deserve a special mention are Esra, Yusuf and Denniz. The restaurant staff are also good and the breakfast buffet spread has some amazing variety.  We had 2 rooms for 3 nights. They made a few special adjustments for us like an extended checkout on the last day. The rooms in the new wing behind with the balconies are lovely. The rooms in the older building have Turkish Hamam type bathrooms.  This Hotel is in Sultan Ahmet which is close to the main tourist attractions like Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern and Islamic Arts Museum / Archaelogy Museums.…

title: Excellence location but that's about it.
review: Dear Mubaraka, Thank you so much for your great review about us. We are so happy to see that you enjoyed your stay in our hotel. Thank you for recommending us. Hope to welcome you again...  Best regards,

title: Very enjoyable stay
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: An Excellent Stay. What a fantastic hotel!!
review: Best part of Rose Garden Suites is the staff. They are incredibly helpful. They spent lots of time with us regarding sightseeing, getting around in Istanbul, transportation to/from the airport - and anything else we needed. Everyone from restaurant staff to front desk, to guest relations, to housekeeping, to staff who helped with baggage were delightful.  Location is great too. Right in Sultanahmet. Minutes to Topkapki, Blue Mosque, Roman Cisterns, etc.  We stayed twice. There was no elevator in our section - not sure about other parts of the hotel - so be sure to ask, if that's an issue for you.

title: Extraodinary
review: Dear Maureen,  Thank you so much for taking time to review our property.  It is so nice to see that you were satisfied with us.  Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best wishes,

title: Over ALL a GOOD Hotel to Stay!! - Please review my comments before making your decision
review: Rose Garden/Garden House is fabulous hotel. We could not have had a better week in Istanbul. The staff are very attentive and take care of every detail. The breakfast is abundant -enough to keep you going for the day- and well presented. It is very tasty -a full selection of both Turkish and standard continental breakfast all freshly prepared-. At around 3pm, tea, coffee and cake is available -for free- in the beautiful garden. The rooms are spacious, well kept and tidy all the time. We have been very well looked after all week, both individually and as a couple. We travelled to Istanbul to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary and the birthday of one of us. To our surprise, the birthday person received a gift from the hotel on his actual birthday. This has been such a lovely…

title: Quiet, clean, comfortable luxury in Old Istanbul
review: Dear Andrew and Mario,  Thank you so much for your taking time to review our property.  We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best wishes,

title: Lovely Hotel, Great Staff and Best Bed
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: BAD Experience
review: We stayed six nights in an Executive Suite at the Rose Garden at the end of our four week holiday in Turkey.  The room was large with sitting area and a good sized bathroom.  It was very clean and had good wifi. The bed was the most comfortable bed that we had slept in during our stay in Turkey.  The hotel is located in a quiet part of Sultanahmet with many local shops and cafes/restaurants nearby.  Our room faced the street and it was a little noisy with traffic noise the first night but we got use to it. We found it convenient to the main sights, etc.  All staff including the breakfast and cleaning ladies, were very friendly.  Deniz, Hotel Manager, stopped for a chat at breakfast most days to ask how our stay was going, what we were planning for the day, making suggestions.…

title: Great staff, good location
review: My daughter made the reservation here for two rooms because she stayed here last year. She made the reservation online for the exact room she had in her prior visit and another just like it. However, when we arrived early evening, we were shocked at the rooms we were given. Mine was on the first floor just off of the dining area/bar with only sheer curtains on the windows. With a light on there was absolutely no privacy. There was peeling damp in the bathroom and smelled musty. To turn on the air conditioning, I had to go to the reception area and ask them to turn it on. In the middle of the night, I was freezing so I had to go to the reception area in my pajamas to ask them to turn it off.  My daughter's room was on the second floor and did not have a balcony which was in the…

title: Impressive location and hotel.
review: We stayed here for 5 nights during our trip to Turkey. Right at the outset I must say that the staff at this place were among the most warm and friendly that we've come across at any hotel, which probably lifted our experience a couple of notches. They were always helpful when it came to anything about Istanbul and were genuinely concerned when our 1yr old fell sick. The location is very good, close to Sultanahmet square but it is a reasonably steep uphill walk, so might not be the best for travelers with mobility concerns. However, the location is very peaceful at most times in the day and there were never any noises to bother us. We stayed in a room at the bottom of a flight of stairs (again maybe a concern to some) but we didn't mind the climb. The room was quite comfortable…

title: Pleasant stay in Sultanahmet
review: Stayed here last week for 4 nights, loved the room which was very clean and fantastic décor. Breakfast was a feast. The location is perfect but as mentioned there is a steep hill to get past to the attractions every day.

title: Good Hotel
review: Fantastic staff.  Lovely room.  We highly recommend Hotel is very conveniently located My only caveat is that there are a lot of steps and no lifts.  So if you have mobility problems you might want to request a ground floor(although that won't completely eliminate steps ).

title: Very enjoyable stay
review: In general a good hotel, good breakfast, location and service,  Our room was very standard and small not according to the price.Many Restaurants near by .The staff was very kind and smiley.i would  recommend this hotel.

title: A serene space
review: Dear guest, Thank you so much for your kind review about us. We are so glad that you were satisfied with our staff and servıce. Hope to welcome you again...  Best wishes,

title: Peaceful, elegant hotel in the Old City of Istanbul
review: I recently stayed with a friend for 3 nights in October. The hotel is well located in the old city, walking distance to the main sights and plenty of restaurant options nearby.  The hotel is on a hill which was fine for us but may be an issue for those with walking difficulties. The room was very well presented and clean - we had an issue with flies in the room which the hotel quickly sorted.  We also needed an extra bed adding which they did quickly and efficiently. The staff were friendly and helpful, the service excellent and the breakfast was good and varied.  I would recommend.

title: Beautiful hotel near Sultanahmet

title: Delightful and peaceful, but close to Sultanahmet
review: We stayed 4 days in this romantic hotel. Well maintained room , nice and attentive staff, delicious breakfest and great surroundings near the hotel......Sultanahmet square, Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar a few minutes walk...  I can recommend

title: Hotel Said They are Overbooked after Prepaying For Stay (Really!)
review: Location. The suites are tucked away down the hill from the Obelisk and Blue Mosque with the Grand Bazaar just up the road within walking distance. If you are saving your legs for the Bazaar, you can walk up to the Cemberlitas tram station and take a tram one stop west. There are plenty of sites and food outlets in the area to meet most tastes or you can eat at the hotel or order in. The area is pleasantly quiet and we did not have any noise during our stay.  Warning I would not recommend this hotel if you have difficulty with hills, since the inclined walk up the hill to the Blue Mosque Square or the tram station is quite steep. The walk in itself is a great way to walk off the excellent breakfast provided by the hotel, but whilst I think I could probably manage pushing a wheel…

title: traditional queen room. great staff, clean hotel, unique design
review: We booked this hotel through Orbitz after reading great reviews, and prepaid for our stay. As we showed up on our cab they told us they are overbooked, how can that be when we prepaid on a non-refundable rate. They took us to what they called their "sister hotel" which was more like a hostel (no name on the door of the hotel), not the same quality or amenities as we prepaid with Orbitz. When we complained to Orbitz, they said they were "sorry" and will give a $25 voucher for a future stay and apply for the refund after 5-6 weeks. This is highly unethical. Please be careful. Please email/call hotel prior to your stay when booking with Orbitz/Rose Garden

title: Best Hospitality Experience in a Long Time - Great Stay at Istanbul
review: i stayed two days during last august in the traditional queen room. the hotel is clean, unique design, helpfull staff, good brekfast. the trditional queen room is impressive and the bed was big and comfortable. the location is nearby the major attractions in sultanahmet. but the road to the hotel is very steep. i would highly recommand this hotel.

title: 10 Minutes From The Sites!

title: Excellent stay, central, calm and comfortable
review: We stayed in the Rose Garden Suites which is a part of Rose Garden House/Hotel for 5 full days in September. Firstly its location is ideal if not perfect for the old part of the city. A short walk up a hill behind the old remains/back wall of the Hippodrome (think Chariot Racing) brings you into Sultanahmet Square from which the Blue Mosque, Haige Sophia and the Basilica Cistern are only feet away. There are also many gift shops and places to eat around the Hotel/Suites as well.   The Suites are separated from the Hotel by a very nice courtyard, the breakfast room and a flight of steps. We found the courtyard (which is where you eat in the evening if you decide to eat at the hotel) was a wonderful place to relax after a day of sightseeing. On a couple of evenings one of the…

title: Best Hotel in the Old City
review: Dear guest, Thank you so much for your excellent review.  We are so happy that you were satisfied with our hotel. Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best wishes

title: Great stay in Istanbul
review: The room was located in a very calm patio and arranged nicely, with wooden features as well as with a traditional turkish Hamam bath. The staff was very kind at all times - as we had never been to Istanbul before, we were even given a very helpful map with some insights to the city.  The room included a comfortable bed and a large bathroom. As one or two features in the room did show some signs of use, extremely tidy persons might consider booking a suite rather than an usual room, but it met our expectations perfectly.  The location is very central as well without beeing to busy or even to loud during nighttime - we were able to get to the Blue Mosque within minutes by foot.   The various breakfast is definetly mentionable - it contained all kinds of traditional Turkish food as…

title: Perfect boutique hotel
review: This was the best hotel in the old city (we stayed at Sokullu Pasa next door as well upon returning from Cappadocia).  The breakfast was excellent, the rooms are spacious, and the gardens are really nice to sit and relax.  Definitely a good location that is only 5 minutes walking from all the main sites (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc).

title: Would do it again

title: Great hotel, great staff.
review: It was a great stay, friendly warm welcoming staff, amazing place to rest, food was tasty, specially the breakfast Also it was 10 minutes far walking from Sultanahmet tram station and Sultanahmet part.

title: Pleasant stay
review: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The staff were very friendly and eager to help. Yusuf at the front desk was always happy to help us. Whenever we asked him for advice on which places to visit he was always helpful. The room we stayed in was very nice and was regularly cleaned.  The hotel location is ideal as it is walking distance to local attractions. The hotel had everything we wanted at a reasonable price. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Lovely lovely Boutique Hotel!
review: Dear Guest,   thank you very much for posting your comments.We are happy to read that everything was at your satisfaction and that you enjoyed your stay in our hotel Rose Garden House.Looking forward to welcome you again,next time you visit İstanbul.   Best Regards,   Guest Relations

title: High Praise for the Rose Garden House
review: 2 night in Rose Garden,  Service was amazing, we needed a taxi/shuttle and a early breakfast (4 am) because we had to head early to the airport and they helped us with what we asked. Breakfast is great, diverse food. Location is good- 4 mins  walk from the blue mosque.  Recommend!

title: haven of peace
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Well placed, really friendly hotel with excellent staff
review: We had the pleasure of returning to the Rose Garden after a first stay one year ago. In fact one of the reasons for our returning to central Istanbul (we have visited here many times) was the prospect of spending a few days in the seclusion of this remarkable hotel. This is definitely a quiet oasis, just a few minutes walk away from all the major sights of the Old City, and in the midst of a very hot summer this is invaluable. We have stayed in many hotels in Istanbul but the Rose Garden is our favorite - the central garden courtyard is refreshing, where golden-furred cats bask in the shade of rose bushes, the breakfast pavilion is arranged to be spacious and cosy at the same time, and facilitates friendy exchange with fellow travelers of all nationalities. In the evening, you…

title: Cool oasis
review: Dear guest, Thank you so much for taking time to review our property.  We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best wishes....

title: Wonderful service in a great location
review: We stayed for 10 nights at The Garden House in a standard double room. Our room was clean and quiet with excellent air conditioning (very welcome after a hot day out in the city). All the staff work together to make your stay pleasant and hassle free and we were known and recognised from the first day (which doesn't happen in large hotels). The main sights are only 10 minutes walk away and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. We would definitely return to Istanbul and stay at this hotel again. The beautiful, live folk guitar music at dinner brought my wife to tears.   You can feast at breakfast. There is plenty to try.

title: Great hotel and great location
review: Dear guest, Thank you so much for taking time to review our property.  We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best wishes....

title: Friendly hotel in fabulous location
review: Arrived from Malaysia to Rose Garden Suites Istanbul very early in the morning and supposed to check-in at noon. The staff at the reception was kind enough to let us have the room early and we were invited to have a complimented breakfast too. With such good hospitality, we managed to get a very good rest and feel fresh again to venture round the city.

title: Conveniently Located
review: Dear guest, Thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again...  Best wishes

title: Really pretty, quaint hotel in the Sultan Ahmet Area
review: We arrived at 7am and as check in was not until 12 we were given a complimentary breakfast. Both the restaurant and reception staff were smiling and eager to help navigate us to the tourist attractions. The blue mosque and Topaki palace were very close, but the hotel was in a quiet street. We ate in the restaurant once and the food was tasty and fresh. Room was great value. It was very clean with spa bath and balcony.

title: Great Hotel near Blue Mosque
review: Dear guest, Thank you so much for taking time to review our property. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to welcome you again soon... Best wishes,

title: Fantastic stay
review: Rose Garden suites is an oasis of tranquillity and comfort in the hustle and bustle of Sultanahmet. The staff are helpful and friendly and the breakfast is divine. A wide selection of fresh bread and fruits, with traditional Turkish breakfast as well as continental staples. There is also a fresh omelette counter. The rooms are cleaned immaculately everyday and the hotel has a nice homely feel...not too busy like other hotels in Istanbul. The hotel is also located only 5 minutes walk to the hippodrome.  The only thing I would not recommend is the lunch and dinner as there are better alternatives nearby.

title: Excellent location and Staff. I would recommend and stay again
review: We spent two nights at the Rose Garden Suites and loved every moment. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, our bags were carried up to our 4th floor room and the breakfast buffet is unbelievable. Just a short walk from all the major sites. We had a great time. Highly recommended!

title: Fantastic
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to review our property.  We are glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Hope to welcome you again.  Best wishes,

title: Great location, lovely staff
review: I came here with my mother for 5 nights. The suite was very large and classy and beautifully decorated. The location is excellent if you want to explore historic Istanbul you can do so by walking to Hagia Sophis, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Grand Bazar, Basilica cistern, Mosaic Museum, Archeological Museum, Hagia Irene...and others. The staff is very friendly and helpful: Deniz in breakfast buffet, Arif and Asna on reception, the manager Mr. SELJUK , all of them have been very courteous, friendly and professional. They helped in arranging tours and all other issues. The restaurant is very good and the food is fresh and tasty.

title: Special honeymoon; great staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Cozy Corner, Charming Room, Pleasant Breakfast
review: Cozy, charming rooms. Ours had wooden furniture, an antique phone, and the bathroom had a small jacuzzi in it, as well. The breakfast was varied, the outside seating area was pleasant, and most importantly, the staff was very helpful. We asked tons of questions regarding our vacation plans and they were extremely willing to make several phone calls for us (especially to places where English isn't spoken) and explain the transportation system to us. The staff also helped my new husband plan a candle-lit surprise dinner for the both of us. Thank you for a lovely stay!

title: A real gem
review: Comfortable suite with clean beds and nice jacuzzi bath. Staff is friendly. The rose garden is beautiful! Breakfast is adequate but could be a larger spread. Wifi can be received in the room but only two bars. Can't beat the location - within walking distance to major sights. Only one negative comment - TV has almost no English channels.

title: Would definitely recommend to a friend!
review: We have just got back from a wonderful stay at the Rose Garden Suites. We would like to thanks all of the staff for looking after us from the minute we arrived to the minute that we left, this morning.  We arrived very early in the morning from an overnight flight into Ataturk Airport. On arrival we were offered breakfast whilst someone took our bags straight to our room. Getting the room so early was a real bonus as we were able to get a few hours sleep before exploring the city.  Our room was beautiful (superior room, overlooking the courtyard) which was lovely and quiet. This hotel is a little haven of peace and quiet in a bustling city and in such a great location.   We dined a few times in the lovely little courtyard and found the food to be freshly prepared and reasonably…

title: Rose garden hotel
review: Staff were very friendly and helpful. The suite we booked was very comfortable and always kept clean. The hotel is situated close to many of the well known tourist attractions such as the blue mousque and the grand bazaar; making it the perfect location. The breakfast served had a wide variety to choose from and you could also book many tours with reception. Overall, had a wonderful tme and look forward to our next trip there!

title: City Trip
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great stay, wonderful staff and breakfast.
review: My girlfriend and I visited the Rose Garden Hotel from 2nd July until 09 July. Summarizing: Everything has been fantastic and very personal and friendly. The service was excellent and much better as in some Spa- or Club Resorts. Very polite and helpful staff. At the breakfast you can choice between turkish or international buffet. Considerable is that the position of the Hotel is closely to all Sightseeing points. One is easiliy and quickly at the most important spots in the old town. I recommend the hotel to everyone who wants to stay in a turkish, family oriented hotel with a good position in Istanbul old Town.

title: Stay at the Rose Garden!
review: The place was great, perfect location to visit all historical sites.  Amazing breakfast, the breakfast manager was wonderful.  We had to leave at 5 am for the airport and the breakfast opened the restaurant for us and made us breakfast before we left.  Very helpful staff everywhere in the hotel.  Big comfortable rooms, but no elevator, so if that is a problem for you this is not the place to stay.  For us it was fine.

title: Small, quaint and a really great location
review: This is a jewel of a hotel!  It is wonderfully comfortable, clean, and in a great location.  But more than anything, the owner and staff could not be more professional, kind, and helpful.  They made our stay a real joy.  They made the arrangements for us to take a day-trip to Gallipoli, and answered every question we had about Istanbul itself.  The food is fantastic.  The breakfast, which is included in the cost of the room, is a banquet in itself.  I hope to go back to Istanbul, and I will certainly plan on staying at the Rose Garden.

title: Long weekend escape
review: 4 Adults, 2 young boys. Although we had rooms on the top floor, we really were not bothered by the lack of an elevator. The staff was gracious even if they had kind of messed up about the extra beds requested for the children. All in all, good rooms, it fits the "ancient city" experience that Istanbul offers and combines it with modern day conveniences and great food. Will visit again for sure and will recommend to others as well.

title: A real jewel of a hotel in Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great Location, accomodating and very friendly!
review: We have been to Istanbul a number of times but this is the first time we have stayed at this hotel.   I have got to say, it was one of the best experiences I have had.   The staff are extremely helpful and because of its size, they have an opportunity to get to know the customers.   The room we had was beautifully decorated in Ottoman style with fabulous wooden floors.   The outdoor patio is a haven of peace after the noise and bustle of Istanbul.   The breakfast is plentiful and the service superb, especially the egg lady who is fantastic.   The only down side is that the walk up to the major sights is up a rather steep hill, which is OK for most people but not for some.    I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, it is a gem of a hotel and deserves good business.  …

title: One Great Hotel by Rindge Leaphart
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to review our property.  We are glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Hope to welcome you again soon...  Best wishes,

title: Great hotel, great staff
review: This hotel was fantastic.  It is privately owned and the owners truly care about customer experience.  The staff was wonderful and very accommodating given our late arrival (midnight) and were even able to secure us an 8 a.m. tour.  The location is amazing and just blocks away from the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia and the Bosporus. The breakfast provided a flavor of authentic Turkish cuisine and was very good.  I would recommend this hotel to any friends and family

title: Fantastic customer service
review: As a first time visitor to Istanbul it quickly became obvious that the city is a collection of very old buildings.  Rose Garden suites is no different.  I believe the building was built in the late 1800's.  The hotel itself is celebrating their 10 year anniversary.  If you are travelling to Istanbul to visit the Blue Mosque, Ayasofya Hagia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar, or the spice market, etc.....then this hotel will be more than appropriate from a location perspective.  It is no more than a 10 minute leisurely walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the tram, and Hippodrome.  Probably a 15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, and 20 minutes or so to the Spice Market.  The only potential concern about this hotel's location is that it is tucked away in a neighborhood that had a slight…

title: Nice stay
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Mavorlous hotel
review: We stayed here for 5 nights. Is was really wordt being here. The hospitality is great. The garden is very nice. The major tourist attractions are within walking distance.  The only issue we had was that the taxi driver had some problems in finding the hotel :-)

title: A lovely haven in a busy city!
review: It is our first time to Istanbul，the hotel give us many help，help us to arrange everything. Considering we are couples, the hotel Ievel up our room for free, and get the turkey bath in the room, by the way, the breakfast is also great, I also booked two nights there when I return through Istanbul. It may be the best choice in my trip.

title: Great Location and excellent service
review: We stayed here for a week in May. All the staff were so Friendly and helpful they made our stay so easy. We loved the garden with all the flowers and sitting outside for breakfast and dinner in such a friendly relaxed atmosphere was great. The food was lovely and so much choice for breakfast! The room was really nice and the facilities perfect. The best way to describe this hotel is a home away from home! Highly recommended and we would definitely return. 10 out of 10!

title: Great friendly service
review: Dear Karen,  Thank you so much to review our property.  We are glad to be your far away home in Istanbul.  We wish to see you again soon.  Best regards,

title: Old World Hospitality
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great place - close to Sultanahmet sites
review: The Rose Garden is an oasis in the center of the Sultanamhet, the ancient heart of Istanbul. The staff were gracious, helpful and hospitable. The room was lovely and spacious with a gorgeous walk in shower, good amenities including a loofa that scrubbed the weariness of travel away, and a very comfortable bed and linens. The restaurant serves a delicious breakfast, a cornucopia of breads, fruits, nuts, and veggies ( I'm now addicted to sour cherry juice and who knew halvah is for breakfast). Did I mention the staff is delightful? A wonderful stay and experience!

title: Amazing Hotel!!!
review: I chose this hotel based on previous Tripadvisor comments. It is very comfortable, clean and well presented. The staff are attentive and very helpful. The breakfast is traditional Turkish buffet style and of excellent quality. The lady who makes the omelettes is so friendly and charming. We had bathrobes, fresh linen and towels every 3 days, slippers, toiletries and tea/coffee making facilities and a fridge in the room. We chose a superior double with balcony and it was very spacious. The ensuite shower had a hamam too. As we booked directly with the hotel, they provided free transfer from the airport which is very handy! The hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from the Sultanahmet sites and there are plenty of interesting restaurants / bars within a couple of minutes walk from…

title: Very hospitable Stay!!
review: Our stay at the Rose Garden was nothing short of amazing! Everyone was SO friendly and if anything topped this it was how helpful they were at everything that we needed. Our room was beautiful, clean, and just an absolute pleasure to stay in. The location is a less than 5 minute walk to the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and we will be staying here when we return.

title: A delightful small hotel at centre of old town Istanbul, close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia etc
review: Nice rooms, very good service, friendly staff. Very nice Breakfast with fresh omelletes. Free Wifi and and always hot water! Very near to all the ammenities. Next to Ayia Sophia and Blue Moscue. Will surely come back!!

title: Fabulous place to stay in Sultanhamet
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Istanbul sights
review: I stayed here for a week with my elderly father while we were in Turkey for the 100th anniversary commemoration at Gallipoli. The entire experience from booking through to arriving and our entire stay was without any issue.    We both had large double rooms which were very spacious and most comfortable.   The free WIFI worked well and there was WIFI throughout the hotel so you could use it in the bar or garden if so inclined.  Our rooms were on the lower floor which worked well for us but might be a challenge if you were not reasonably fit. In fact if your not fit I would not recommend staying here as it is down a very steep hill from the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque etc.  For the fitter it is fabulous as it is out of the bustle but only a five minute walk away. The buffet breakfast…

title: Lovely stay
review: Great rooms, huge beds, wonderful staff, good breakfasts. The hotel is just a short stroll from sulanahmet and all the main sites. the staff could not have been more helpful with suggestions for travel, restaurants and directions to the sights. Fantastic trip

title: Great staff and great location - will stay again
review: Dear Peter,  Thank you for taking time to review our property.   We are glad to see that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Hope to welcome you again.  Best wishes,

title: No regret!
review: From our arrival to departure we were looked after fantastically by very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were very nice and clean; the free bottle of water each day was helpful. The hotel is well situated within easy walking distance of all the major sights, with plenty of restaurants nearby, we would recommend Erhan, which had great food and reasonable prices. We would definitely stay here again if in Istanbul

title: Finding a family in Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Amazing Breakfast, Clean and Comfy Room
review: After 30 minutes in this hotel we felt at home with new friends consisting of the staff of this hotel. Top quality service, food and atmosphere. Whenever we decide to visit Istanbul again we already know that we don`t have to look for another hotel. Earlier comment stated that breakfast could be improved; I wonder how, because all four of us never ate as much and as good as here.

title: Such a sweet Boutique-Hotel in Sultanahmet!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to review our property.  We are glad to learn that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Hope to welcome you again soon.  Best wishes,

title: nice people, great food
review: Esra our guest relations manager was friendly, welcoming and gave us great recommendations. Breakfast was of an amazing Turkish variety - we got to sample almost everything there is in Turkish breakfast cuisine. The room was nicely furnished with a clean, comfortable bed and bathroom.

title: historical building with superb staff and service!
review: Dear Victoria,  Thank you for your beatiful words.  Hope to see you again...  Best wishes,

title: Lovely but noisy ground floor room!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Highly recommend
review: We stayed at the rose garden hotel for our honeymoon last May and there were many positives, but I'll start with the couple of stand out negatives.   One was that the WiFi never seemed to work very well on my phone! But my husbands was on and off.   The absolute main gripe of mine however was that on our ground floor suite facing a busy road with a couple of takeaways on it it was quite noisy at night time when we were trying to sleep and as the bed was right by the window it felt like people were walking and talking literally inside our room! I have also read other people complain of thin walls and hearing people from the other rooms when they were on upper floors though I think I could have lived with that more than feeling like the local takeaway was inside our room, it took…

title: Friendly staff always makes a pleasant journey!
review: Dear Guest,   Thank you very much for taking the time to review our property. I am very sorry that your stay was compromised by the noise of the street. We will certainly try to find a solution for a better isolation. Thank you for your kind critique. Hope to welcome you again soon in another room type which overlooking to the garden side or at the upper floors.   Best wishes,

title: Awesome hotel in a perfect location
review: Mom and I arrived quite late and the staff at reception asked us if we wanted to hear about the tourist information first or checked in to the room first, as usually other big chain hotels do not have this customized meeting for each guest. It made us feel very welcomed and helpful. Later during the stay I noticed that it's such a good strategy rose garden does to make each guest get to know what they can do to make the most use of their time in Istanbul. The second morning Manager sat down with us at the table and discussed with us before helping us arrange a one day tour to all the must-see attractions, which turned out great. I've stayed at countless hotels across the world and this one definitely impressed me with its attentive staff and superb service. The building itself…

title: Charming hotel in the midst of old town
review: We didn't stay in the hotel but we kept our luggage in the reception and had a wonderful breakfast.  The staff were really helpful and informative. Even though we didn't stay in the hotel, they gave great advice on how to best make use of our time in Istanbul! Just like a friend!  And the best breakfast collection in Turkey!  老板十分热情，帮助我们了解土耳其的交通文化也给了我们很多很好的旅游建议。酒店的早餐非常好吃！

title: rooms clean and very well presented, the attention to detail made it a cut abive the average
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Nice hotel with wonderful staff
review: The hotel was situated in walking distance of the Blue Mosque but up a steep hill as is most of Istanbul.  The breakfast was very good with a wide selection to cater for all tastes. There are restuarants all in walking distance.  You need at least 3 full days to get a flavour of Istanbul.   You can spend a day getting lost in the grand bazaar.

title: Excellent/ Estupendo y bien comunicado
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review our property. It is always heartwarming to hear that our guests enjoyed their stays. Hope to welcome you again another time.  Regards,

title: Excellent
review: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. The rooms we got were spacious and really nice.  The staff was very attentive.  Good breakfast.  Location is very close to the sights in Sultanahmet. We will definitely consider coming back!

title: The best service in town
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to review our property. It is always heartwarming to hear that our guests enjoyed their stay. Hope to welcome you again another time.

title: Great Place at Perfect Location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Amazing Stay
review: Just 5 minutes walk from the main sightseeing spots Rose Garden Suites offers very comfortable accommodation in a nice neighborhood of small shops and a few restaurants. The hotel has two buildings, between the two is a little garden which must be nice to sit in during the warm season (we stayed 5 nights in deep winter). The restaurant / breakfast room is located here. Nothing to complain about the breakfast, a lot more variety than in similarly priced hotels in France or Italy. As an added bonus tea, coffee and cake are served free of charge in the afternoon. Keep in mind that the area is quite hilly, so there are some stairs between the two buildings. The Executive Suites in the new building face a little street which is busy till about midnight, after that no problem. There…

title: 5 stars
review: We stayed here for 6 nights for my wife's birthday. Upon checking in Murat was extremely helpful at planning our entire trip. He was attentive and looked after us very well from arrival to checking out. The head chef Ramazan was also courteous and took care of us. The hotel staff were always on standby catering for all our needs. Our hotel room was perfect and the hotel itself is walking distance to many of the main attractions such as Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace.   In short, we will definitely be coming back and we highly recommend this hotel!!!!!!!!

title: Just perfect!
review: Simply 5 stars and they helped us to make great memory , and the restaurant with the chief Ramzan soo remarkable plates so delicious , the hotel is for sure is so recommended  and once will be in Turkey again will book again with them 😃😃😃

title: Excellent Excellent Excellent
review: Very friendly personal. Everyone's happy and smiling. The hotel is located a few minutes from Sultan-Ahmet-Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome and the next tram station is also very near. So it's perfect for a city trip.   There is a huge selection at the breakfast buffet, typical turkish. We loved it!   Excellent! See you next time :-)

title: Highly recommended
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: I'll be back!
review: Good location closed to main tourist attractions (Sultanahmet, Hagia Sofia). The staff is very nice and helpful. The breakfast is very delicious but we would also recommend the dinner menu at reasonable price. The rooms are clean and well-equipped. Although we have booked a standard room we received a superior room for no additional fee. Thanks very much to Bora (the hotel's manager). :) We definetely recommend this hotel to stay. We spent there three nights. If we return to Istanbul, we definetely will stay at Rose Garden Hotel again.

title: Highly recommended
review: Hotel very well located in a quiet area and yet very close to the Blue Mosque. You can walk the whole day in this area and if you feel tired you won't be more than 15 minutes away...that's how good it's located in the Sultanhamet district! The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms were great: cozy and spacious with nice "old fashion" furniture (we stayed in Rose Garden Suites). The restaurant was also great and the waiters and chef are just great folks to talk to. Anything you need, just ask the reception, they will recommend you the best tours and book everything for you (I highly recommend the cruise on the Bosphore at night). I will be back for sure: 3 days in this great city is simply too short, and I'll definitely stay at Rose Garden again.

title: Lovely Hotel near by everything in old Istanbul
review: The hotel is  located  near Blue mosque, Hippodrome. Awesome  location. friendly staff. highly recommended for family. Rooms are small  but well  maintained.  We stayed for 7 nights,the most memorable stay I must  say.   Breakfast was the best. Though Wi -Fi  was weak  but I would  definitely love to  stay again  if I visit istanbul in future.

title: Great hotel to stay very central to all sights
review: Rose Garden has an excellent  location only 5-minutes walk distance from  Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Topkapi and Great Basar.  Rose Garden has great friendly atmosphere with perfect staff. In december we stayed for five days in the Hotel. We had tasteful breakfast every morning and four times delicious  dinner .  Thanks a lot for excellent service .

title: Best Hotel In Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: calm and good
review: Very friendly staff and a very good restaurant with the most friendly waiter ever (Yasar). The room was fantastic with a turkis bath style marble bathroom, the bed was very comfortable and. This hotel is highly recommended.

title: Very Customer Service Oriented
review: No Spa, No sport's club but ut is a good hôtel and calm. we would like to see a breakfast a little more diverse. the service is excellent and the staff are helpful , nothing to say about that. Other than that I Think All is well

title: "Simply Friendly"
review: We stayed here for five days in September and it was a pleasure to stay here.  We were upgraded to be bigger room when we checked-in and welcomed warmly by Selcuk, the manager, who took the time to give us a little orientation session showing us what the hotel had to offer.  We arrived just in time for the complimentary afternoon tea time where they serve tea, fruits, and cakes.  We enjoyed this several times during our stay.  Ramezan, who worked at the restaurant/bar, was always friendly and gracious and committed to our comfort.  The breakfast that was provided every morning was enjoyable, and we loved making ourselves a turkish coffee and tea in the morning along with a fresh omelet.  What really stood out for us at the Rose Garden was the excellent customer service.  You can…

title: Great location and wonderful staff!
review: The hotel is walking distance to the Blue Mosque with a lovely courtyard and rooms in the sunken rose garden. Rooms are very nicely appointed and the breakfast is outstanding. Chef Ramadan can also personalize to meet your taste and expand on what may be a considered a very limited dinner menu. Friendless oozes out of every person working here. One evening we got back very late and were starved! The night chef (who was sleeping) delivered delicious omelets and toast to or room at 1AM Hari

title: Great home base for exploring
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale.
