title: Simply the best
review: Just finished a week stay in the Rose Garden. Staff were very helpful but not intrusive- could really tell they wanted you to be happy with your stay. Room was always well cleaned, breakfast was good and plentiful, location was perfect for all there is to see and do in Istanbul. Highly recommend.

title: Great hotel and Excellent staff
review: Rose Garden Suites was our haven in Istanbul. We arrived after 10 days of touring Turkey and were looking for some place to unwind as much as a place from which to explore Istanbul. Rose Garden Suites was just perfect. Kudoes to Mr. Selcuk who took us in hand and have us fabulous advice about what tours to take and what to see on our own, thanks also to Murat who persuaded us to take the night cruise on the Bosporus- which was great night out, and the whole staff at breakfast- (the eggs are lovely), and Ramzan who was a truly entertaining at dinner. Whether you are staying for a couple of days or making Istanbul a base to explore Turkey the staff at Rose Garden are happy to share their experiences and tell you where to go to make the best if your time.  Although they don't say…

title: A great stay in a very charming hotel
review: Everything is wonderful.The location is close to Sultanahmet sights,room is quiet and clean,they changed bath towels everyday,the breakfast in the terrace garden every morning. especially They have excellent staff. Mr Selcuk very friendlyand helpful,he provided great service to us.

title: Small hotel in excellent location
review: The hotel is extremely well located, near all major Istambul's sites ; it is warm, charming, with a very nice garden in which you can have your afternoon tea. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful. The rooms are slightly small though.

title: Superb Hotel for the Price and Location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice hotel in Sultanahmet
review: I would like to begin the review with saying that the 1-5 star scale is a scale. If I give any hotel 5 star, it means I would never ever find a hotel better than that, so in my opinion, 4 star is right up there. Secondly, I feel the scale is relative to the location, so this is for Istanbul. I cannot compare a hotel in Istanbul to one in Vegas and give them both the same stars.   That said, Rose Garden is a Gem for its location and its Hospitality. If you are flying from the US, please remember, this will not be like your Hiltons and Marriotts, for for most Hotels in Old Istanbul are not built that way. Its much smaller, B&B feel. Very clean and comfortable. The breakfast is superb and is included in the price. Internet connection is strong, so all your research for next day…

title: Impression on the top
review: Nice and frienly personnel, good breakfast, nice garden/terrase restaurant with local drinks, sveet kittens and cats,very quiet situation, walking distance to good restaurants and the main locatl attractions. Weather was excellent and the long weekend perfect.

title: I would recommend this nice and cozy hotel in the very heart of wonderful Istanbul!
review: This hotel hit me from my heart when I saw the room. I didn't expect that much because there was a real big hammam in the shower which made me feel very warm and never wanted to leave. I really like the cleanness and warm old style rooms. This was better than any other luxury hotels. I suggest anyone to stay there at least one night so that you would understand what I mean

title: Definitely will com again
review: We  have been to Istanbul for the first time. They say "you have the only chance to make a first impression". Rose Garden completed the mission at A mark.  Excelent location, nice premises,ready-to-help personnel, good and no-pork food, and finally roses themselves. Thank you all, guys!

title: Skip this hotel - there are many better hotels in the neighborhood
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Istanbul Roses
review: I don't know why this hotel is so highly rated on this site and Hotels.com. Perhaps its the email they send you asking you to rate it 5 stars after you check out. It was dingy, the bed was hard as a rock, and you had to climb a flights of stairs by the foot of the bed to get into it because of the railings on the bed that make it feel like a crib. It took eight minutes to get the water temperature to be warm. There were bugs in the room. The staff was pleasant, but wanted us to switch rooms twice in the three nights we were there and were not accommodating to other patrons when they were unsatisfied with their rooms and asked to be changed. We thought we were getting a deal because the pictures looked great and they say their rack rate is 5 times what we paid, but I think that…

title: Charming inn - with very helpful staff
review: For our first trip to Istanbul, we were very lucky to chose Rose Garden Suites for our stay. Very friendly and devoted people running this hotel. It is close to the ancient city and much of what we wanted to visit is quite close (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque a.o.). They ran a discount on Bosporus boat trips while we've been there, all bookings executed to the minute. Half an hour from Ataturk with taxi, nice rooms, quite a good breakfast buffet, an overall excellent experience and a big chance to stay at this hotel again next time we go to Istanbul! A lot of good restaurants around, money dispenser, shops with everything you need, close to Tram and Metro station. Receptionists and lobby-boys very reactive, all our needs covered to satisfaction!

title: Comfortable and Friendly Hotel in Central Location
review: There is some confusion between Rose Garden Suits and Garden House Inn - they are run by the same staff  ... Mr Selcuk helps plans the tours etc and Mr Yasser over at the kitchen were very helpful. It was quaint to wake up early in the morning to the prayer calls from the mosques nearby - I would say it was one of the nicest experiences in Istanbul. Breakfast is quiet a spread. The only thing that bothered us was that we were on the 4th floor with no elevators.

title: A wonderful Family trip.
review: Centrally located hotel very convenient for all major historic sites. 5 Mins walk to Blue Mosque which is great as we got up early one day to miss the queues and then went back to the hotel for a late breakfast. Comfortable and well appointed room. We paid extra for a suite and it was superb. Very helpful and friendly advice on things to see and where to eat. Friendly restaurant and bar service with good food. We only ate in on our first night but the food was very good.

title: Nice small hotel in the very center
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Gorgeous treat hotel
review: I had the opportunity of spending one night in this small hotel in the very center of Istanbul. From a location perspective it is sensational, barely 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque. I would call out the service which was great and very attentive at every moment. The facilities are great and the rooms are clean and very well taken care. Only the power went out several times during the night, but for the rest was a great stay. If something I would bring down the level of touristic merchandising around the hotel, but this is a common thing in Istanbul.

title: Wonderfully located and friendly hotel
review: We treated ourselves to 2 nights at this hotel as a birthday treat, and it was perfect. Our bedroom was a beautifully decorated little slice of heaven, and the bathroom was utter bliss too - we have honestly never had such a great shower! We paid a little extra for a room with a balcony overlooking the courtyard which was lovely - lots of birdsong throughout the day. Really friendly, thoughtful & helpful service with a smile throughout (even at 3am after a night out!), and a fantastic location in a charming & historical area, only a few minutes walk from the main attractions in Sultanahmet.  I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. Thanks to all the lovely staff who ensured we had such a great trip.

title: Excellent service
review: We visited twice, three nights in total. The staff were unfailingly helpful - with luggage, tour booking, dinner, airport shuttles...Great atmosphere and a lovely garden and courtyard for warm nights. The location is excellent, quiet except for the call to prayers, which is everywhere in the City anyway! We did lots of walking and thus appreciated the good breakfast which is included. We had dinner there twice, which was specially cooked with lots of extra accompaniments. Highly recommended.

title: our first trip to istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Very friendly perfect hotel break
review: we spent six nights at the Rose Garden Suites and found the rooms far exceeded our expectations. staff were truly friendly, wifi was included, the breakfast was fantastic staff made  great omelettes. close to all the attractions, helped organise trip to Gallipoli,   thank you to this little hotel.

title: Lovely hotel- Excellent customer service
review: Great hotel that ticked all the boxes.  Very friendly and helpful staff, including the ever enthusiastic Murat who made us feel very welcome during our stay.  The room was wonderful, very large, comfy bed, clean, nice interior and perfect bathroom.  One hint is though try and get a balcony room upstairs which is more private. The hotel was in a great location, a short walk to all the major sights but located in a quiet area out of the hustle and bustle.  The hotel also serves free refreshments between 4pm to 6pm in its garden, and it is well worth taking advantage of this if you're around.    However, the main highlight were the staff we met.  All of them were fantastic.  Murat helped us plan our days, and I'm sure he will recommend you to do across the bridge and up the "Tunel"…

title: A Haven In Busy Istanbul
review: I stayed in the Rose Garden suites for 5 nights as a romantic break in Istanbul. On arrival we were greeted by Murat who looks after reception and also helps with ant tours or questions you have about Istanbul. We were made feel welcome instantly. We were tired and hungry after a long days travels and Murat didn't want to overload us with information so we agreed to meet him the following day to start organising the next few days.  Our room was wonderful. We were in the Rose garden superior room with balcony. It was very spacious, beds were comfortable and the shower was fantastic. On the 3rd day I wasn't feeling well and Murat and the dining host were really caring and made me some specialised teas to make me feel better!! Nothing was ever a problem.. The hotel is located very…

title: Comfortable, pleasant, friendly hotel
review: It is not often you walk into a hotel room and are a little shocked to find it is much nicer than you expected. It has happened to me twice. Once in Bali, and now at the Rose Garden Suites. The room was much nicer than I expected from the picture. A large room, big comfortable bed, and a cute little balcony overlooking the garden that we enjoyed a morning coffee on.  The bathroom shower is truly excellent, a strong rainhead marble shower which I thouroughly enjoyed after staying at rather modest places in Turkey the previous two nights.  Mr. Selcuk made us very welcome as did the maitre d in the restaurant. We enjoyed one very nice meal in the restaurant garden the first night when we were too tired to explore the city and would recommend it to anyone. The hotel is situated very…

title: Very Good Experience
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great customer service and very comfortable room!
review: Our recent 5-night stay at Rose Garden Suites in old Sultanahmet in Istanbul was memorable indeed. This was our third visit to Turkey and we were quite overwhelmed by the beautification of the city since our last visit. Rose Garden Suites probably oversells itself somewhat on its website. There was little evidence of the “premium bedding” the website boasts of, for example. And the room we were given on arrival was far below the standard we expected from both the website and the price. It took some argumentation and the threat of asking for a refund to motivate the management to give us a choice of two much better rooms the next day. The second room was beautiful indeed, and we enjoyed our remaining 4 days there thoroughly. Another detail that seemed short-sighted was that we…

title: Romantic, relaxing, perfect location
review: We have stayed one night to Rose Garden Suites in Istanbul. Very centrally located, with great customer service (from suggesting where to go for a late night dinner till the preparation of an early morning breakfast, before the opening of the breakfast time) and a spacious room with a balcony. Absolutely perfect bathroom facilities in our room also. Dear Manager Selcuk, thank you very much. For sure your place will be our first choice next time that we will visit Istanbul.

title: garden !!!
review: We met up for our anniversary weekend, and enjoyed a lovely room with flowers, an anniversary decoration on the bed, and staff who were helpful and friendly well beyond expectations.  Patio onto the garden was so relaxing.  Breakfast was excellent and covered all tastes.  We also enjoyed another meal and wine on the patio.  Delicious.  Location central for the main sights of Istanbul, and offered a lovely bit of quiet when touring was done.  Selcuk was excellent with organizing a private tour guide, restaurant reservations, and tips for making our way around.  Great value for $ as well.

title: Cozy place
review: I loved this hotel, the location was excellent, walking distance to the major sites in Sultanahmet. Staff were very accommodating, nothing was too much effort.The garden is great, the treats like coffee, tea and cake available the whole day are really a great idea !We took advantage of the happy hour on two nights of our stay. The decor within the hotel itself is traditional .Wish to return in the near future!

title: Best customer service ever!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great location and beautiful room
review: We booked a standard room at the hotel but the manager Selcuk bey immediately proposed to upgrade our reservation to a suit as it won't be comfortable for four of us (a baby, a toddler and two adults) to stay in a small room. The suite was beautiful. The breakfast included in the price was satisfactory and all the personnel starting at the hotel and in the restaurant were extremely helpful and kind. We will not look for another hotel on our future trips to Istanbul. Keep up the good work

title: Very Comfortable
review: I loved this hotel, the location was excellent, walking distance to the major sites in Sultanahmet. Staff were very accommodating, nothing was too much effort. The rooms as also beautiful with a balcony overlooking the garden area where we had breakfast every morning. Gorgeous bathroom, big room, comfortable bed. Everything a traveller needs. I enjoyed the breakfast and the sitting area next to the garden was a really nice place to relax (often with complementary water and cake). Will definitely return!!

title: A great place to stay if you want to visit Istanbul
review: Me and my wife stayed for 1 night in this cozzy hotel and it was a very pleasant stay. Its very near Hagia Sofya and Sultanahmet and the other attractions in the city center, but is in a very quiet street. Might be difficult to reach at first, but then it becomes easy when you know your way around the area. Very confortable room (the ac is not on top of you when on - which is great specially at night), with very good amenities. The breakfast is average, normal turkish breakfast, but fresh food. The staff is very nice and helpful, they gave us discount in the tours that we take around the city and pointed the best spots to go for dinner and turkish bath. We really enjoyed our time.

title: Wonderful hotel in the Old City
review: Rose Garden Suites is a lovely and cozy hotel where you feel at home when you come back after a tiring day. The garden is great, the treats like coffee, tea and cake available the whole day are really a great idea and we want to stay there and chill out and to continue to smell and feel Istanbul. Mr. Selçulk was absolutely amazing during my whole stay there and I totally relied on him on the good tips to know my way in Istanbul. His team is top as well, so I will definitely come back if again in Istanbul.

title: Great location and friendly staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Friendly and helpful staff and good location
review: We recently stayed at Rose Garden Suites for four nights and we really enjoyed our time there. Upon arrival we were greeted by Murat at the reception who was one of the most hospitable and friendliest members of staff. Once shown to our room we were happy to see that it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The decor within the hotel itself is traditional and while it is not as lavish as other Europeon hotels the staff and location make this hotel a great place to stay. We definitely recommend this hotel. Special thanks to Murat and Ramazan. Compliments to Hidayat for making delicious breakfast omlettes. (Yusuf & Sara)

title: So warm and welcoming
review: The location of the hotel is very good to get to the attractions. The atmosphere of the hotel is very warm and feels like home.  The staffs are so kind, helpful and friendly.  The price was reasonable.  The room was clean and very classic. Wish to return in the near future!

title: Great staff and Location
review: After booking a couple of other hotels and having to cancel (free of charge) because I received no replies to my queries about certain facilities I found The Rose Garden. No sooner had I made a booking then I received an email from the sales manager to check to see if there was anything I needed!! Wonderful. This was just the beginning of the fantastic service we received. It was almost midnight by the time we arrived but the service manager, with excellent English, very patiently looked after is. After settling into our room we were able to enjoy a drink at the garden bar with an equally friendly, helpful bartender who spoke perfect English also.  The facilities at this hotel are truly lovely; the room, the garden bar and outdoor dining and breakfast area are all very welcome…

title: great service and very enjoyable stay!
review: Tucked away in the old district you will find a gem of a hotel. The staff is incredibly helpful and pleasant. The location is perfect for those wanting to see the old city. The price was reasonable and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very nice as well. I would stay there again without hesitation.

title: Great service and family atmosphere
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Amazing experience from the word go!
review: A beautiful stay with the family; this is our second time in Turkey and staying in the same chain, this time, we stayed in the Suites hotel; it was really comfortable and the staff were great.  Easy to go to all the attractions and restaurant areas; value for money.

title: Cozy, quiet, cool...
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this ideally situated hotel. The staff in particular were very professional. The breakfast had an array of traditional Turkish specialities, and Hamide, Ulaf and the rest of the team at breakfast did their best to ensure our needs were taken care of. Echoing the same view as some of the previous commenters, we would like to make a special mention of Ramazan the barman who really made a big difference to our stay. Ramazan was friendly, courteous and held an excellent command of English. He went out of his way to explain the local culture and customs of Istanbul and his insiders advice was invaluable to us.

title: A great place to stay but.....only if you have reasonable cardio
review: We stayed here for our honeymoon and it was very good. The place is cozy and somewhat romantic. There are a lot of stairs to walk up and down when coming in and out of the hotel but Istanbul is all about walking. The location is very nice, minutes away from the tram, mosque, Haiga Sophia, and many other places to see. The street is very nice with several restaurants and cafe to enjoy an evening. I would recommend but get in shape first. Lots of walking here.

title: Rose Garden...A fantastic place to stay
review: I stayed at the Rose Garden for 3 nights from 23rd July `14 to 28th July `14. The room I was assigned at first was on the 3rd floor wand had low beams which felt a little Claustrofobic but when i asked for a differnt room was prompltly and kindly dealt with and only had to pay and extra 20 Euro per day for a better room. Everything about this Hotel is good, the service, the rooms, dealing with problems (we had a faulty fridge that leaked water all over the floor but it was dealt with promptly), the breakfast and the service. The front was exceptional in spending time helping us plan our visits and we were even we were given an Istanbul card to use for our stay. The breakfast waiter, whos English was perfect, was especailly kind.    Things to watch out for. Calls from the hotel…

title: One of Istanbul's hidden gems
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: What a wonderful little Haven in Istanbul
review: This cute little boutique hotel is by far one of the most special and pleasant places I've stayed in during all my worldly travels. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and the room beyond expectation They eve upgraded me to my own private suite without any particular reason ;-) Thanks so much for the lovely stay and will definitely come again!

title: A Delightful Stay
review: This is a really nice little haven tucked away in Sultanahmet.  It has a nice outdoor breakfast terrace and sun room with plasma TV for evening relaxing.  Beds were comfortable and rooms spacious.  The courtyard is clean and well landscaped.  Staff is extremely helpful at guiding you to major attractions, all within walking distance.  The breakfast provided was amazing!  Definitely included in the little black book of places to return to in the future.

title: Kelly
review: Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable. The small boutique nature of the hotel coupled with friendly and helpful staff delivered a very welcoming atmosphere. Breakfasts were superb and the courtyard a relaxing haven for a quiet drink. Free wifi and lots of access points allowed for easy connectivity whether in your room or elsewhere.  The location is favourable for sight seeing, the Blue Mosque is very close and also within walking distance is the Grand Bazaar & Topkapi Palace. While it required a moderate level of fitness, it added extra opportunity to soak up the sights and sounds.  We found that a small downside to the marble floors and staircases is that they are rather noisy when other guests return late at night, especially if said guests are laughing/talking/wearing heels.…

title: Boutique hotel near old city
review: Wonderful spot with a great location. A lot of the sites are just in walking distance. Nice rooms and layout. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfast with a lot to choose from. Lovely courtyard as well. Very close to mosques (as are most places in Istanbul) so be prepared to wake up to the call to prayer.

title: Great place to stay
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel
review: The rooms are very average, but the shower had huge amounts of hot water any time I wanted, and staff were fantastic. The staff attitude alone makes it a worthwhile place to stay. The location is excellent - all the big sites are withing walking distance.

title: Lovely place
review: We stayed at the Rose Garden Suites in Istanbul from June 2 thru June 5th of 2014.  The hotel has a great location, within walking distance to major tourist attractions as well as public transportation. We were traveling with friends and totally enjoyed the patio/garden courtyard, the coffee/tea and cake available all the time.  The head of guest relations, Selcuk Topcu was fantastic !  everything we asked of him he accomplished with a smile, from tickets to a folk dance to restaurant reservations at the last minute. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because our booking was to include breakfast at the restaurant each morning however no one informed us of such at check in and so it was only on our last day that Selcuk mentioned it to us. We would suggest to friends that…

title: Satisfied!
review: Lovely hotel. Is conveniently located on a quiet street, a 5-minute walk from the Blue Mosque. The hotel is very cozy and comfortable, beautiful rooms in the Turkish style. Wonderful staff, very friendly and welcoming. Delicious breakfast and dinner in a beautiful and very cozy garden. We lived there for wonderful days during our stay. Thank you.  Antonina and Sasha.

title: Great Location and Great Staff.
review: was at the back end of a cruise, stayed for 3 nights in Istanbul and decided to give this place a try since one of my friend was quite pleased about his stay here a year ago. rooms  are quite roomy for european standards and clean. the room we stayed in however had ac issues, BUT the hotel was nice enough to offer their portable ac for us to use. as being from Vancouver Canada we don't frequently see weather hovering around the 30c range hence without ac I would die! =) staff is very friendly and helpful whether being through the hotel services or offering assistance with local information and etc... bf is great with all the local fresh fruits they offer daily and again friendly restaurant staff. also have to mention about the baby kittens they just recently had which hangs…

title: Stay a while..
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Good Location
review: Rose Garden Suites was quite nice and near so much of Istanbul's many sights. We stayed 1 full week. The pick up from IST airport was efficient. A greeter was there with my name on a small sign and he led us to curb side where our shuttle picked us up. You can tip the greeter in any currency. I did email the hotel manager the night before just remind them of my arrival..I would advise doing the same as its a very busy airport and arrival area.  The hotel has no elevator and we were on the top floor but, it was worth the climb. We booked room 502 with its own balcony, nice seating area, WC with large bathtub. There's not much space to put your clothing. There are lots of shelves with decorative items upon but, only one small closet and small drawers on the night stands. The decor…

title: Highly Recommended
review: Located in an alley off the main road. The hotel is made up of 2 buildings, the main building and the annexe. There are no lifts in both buildings. The rooms are big and comfortable. Breakfast is adequate with juices, cakes and local products. Mr. Selcuk provided us with a map and pointed out the sights to visit. The Blue Mosque is only a 10 to 15 minutes walk from the hotel. The Sofia Hagar and Tokapi Palace are also within walking distance. It would be cheaper to travel by tram rather then taxis. Taxis do not use meters. It is relaxing to sit in the Rose Garden during the evening to have drinks.

title: Highly Recommended
review: Our stay was so wonderful that we did not want to leave the Hotel! Our rooms were large, comfortable and beautifully decorated. The location was great and the staff was very helpful. The terraced areas were very peaceful and relaxing and even the children enjoyed the accommodations.

title: A Turkish Delight!
review: Good location for the old city.  All main sights within reasonable walking distances.  We had a de-luxe room which was very spacious and clean with a balcony.  Very comfortable bed!! Our room was in the annexe and was very quiet, although up a couple of flights of stairs and there was no lift   That was ok for us but may not be suitable for all travellers.  Hotel has a nice courtyard to relax in the shade and enjoy a complimentary cup of coffee/glass of water.  Breakfast choice was excellent and the one evening meal we had was good.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  I would happily recommend this hotel.

title: Great stay at a great location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Amazing!
review: Travel Time: From 2nd April for 4 nights  The good bits first.  To be honest, just about everything is right with this hotel!   We were travelling from London with 2 young children including a 18month old and were expectedly a little apprehensive about facilities, safety and quality of accommodation.   - The hotel is located behind the Blue Mosque; a 7-10 min walk to the main square between the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophya. We had booked our airport pick up through the hotel. If you are travelling with a lot of luggage or with kids, would suggest you pay the extra and avail of this service. Is well worth it.   - The room (we had booked the Executive Double Room...pictures 3 and 5 on Expedia) was clean and spacious overlooking a back road. Therefore wasn't noisy and the kids slept…

title: FANTASTIC !!!!
review: It is the most cozy hotel I've ever stayed at. It has an open shared terrace under a huge tree with free beverages and snack all the day long. The hotel has its own restaurant with a very good food. Breakfasts are abundant. People are very nice. We've got a big luxe room with 2 balconies and welcome fruits. Interior is great - in Ottoman style, very comfortable. The only minute minus was air conditioner not workinf properly. Location is great - Ai Sofia is 500m. There is a local market nearby with bundles of fruits and vegetables.

title: Excellent hotel
review: We stayed for 4 days. manager greeted us (Selcuk Topcu), and gave us a tour of the property ( rooms and amenities). After that,  he stayed with us and told us what to do and what to see in the short period that we stayed. Arranged for a night cruise on the Bosporus and also a very nice restaurants. Location is very good ( very close to the main attractions), hotel is very clean and staff is very nice and helpful. Breakfast was included and it had a good variety of food. All in all, I would HIGLY recommend this place and I will DEFINITELY would go back!

title: An Oasis in a Bustling City
review: It is an ottoman style hotel in Kycuk Ayasofya area, close to all main attractions.Very stylish rooms with beautiful marble baths , very good breakfast which can be get in a beautiful garden. All the hotel personel is extremely helpfull, especially Mr. Selcuk Topcu who helped us a lot!!

title: A gem tucked in Istanbul's Bye lanes
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A lovely hotel, well located
review: I have just returned from Turkey after a holiday trip for nine days and would be totally un just and un greatful if I donot put on record my appreciation for the hotel" ROSE GAREDN SUITES" situated at Sultanahmet in Istanbul. The place is small but very efficient and decent. Staff is always smiling and will go out of their way to help and satisfy your needs. The location is just perfect. All the places of interest in Istanbul, like Ayasofia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and Topkapi palace are situated within 7 minutes easy paced walk from the hotel. This place reminds me of my stay at Great Western Plus Vienna.  Guest relations manager, SELCUK, is very polite and professional and will provide all the inputs about the town and will also help you in planning yr sightseeing trips. There…

title: A beautiful hotel but it is a shame about the balcony
review: We loved the Rose Garden Suites Hotel!  I was lovely and comfortable. We felt like we were really in Turkey but with great comfort and a peaceful, beautiful setting.  The rooms were spacious and the flowers in the garden, renewing.  The location could not have been more perfect  - close to everything and yet not in the midst of the crowds.  And, the staff were enormously helpful.

title: great hotel
review: The Rose Garden hotel is a fantastic hotel  situated very close to the Blue mosque and the Hagia Sofia.(literally a 10 minute leisurely walk) The staff are fantastic and provide ample information and readily help book excursions. The grounds on which the hotel sit are well kept and the flowers and cats that roam the gardens are a treat. The breakfast buffet is fantastic and the rooms are of great size and quality. My only gripe  would be the extremely poor attampt at a balcony. We were situated on the ground floor and a picket fence with two chairs had been placed outside ....this does not in any way constitute a balcony but the the rest of the hotel was so pleasant that it didnt really make too much of a difference. If you are in istanbul definately give the Rose Gardens a…

title: Great hotel
review: بصراحة فندق اكتر من رائع من كل النواحي  تعامل الاستقبال لطيف و متعاون  لما طلبنا منهم يحتفظوا بالشنط عندهم يوم و نرجع ناخدها وافقوا  يطلبولنا السيارة تاخدنا من باب الفندق  لما تطلب منهم اي طلب يساعدوك او عنوان يدلونا عليه من اقرب طريق  ما تحسهم يبغوا ينصبو عليك او شئ من ده الكلام  ياخدوا الشنط و يطلعوها باسلوب محترم  غرفهم نظيفة و الاثاث مرتب و مزودة بكل الاحتياجات  في كل غرفة في غلاية و كاسات و شاي و موية  و في بوفيه في المدخل فيه عصيرات و موية و فاكهة و كيك و شاهي طول اليوم  و اهم ما يميزهم حديقتهم  الداخلية  جدا جدا مناظرها روعة مع جوهم الحلو  و جلساتهم مريحة  تقدر تقعد فيها في اي وقت  بوفيه الافطار منوع و يرضي كل الرغبات   i advice this hotel for anyone want to visit istabul  we stayed there for four days , it was very enjoyable stay beyond our expectations their garden is…

title: Oasis in busy Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Great little quiet hotel
review: What a find! My sister-in-law booked this hotel and did she ever come up with an amazing find! The hotel was so fabulous that we booked it again for our next stay here in two weeks with our three daughters and a daughter's husband! Selcuk has been incredibly helpful with tickets to various events, as well as travel advice.  He has really looked after us during the past four days--he even called the airline to check our reservations. The hotel really is a refuge to come home to after a day in an non-stop city. Breakfast was included and we lingered over coffee in the quiet calming outdoor courtyard and plotted our strategy for the day.  We delighted in dinner in the restaurant with Suat guiding us to the best choices in wine and specials of the day.  We can't wait for our return…

title: ideal location
review: Rose garden suites hotel is a wonderful gem that is quiet with superb service. Selcuk Topcu was incredibly helpful and went above and beyond expected service. He was genuine and professional providing the best possible service and attention. Suat in the restaurant was also extremely helpful. We plan to return and have no reservations about recommending this hotel to anyone.

title: Feeling At Home in Istanbul
review: Charming hotel in old wooden facade building in a peaceful location. Rooms are big and typical. Bathroom has turkish features. Even parking your car is possible thanks to the valet service. Close to main historical city centre.

title: A stay to remember
review: I spent a week at Rose Garden Suites during of May.  This hotel is one of the cosiest places I have been to. A very convivial lobby when hit drinks and cakes available at any time.  The rooms were spacious and very clean and comfortable.   I have to admit that our stay was made even more enjoyable thanks to the very dedicated staff available at the hotel. First of all I would like to thank Selcuk who would constantly be willing to help with any reservation and recommendation and that in a daily basis.  Also Fares who would also help a lot and many thanks to Mourad also.  Really the staff made a huge difference and we will surely be back very soon.   Thanks to all of you!!!

title: Lovely oasis in a busy city
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. title: Coziest Hotel
review: The hotel is located in exciting Sultanhamet district, and is a 30 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, and other classic sites.  Getting to the main drag requires hiking up a fairly steep incline for several blocks, so those with physical limitations might find it an effort.  The hotel is very well managed, the staff are exceptionally helpful and courteous, and the full breakfast (inluded in our price) is excellent. Our room was spaceous by European standards: king bed, comfortable firm matress, powerful shower with lots of hot water, and an efficient air conditioner. Our room was spotlessly clean, as was the rest of the hotel.  Our room was in the back of the hotel overlooking the patio, and was generally very quiet.  The hotel is situated on a quiet…

title: No regrets about choosing this hotel
review: Cozy hotel, excellent service, super clean and impeccable hospitality.. The breakfast was delicious and the cleanliness of the room and the bathrooms were excellent. Felt just like home! Loved our stay in it thanks to the friendly and helpful employes!

title: Friendly and Welcoming
review: After travelling for a month I wanted a comfortable, centrally located hotel in Istanbul for the last 2 nights of my adventure. This place was far more then just comfortable. The staff were very friendly, full of suggestions for my visit and the room itself was great - super comfy bed with monogrammed sheets no less and a fantastic bathroom with strong pressure shower (a welcome find after 2 weeks running around under Moroccan showers trying to get wet) and all the toiletries you need. The breakfast offered a tasty and extensive buffet. Thank you Rose Garden.

title: Excellent and hospitable!
review: We visited Istanbul in Nov 13....Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor....wasn't dissapointed.  Was welcomed by Celcut, the owner and manager. Really welcoming and friendly family run hotel. The location of the hotel is convenient as the Sultanahmet Mosque is a 5-10 min walk...and all other attractions are conveniently located.  The room was well presented, decorated in the ottoman theme. Rooms were clean, bed was comfy and the shower was awesome. (very large shower head) The only negative is that there is no lift, but that is not an issue as its not a bad climb.  Breakfast was good..staff was very friendly and welcoming and drinks were available throughout the day with locally sourced delicious biscuits.  Istanbul is an amazing City and would recommend…

title: not a 4 star hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Trip to Turkey
review: This hotel is at it's best a 2 start hotel but surely not a 4 star hotel. Rooms are poorly finished (paint job done really badly, staining on the ceiling, not even a pen to write, fridge not working, air conditioning not working and if so pretty useless and WiFi connection pretty bad apart from lobby) housekeeping is extremely quick and do not pay attention to details and forget to restock toiletries and did not change bed sheets during our 5 day stay. Breakfast is ok but nothing to die about, only juices in carton boxes if you want fresh squeezed orange juice you have to pay extra.  Good things was the bed and the free coffee facilities in the lobby. We wouldn't recommend anyone we know to stay there as they are clearly not bothered to create returning clientele there are much…

title: Beautiful Rooms, nice staff, in the old city's centre
review: The Hotel is very good and we had a very beautiful Time it was a very interesting and beautiful vacation in Turkey. The City has a lot of great buildings and the people are very friendly. The food was very good.We had a very nice Time in your Hotel. Thank you for all.

title: Great Location lovely Hotel
review: We stayed for five days in the nice hotel, that had a quiet courtyard, where you could nicely relax after sightseeing. Mr. Selcuk bey, guest relationship manager alwayes cared for our wishes. The rooms are wonderfully designed in ottoman style. We felt very comfortable.  All the sights worth to see are near Rose Garden Suits. Nevertheless the rooms are quiet. We will come back!

title: Friendly Staff and Nice Hotel
review: Stayed for four nights and we upgraded to The Sultan Suites large spacious rooms with massive beds and wet room. The Staff were all very helpful and friendly especially Setcuk Topcu (Guest Relations). The Hotel is so well located for the Old City,Grand Bazaar etc all within walking distance. We could not fault this Hotel the rooms were spotless lovely breakfasts eggs cooked to order every morning. We would definitely stay here again and would have no hesitation in telling our friends and family to book this Hotel when in Istanbul.

title: Excelent
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Very Pleasant Hotel to Stay
review: I had a very pleasant stay in Rose Garden Suits in Istanbul.  Staff are very friendly, Rooms are clean and tidy, service is superb, Quality of food served in hotel's restaurant is good. I strongly recommend it.

title: Great location, very friendly staff
review: We have stayed at this hotel for the past two days. Very clean room, comfortable and pleasant. The hotel staff are very friendly, curious, and accommodating. The location is very close to all tourist attractions in Istanbul, the hotel manager/ customer relation staff are always happy to make arrangements for you.

title: Charming & excellent central hotel with great character.
review: We really enjoyed our four-nights stay at the Rose Garden. The staff and manager were extremely helpful with giving directions. A 24-hour tea, coffee and cake service is available in the garden. The hotel is in central location with just 5-8 mins walk from the Blue Mosque.  Highly recommended!

title: Lovely place in the old city - staff could not do enough for you
review: This was ideal for our 3 nights in Istanbul. Rooms with a Turkish feel and ours overlooked the delightful patio garden. Walking distance to all the sites plus great restaurants in the vicinity as well. Really friendly staff who can help you plan where to go. Complimentary wine, coffee, tea and juice in the foyer/patio area, made our departure day a pleasant rest.

title: A great welcome and fantastic location!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. title: THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN ISTANBUL and for Honeymoon
review: What a gem this place is! Lovely welcome, friendly staff who respond quickly to requests. Nice clean rooms with great decor. Great little touches in the rooms, including complimentary toiletries, slippers, bath robes, fresh towels daily, mini bar and wine on arrival.   Excellent location for Sultanahmet and close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar and restaurants.   Make sure you take comfy walking shoes as I had to buy some there - you will be doing lots of walking!

title: Best in Istanbul
review: I will recommend this hotel to everyone who can afford it and if you cannot afford it you may save for the experience. We spend our Wedding NIght in The Rose Garden Suites. It was the best decission we could made. The rooms are fantastic. The hotel was full but the director and owner made an effort to accomodate us, so we stay in 3 different rooms. That's whay I can speak about rooms.  They were all fantastic with tasty furniture. We specially love the Hamman Bathroom with beatiful marble. The hotel staff is amazing from Bora to Mehmet the Night Manager who did everything to help us. It was like our family and refuge in Istambul. The breakfast is very good. It is so close to Hagya Sophia and the Blue Mosque. It is the best place we could dream of. They made every effort to make…

title: Like Family
review: This place was the best your money can get and the staff were amazing and ever so helpful. Mehmet was the night manger there and he was a diamond and so helpful. This hotel relaxes you as the rooms are immaculate and clean. I got the executive room and my wife really enjoyed it. This hotel is a traditional hotel and the best in this area. All the attractions are within a short walk too and when you want to remove yourself from the hustle bustle of a busy city come to Rose Garden Hotel. Honestly I felt like I was at home and the friendly staff made sure I left safely and ordered me a cab and Mehmet even spoke to the cab driver to make sure I do not get ripped off. By the way taxi fare is 45-50TL to Atarturk airport and it's 25 min drive. I will definitely go back to this hotel.…

title: Brilliant location and nice staff / Fantastisk beliggenhed og god service
review: its one of the most atmospheric hotels I have been to , the rooms are beautiful and clean , the people who work at the Rose Garden , are so nice and warm , just make you feel like you are in a family hotel .  the hotel is walking distance to the bazar  , and Aya Sophia Mosque .

title: cozy hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Greast place to stay in every way
review: Cozy hotel, picturesque rooms, delicious breakfasts, quality service. Hotel is located close to tourist attractions.Convenient to transportation. Repairs in the rooms is not fresh, but fairly clean. I liked it.

title: Nice place to stay for two nights
review: This hotel was super in every way. It has spacious and comfortable rooms, a superb restaurant facility, and best of all very helpful staff always willing to help. We stayed with friends for a 4 day break to get to know Istanbul, and were delighted. The location is ideal, just minutes away from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome and what for us seemed to be the centre of the city. A little further, but still walking distance are the grand bazaar and the Suleymanje mosque. Our room (we were upgraded to an executive suite) was delightful, spacious, with  an extremely large bed, and a Jacuzzi bath. The breakfasts were delicious. Overall we were really happy with the quality of our short holiday. Nothing is perfect, but our stay in the Rose Garden suites is as near perfect…

title: Wonderful place
review: Very nice place to stay in Istanbul, close to the center, but quiet.  We had one delicious meal at the restaurant the last evening.  It was our first trip to Istanbul, and the staff helps us with recommendations about what to do and where to find the easiest way to the marked.  We had computer access, and the food was nice. I would like to come back!

title: Just perfect!
review: Everything was nice. The room was comfortable, quiet and clean. Beakfast was perfect and service was great. And, at last, all the people of the hotel are very efficient and friendly. The hotel is very close to Blue Mosque and St Sophie.

title: Nearly Perfect
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent service
review: We took the executive room. It was very nice. Extremely spacious, tastefully furnished and decorated, very palatial looking room. Jacuzzi and floor heating in the bathroom were a nice added touch. The queen sized bed was supremely comfortable.  The morning buffet breakfast had an extremely wide selection of food including freshly made omelettes with fillings of choice.  The room rates online for the weekday was exception value at something around £70 per night. The weekend rates do shoot up however.  I only have a few minor quibbles. Firstly the wooden floor in the room was ever so slightly sticky, so it was not suitable to walk on in bare feet. Secondly our room was road facing so it wasn't pin drop silence, it was not loud by no means and it was really quiet after 11 pm but…

title: great customer service in great location
review: Good communication and great service. The room was spacious and comfortable with a lovely balcony. The staff were all reliable and patient. I left my coat in the room when I checked out and rushed to the airport. They first brought it to the airport, but I had no time to wait for my coat. So they send international delivery to the UK. I got my coat back very soon. I really appreciate their kind service.

title: Lovely hotel - very helpful and pleasant staff
review: Lovely hotel, cosy and homely, very clean.  Breakfast had fantastic selection, fresh fruit, olives, turkish style breakfast, breads, pastries, fruit juice cooked breakfast, the lot! Free tea, coffee, fruit and cake in the lounge area. Staff all very good, helpful and friendly, also speak good english. Location excellent for sultanahmet. Would recommend and would stay here again.

title: great hotel - greater staff
review: The hotel is in a great location, about 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque which is at the centre of the old town I believe. I went to meet a business partner in the jewellery district which was about 15 minutes walk from the hotel (very close to the Grand Bazaar). The room was a premium double room which was very comfortable, extremely clean (every part of the hotel) and the shower was nice and powerful with hot water always available. Electronic room safe was very easy to use too even though I felt very safe there.  There is a nice lounge area for guests and this leads out to their garden which doesn't have any grass but lots of flower pots. It's important to mention the staff because they were extremely helpful and all spoke great English (one of the men had spent several…

title: Excellent

title: Very Good hotel
review: Good day! Although i spent at the hotel quite a little time, i had a very good impression. The decor, service was on the top. The hotel is very comfortable and cozy. It is located nearby local sights Thank you very much. I will definitely stay at your hotel next visit. Sincerely, Zeil Abilgaziyeva.

title: Nice days at the heart of Istanbul
review: Visited this Good Hotel on weekends in January 2014. Hotel situated in historical place of old Istanbul. Sultanahmed square is only 10 min for a walk. Only one thing - travel from hotel to Blue Mosque always upstairs due to hotel location. But any way there is a good chance to make a sport) Hotel's staff is kind and friendly, prices were adequate for such year season. I booked penthouse its little bit bigger that other rooms.  I recommend this hotel! Thank you.  Sergey

title: Fabulous boutique hotel
review: We had a memorable stay in Rose Garden...A fantastic experience in a beautiful hotel with nice people(Cecluk and all the team were really GREAT!!!)  Good service, nice rooms, a great restaurant and a lovely atmosphere...

title: Location Charm Comfort
review: A fantastic boutique hotel within walking distance of all the great attractions in Istanbul.   The rooms are decorated in perfect ottoman styles with fresh scented sheets and the best beds ever!.  The staff were perfect hosts in being friendly and extremely accommodating.  Nothing was too much trouble (even when we had some printing issues).   We arrived a little early for our check in and were invited to help ourselves to the breakfast buffet while waiting. Will definitely be returning to Turkey and staying at the Rose Garden again.  Wonderful hotel and highly recommended as one of the best.

title: Feel at home in Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Hidden Gem ın Sultanahmet Grand Bazar Area
review: From the moment we were met at the airport and then arrived to the warm welcome of Selcuk at Rose Garden Suites, we knew we had made a great choice. We couldn't fault this hotel. The service from all staff was excellent , always helpful, courteous and friendly. The restaurant was great with a lovely atmosphere and decor. Water, tea, coffee and fresh cake were available throughout the day. The rooms were lovely , beautifully decorated and clean and comfortable.The bustle of Sultanahmet  is easy walking distance from the hotel, and yet it feels calm and protected in the hotel. Don't hesitate to book this hotel..it is perfect!

title: Excellent location and staff
review: Very frıendly staff and extra touches that make your stay here enjoyable and stress free. If you want the experience of Sultans, you may want to request the super-sized bed, wıth ıts own Turkısh Bath. Extra touches and many freebies. A very decent breakfast, full of cold & hot optıons, to fuel your busy sıghtseeing schedule.     (5 Donna)

title: Welcome and enjoy
review: All membres of the staff have been that kind and professional. Specials thanks to MR. Selcuk for his welcoming. The hotel is so well situated : 5 mn walk from the main historical and touristic places of Sultanahmet area). Not that far from the old harbor where you can have delicious Fish meals ...

title: Very comfortable and great location.
review: What a nice day when i came there. All of them are welcome to me. It's a pleasure to stay there.  There was also a free time to eat a fruit and it was free. So i was interesting to stay there. For all who has a plan to go to istanbul in the future, maybe you can stay here

title: Absolutely wonderful
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great Stay @ Rose Garden Suites
review: We stayed for 3 nights at the Rose Garden. Very nice room (top of stairs 403) Breakfast was included, buffet style and plentiful. Coffee/tea, breads, fresh fruit yogurt, cereal etc. The staff are pleasant and very helpful, Selcuk is wonderful and can give you directions to just about everywhere. The hotel is situated nicely in Sultanahmet ,  you can walk to most everywhere, or take the tram or Metro.  Excellent shopping and sightseeing, plenty of restaurants.  We felt very safe walking about, although our leg were pretty tired after a day of this.  There are some hills, so if you have mobility issues you might want to take a taxi.  We will definitely return.

title: Fantastic accommodations and service!
review: Often, a hotel property can be cold and inhumane; just a room with a bathroom to wash away the day's travel blues and a bed to rest one's laurels. Rose Garden Suites' plus point comes in the form of a great host by the name of Selçuk, the property's Guest Relations Manager, a professional masterclass that not only made our stay at Rose Gardens Suites feel like home, but also a great gentleman with a wealth of experience and information as remarkable as his most enigmatic and beautiful Istanbul.  Although my other half and I were earlier checked-into the most basic and smallest room at Rose Garden Suites (which we booked) by his colleagues, Selçuk was kind enough to upgrade us to the Traditional Room (No. 115) complete with a 4 posted bed and a 24hr-heated hammam bathroom that…

title: nice
review: My wife and I had a wonderful trip to Istanbul, in no small measure, as a result of our stay at the Rose Garden Suites. The room was spotless, modern and very comfortable. The staff provided personalized service and went out of their way to make sure our stay was memorable. Ramazon was a particularly wonderful staff person and helped arrange everything from specialized excursions to advice on unusual and unforgettable locations in Istanbul, itself. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel!

title: Astounding Rose Garden Hotel, Istanbul
review: Rose Garden is a beautiful and fascinated hotel. It is characterized by very helpful and friendly staff and good location. Breakfast could be limited but you can asking for more variety and they will prepare it for you. Everything was fine especially the traditional turkish bath in the room. Anyhow Istanbul is a great city and Turkish people are so kind so nice and polite, I like them all.

title: Another great stay!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Very good hotel and kind staff
review: Second time was as good as the first. Good to see the hotel staff maintaining the warm freindly atmosphere. Was great to see the familiar faces. Selçuk always welcoming as ever :))  Definately will be my choice every time i am in istanbul

title: Attentive service
review: Good location, near the historic area. We stayed 5 nights in a very good and clean hotel room at the third floor. Very kind staff in all locations. A delicious breakfast buffé. We love to come back to Istanbul and stay at Rose Garden Suites ones again.

title: Wonderful hotel
review: The Rose Garden hotel is a great base from which to explore Istanbul. The service was attentive, informative and helpful. Their recommendations, excellent, the room comfortable and nothing seemed too much effort.

title: Great place to stay
review: The hotel is perfectly located in he historic area, and only a few minutes walk to lots of interesting attractions. The staff is always friendly, smiling and very serviceminded. The room was perfectly clean and everything worked without any problems at all. The restaurant is also extremely friendly and serves very good local food. Absolutely a hotel we can recommend and would love to come back to.

title: Great Boutique Hotel Near All the Historic Sites!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice location to discover Istanbul
review: This hotel is in an excellent location! It is in the historic core of Istanbul. It is a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, The grand Bazaar, etc. The staff was excellent! The Service was great. The included breakfast was outstanding! Nino who supervises the breakfast was particularly outstanding! As others have pointed out, there are a number of Mosques nearby. The early morning call to prayer will likely wake you up!

title: wonderful stay
review: We stood in the hotel for one week. Very quiet place nearby all main attractions in Istanbul. Good breakfast with great service by Nino and Hatice. Other hotel staff friendly and very helpfully also. Recomendable hotel! Eduardo

title: Rose Garden Suites
review: We had a wonderful stay at Rose Garden suites. It was a cosy and quiet little spot in the old town of Istanbul. The staff was smiling and very helpfull. The rooms where fine with and had a  touch of the old osman style. We would like to come back some day :-)

title: Excellent stay in Istanbul
review: Excellent service and value for money. Room was large but windows were very small so no natural light. Breakfast was very good.                                                                                                               Good location except the roads were very steep which was a bit tiresome on the legs (not the fault of the hotel though).

title: Beautiful rooms and friendly staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Amazing place to stay
review: We had a wonderful stay at Rose Garden Suites and were treated like royalty by the staff, nothing was too much trouble for them.Great location for all the sights, we walked everywhere and saw everything.Our room with balcony was beautifully appointed , clean and comfortable with a super efficient and spacious shower. Highly recommended.

title: Comfortable, easy and friendly
review: We really enjoyed our stay in Rose Garden Suites, the hotel location is amazing, steps away from the Hippodrome at Sultanahmed. The staff was very friendly, Mr. Salcuk was very helpful and made us feel at home. The hotel is very clean and the staff are friendly. The hotel is basically 2 buildings joint together by a terrace where tea, coffee, and cookies are served all day for free.  I would definitely stay in this hotel next time I visit Istanbul.

title: Great location for first visit to Istanbul
review: My stay at Rose Garden Suites was close to perfect! The hotel is close to attractions without being  in the thick of it. Easy to get around by foot and tram. My arrival and check in was well handled by Selcuk. He provided a map, directions and recommendations. Bora waived a fee for my date change which I really appreciate, thank you! The deluxe balcony room was perfect for me, the bed comfortable, good shower, all basic amenities included. The view of the garden was  and the call to prayer enhanced my experience. It is loud as there is a mosque very close by, but if you close the balcony door it's fine. Breakfast was a highlight. Delicious assortment of food, loved the borek and cheeses. Definitely worth it. The bell staff were quite helpful and smiley. I left my new leather…

title: Fantastic
review: I loved the customer care more than anything. The Front Desk Management was exceptionally kind. I was in Isanbul for a few days on a solo trip, and found the location in Sultanhamet, near the Haggia Sophia very good.

title: I felt like I was with family!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent!
review: The staff of this establishment are awesome!! but first, a little bit about the place.  The Hotel is split between two buildings and there is a terraced plaza between the two housing the restaurant and providing areas to sit back and relax.  I had the impression the hotel is a family run establishment.  They care about your experience and make every effort to accommodate your needs.  I stayed 5 days in late Sept. the first day I met Nino, who is an outgoing member of the restaurants serving staff.  I should say I think she is one of the core personnel of that staff, I know for a fact that she stayed working through dinner one night and she was back at work before I woke up the next morning.  She welcomed me to breakfast every day though! Bora gave me some great tips on things to…

title: way better than other 4-star big chain hotels
review: Everything was just perfect in this hotel! Some detail like the wifi not working well in the bedroom, but excellent people. We were leaving the hotel at 4am and they offered us to get us breakfast at that time! That made us melt... I recommend it. It is very nice and quiet, with a location with walking distance from everywhere!

title: Super!
review: Our family spent six nights in Istanbul recently: three nights at Rose Garden (for its great location in the old city) and three nights at a major 4-star chain hotel (for my conference). Rose Garden wins the contest in every possible dimension. The room is clean and cozy; wifi is fast and everywhere; food is fresh and healthy; zero hidden charge and lots of free goodies including coffee / snack / wine tasting. Most importantly, the staff is super nice, making you feel that you are staying with a family. The hotel is conveniently located with 6 out of the top 10 Istanbul attractions within 20-min walk away. In addition, the hotel can arrange for additional tours. Overall, it is a great home base for exploring Istanbul that I strongly recommend to everyone.

title: Very friendly boutique hotel
review: Clean friendly hotel. Close to Sutlanahemt neighborhood, Blue Mosque, and Hagia Sophia. Rooms were very original, complementary tea and snack were available 24 hrs a day. Breakfast was also good, not a great deal of variety but fresh and tasty. Also has a very sweet garden where you can escape after a long day of sight seeing, while drinking you complementary tea and snack.

title: Sweet memory
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm.
