title: Fantastic
review: I am experienced traveller and frankly can say that you will be pleased to stay in this hotel and sweet memory about its wonderful atmosphere will be with you for long time. Excellent location+flexible service, very responsive staff, friendly surrounding - all these make Rose Garden  Hotel very cosy place where you want to return again. All staff do their best, among them always helpful Nino, Aref and others. All will be done with first words. Strongly recommend this hotel for thouse who appreciate excellence!

title: A really good choice
review: We were recommended this hotel by a Turkish friend who lives in Izmir who always stays here when in Istanbul. We were not disappointed. All the staff were attentive and so helpful. Previous reviews have praised Nino who oversees breakfast - I can only agree - she is one of the most hard working and friendly people I have ever met whilst on holiday, always pleased to make Turkish coffee and tea or anything else required. The hotel is in an excellent location, very clean, friendly, and quiet. Minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and other old city attractions. We had a room out of the main building with a small balcony - it was very quiet - no problems with noise from the road (see previous reviews).  Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to friends and family.

title: Great stay at rosz garden and very close to most sightseeing in istanbul
review: The hotel is nice, the garden a pleasure and the staff really helpful and friendly. All people working there are really great. The location is good, the room was spacious and the breakfast more than satisfying.There is some noise from the main street (mainly people talking late at night) but I guess that's Istanbul. Overall a really good choice.

title: Best location and breakfast
review: This hotel is very clean . The employees are very nice and helpful. I would recommend this hotel. Its just few mins walk from the blue mosque,ayatsofia, tokapi palace and the grand bazaar. The breakfast is nice...and nino is so helpful; whatever u need she will help you. Istanbul is a beautiful city with so much history and recommend walking to places you will discover old buildings that havent been touched/destroyed and get a better experience.

title: Rosy & Cozy Beautiful Hotel - FJK Paris
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Beautiful & Cozy Hotel with an Incredible Staff
review: I stayed at Rose Garden Suites and my two daughters at Garden House for 3 days in August 2013. It is a great hotel with elegant rooms and very comfortable beds. The hotel is very close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar, and many other museums and mosques, like many other hotels in Sultanahmet. What makes Rose Garden Suites is unique the people serving there are very welcoming, friendly, and serve you beyond duty, worth to mention Selcuk, Arif, Ramazan, and the tall bellboy from Diyarbakir--I forgot the name. The garden lobby for breakfast  (included), cocktail, nightcap, and reading our books with free cold drinks, tea and coffee and a few other goodies really adds a lot to the character and contort of the hotel. We had a wonderful stay and enjoyed Istanbul with…

title: the stuff are so co-operative… we felt we r at home !
review: Really one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in all around: the atmosphere is beautiful with the Ottoman-style furniture and decorations, and has this very relaxing (and also beautiful) garden in the middle of both buildings where a delicious, varied, and included breakfast is served every morning, where free water, juice, and snacks are available all day, and where other drinks and food are available for purchase during the rest of the day. As other reviewers have said, the hotel and its staff take great care in their work, as shown by their around-the-clock help, attention to detail, and overall friendliness and attitude. Every staff member was amazing! Special shout out to Ramazan and Selçuk ... but really, a great hotel if you're looking to stay in the heart of the Golden…

title: Great stay at the Rose Garden Istanbul
review: the garden is so relaxing  the breakfast is turkiah , simple and delicious . the organizer Nino of it also so sweet and helpful . i liked also the free of charge cookies , fruits and dirnks in the garden

title: dani& CRISTINA
review: The Rose Garden was such a warm ,welcoming, secure place to stay in Istanbul.  It felt very homey for my entire family.  The rooms were all uniquely decorated, and the bed linens very comfortable and of high quality.   The bathrooms spacious and nicely marbled.  It was a very comforting respite from traveling to have complimentary beverages and snacks available during the day.   The location was supreme at about 5 minutes walking distance from the square, yet very quiet for sleeping at night.  The staff made special effort to connect with each of my children,  Ramazan knew them each by name!  If Visiting Istanbul, I would stay here again.

title: A Tranquil Oasis in Bustling Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Hotel in great location
review: On our recent trip to turkey we stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.  It is in an excellent location, a short walk from the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and other attractions in the Old City.  The staff are friendly and our room was a delight.  We appreciated how quiet and peaceful the hotel seemed with lovely cool trees on the patio.

title: Very Good Experience Overall
review: We spent seven nights in the suite which was beautifully decorated and spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful, walking distance to all major attractions and many restaurants to choose from. Breakfast was beautifully presented in the Garden terrace. Special thanks to Niño and Selcuk. Jan & Ross - Perth, West Australia

title: Fabulous friendly hotel
review: This is a nice hotel, with good staff looking after you. We highly recommend the garden house suites, 2nd levels especially. The staff were very nice to us, always helping us, with Nino being a great host for the breaksfast ( plenty to pick from on a nice buffet) and Ulas being ever so helpful in moving your bags and helping with any other requirements you may need.  Conciierges are also very helpful and do their best ti make you feel comfortable. The rooms are comfortable as well, again recommend the Garden House lower rooms esecially  The locationisquite good too, not far fromBlue Mosque , Grand Bazaar or Cistern. You can get there by walking 10 - 20 minutes max  Overall, a very good hotel and a highly recommendable place to stay!

title: Perfect!
review: This is a great small hotel within walking distance of the Blue Mosque. The rooms are beautifully decorated, spotless, with attention to detail. The buffet breakfast was fabulous, as were the complimentary tea/coffee and cakes in the afternoon. All the staff were friendly and helpful with special thanks to Nino and Ramazan.

title: An oasis of calm and beauty
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: My wife and I recently stayed here. We loved everything about it. Our room was large and comfortable, the breakfast (included) was the best we had in Turkey and the staff was so friendly and helpful. We especially appreciated talking to Nino, the woman in the dining area. It reminded me that great travel experiences are not about only seeing the sights but meeting the people. Each afternoon, tea and juice and cookies were put out in the outdoor dining area.  Easy walk to everything touristy.  Only caution: Even though we had reservations, the first day the reception clerk tried to put us in the "schmuck" room - a tiny 5th floor walk-up. Every hotel has a "schmuck" room, every restaurant a "schmuck" table - don't accept them!

title: Excellent Hotel
review: The hotel is beautiful inside and outside with well-appointed rooms, a flowered courtyard for breakfast, and all located in a quiet, peaceful neighborhood. The rooms are well air-conditioned,  and the beds are very comfortable. The breakfast was a delicious spread of Turkish salads and made-to-order eggs. Our hostess for breakfast, Nino, was courteous, friendly, and helpful each morning. We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and return ourselves in future visits to Istanbul.

title: Rose Garden Suites Istanbul is a rare delight
review: We had a wonderful stay at Rose Garden Suites.  Selcuk, the manager was very welcoming when we arrived and took time to go through various tour options available.  The room was lovely with very comfortable beds and a rainfall shower head.  The staff were all very helpful and the location was great - very close to Blue Mosque.  Would highly recommend it to others.

title: A delight
review: We frequently travel through Turkey, Russia and Central Asia and have found that the Rose Garden Suites Hotel in Sultanamet District in Istanbul is one of those small independent hotels that is overflowing with quality and comfort.  The staff are highly professional, efficient and endlessly attentive and kind.  The hotel itself is like an oasis of cool calm in the midst of the bustling city.  There is an expansive inner garden that is open all day for hotel guests.  In the garden there are always complimentary cold or hot drinks, delicate sweets, fresh fruit and an array of snacks for the weary traveler.  The staff are particularly generous with their assistance and positive outlook.  In the garden area Nino and Ramazan greet all guests with consistent warmth and efficiency. …

title: Good Hotel in Nice City
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: its perfect
review: Rose Garden Suites location is very good. You can walk Grand Bazaar or Blue Mosque in two minutes. The rooms are wide and spacious. Staff were very helpful. They do what you want. Also rooms are designed by similar to Ottoman Architecture. When you walk in the lobby or garden, you go back to the old ottoman times. If you stay in sultan rooms, you feel like a real sultan because of the good service, good room and interested staff. If you like history like me, Rose Garden Suites are the best choice for you. There aren`t any hotel better than Rose Garden Suites.

title: A Real Gem in the Middle of the Historical Penisula
review: The best hotel in Sultanahmet , it was my first trip in Istanbul , definitely i can say that i was pleased with this hotel. Location was so appropriate with visiting historical places. Finally staff was very recpective

title: Excellent stay in the Old city centre of Istanbul!
review: I am just returning back from my trip to Turkey. Last three days we stayed at this beautiful boutique hotel. It is incredible. It is conveniently located close to all Old Bazaar, Hagia Sophia an Topkapi Palace. Rooms are decorated in the old Ottoman Palace style and are maintained in perfect condition. In the midst of a crowded city, it allows one to relax and have tasty cookies at  any time under the shadow of gorgeous trees in the garden. Breakfast buffets and restaurant menu is something not to miss. I truly enjoyed the friendship and service of Niño and Yasin who were ready to serve you at any time.

title: perfect location for exploring old city, good value for money
review: This was our first visit to Istanbul and we found this hotel to be in a great location, a few mins walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace etc; at the same time, it's not far away from the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market and Eminonu ferryboat terminal.  The hotel staff were superb, notably Faris, Selcuk, Ramazan, Bora, Arif, Nino, Vlas, Suat and Yakup. Upon arrival they helped us  with our lugagge, so the lack of elevator is absolutely no problem; also the garden setting is great, they have a very nice selection of traditional Turkish food and coffee for breakfast, including seasonal fresh fruits. Overall the food was excellent and the facilities were top class, we definitely recommend this place!

title: Close to everything
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great location and service
review: We had 3 nights at this hotel in August 2013.  The staff were very friendly, helpful and professional.  The location was brilliant, just a few minutes walk away from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia.  From the entrance we walked through the breakfast area and then down some steps into a courtyard, our room was in a building off courtyard, so we then had some steps going up, but it didn't bother us; there were other rooms leading from street level.  Our room was clean and well equipped, the balcony looked out onto the courtyard.  Air conditioning worked really well thank goodness!  The breakfast was fantastic and easily set us up till lunch time, there were complementary nibbles and drinks during most of the day in the breakfast area.

title: Too many stairs!
review: We were only there for a few days but the service and location was very useful. The room was clean and well presented. Breakfast was delicious and the staff were very helpful. Would definitely return.

title: Lovely small Boutique Hotel near Istanbul Sights
review: We chose this hotel from the internet as somewhere interesting and different to experience on our second trip to Istanbul.  It promised an outside area and rooms with balconies.  Whilst the staff were very nice, we felt disappointed that we were in a room many steps down through a fairly ordinary outside area, then up another floor of narrow steps to an ordinary room.  Thank heavens for the poor guy hauling two heavy suitcases up.  Breakfast was an extraordinary selection of dolmades, meats, cheeses, breads and no cereal.   The place is in a fairly ordinary section of Sultanahmet on a hill.  Just not as it was advertised, and certainly not as good as the Sultanahmet Palace where we stayed previously.  I missed the views of the sea and the room was very ordinary.  Staff were…

title: Nice and quite Hotel in the heart of Istanbul
review: We have found this boutique hotel after 15 min of searching by foot on the narrow streets of Istanbul. As we entered inside, I thought that I had made a mistake to choose this location: the reception was in a small room at the entrance. In 2 minutes I have change my opinion because the staff acted professional  like in a big 5* hotel.  They have a bellman too. There are two different buildings. After we checked in, room service brought us a "welcome plate" of fresh cherries and apricots. The room (213) was big enough, with a small balcony to the garden. The walls of the room needs small color repairs. Before I had started the air condition, it was a "grandma  smell" inside this room - maybe from the carpet. The bed was high and  has a Queen size good quality mattress. The…

title: Turkish Hospitality at its best!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Be careful - the website photos can be deceptive
review: We stayed at Rose Garden Suites for 2 night's in July 2013.  I can honestly say, the only disappointment was the fact that we did not stay longer!  From the moment we arrived we were made to feel at home by the friendly & attentive staff.  Our room was one of the Suites set aside from the main building next to the well kept Hotel Rose Garden. Immaculately kept & maintained the room itself was decorated tastefully to an Ottoman theme. Excellent Bathroom /Shower & the Bed was fit for a Sultan! Very Comfy! Breakfast was included in the rate & again i can only say good things. A more than ample selection & it was all delicious! Despite our awkward arrival & departure times the Staff were so accommodating, & we were offered complimentary early check in & a late check out.  Thank you…

title: Relaxing oasis amidst a throng of activity
review: The location is pretty good and this hotel has some good features, including a peaceful central garden and friendly, helpful staff. We had 5 nights at the beginning of our Turkey trip and a final night at the end.  Our gripe is that we booked a superior balcony room based on an internet photo and the room we were allocated for our five night stay was not to the same standard. It was much smaller, less appealing in decoration and generally disappointing, even though the bed itself was comfortable. Because of a significant birthday, we'd opted to fork out extra money for this property over the property recommended by our travel agent - we wanted something special. Shortly after getting to our room, I spoke to the duty manager and explained that the room was not what we had…

title: Feel like my home
review: It seems that this hotel is a bit further away from the main sightseeing attractions, but in fact, it is very close by once you work out how to navigate the backstreets (which isn't too hard). The garden area makes a welcome relief for sun or shade, which ever you wish, and the different levels of hotel, restaurant and suites makes it a more interesting setting. we stayed in suites and were very pleased with the quietness (even with a room facing the breakfast area, i heard little sound, and I am a light sleeper). The rooms are large and comfortable and the staff are very friendly and super helpful (thanks especially to Ramazan and Selcuk). The food is quite reasonable (breakfast and snacks) and the beer is cold. Nice touches of free water, fruit and biscuits to help yourself.

title: great place to stay
review: Close to all Main Attraktions,  Helpful staffs, big& cleaned room with balcony. Mr. Ramazan is helpful service staff. After Sightseeing i,m refreshed myself with coffee and some fresh fruits  in lovely& charming Garden. Instead of Swimming Pool i spent the wonderful and relaxing Time with Good Book in Lovely Garden.

title: small and sweet hotel with very good sevices
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Boutique hotel is a garden of eden
review: as me and wife we went to Paris by Turkish air,  while returning to Mumbai we stopped TURKEY and stayed at this rose garden hotel ,checked in on 27th June and checked out on 1st of July, we found from  front desk to restaurant ,to food plus 24 hour tea/coffee ,every thing was perfect ,At front desk Mr Bora,Selchuk,and other two ,i don't know the names,special y when you go for your Morning breakfast,the lady making omelet to girl NINO was very helpful, I don't know when we will be going again to Turk y , but even if we will go we will prefer to stay at this hotel, Even the owner of the Hotel Mr AZIZ is visiting regularly and taking review of every guest C K Malhotra

title: Great Service and convenient location.
review: We are just finishing our stay at the Rose Garden Suites.  The Suites are connected to a main hotel across a courtyard. The rooms are spotlessly maintained, with all the little touches that make this feel like home.  Our stay was in two parts, about 7 nights total, broken up by a couple of nights in Selcuk.    Breakfasts were great, in true Turkish style with an a plus of an omelet chef who was consistent.  Also great were the simple but elegant wine and cheese hours (6:30 to 7:30 many days).  Sitting in the garden after a long days' touring was wonderful.  For all the other plusses, probably the best thing about the hotel is the staff.  Arif, the reservation manager, was extraordinarily kind and vigilant.  Whatever you need - he'll get.  But it doesn't stop there.  Boris at the…

title: Old World Charm - Loved it!
review: The staff was very helpful and hospitable. They had daily breakfast with someone cooking fresh eggs of your choice! We stayed there three nights; and our room was located around the courtyard so in the mornings we could hear cutlery (people must be having breakfast) and there are seating area outside our rooms Which can be quite noisy when the neighbours are out having a good time. All in all, it has been a good stay, good location and great service.

title: A rare find
review: This hotel won me over within 5 minutes of entering the lobby.  Wonderfully warm, friendly, helpful staff; beautifully appointed rooms and public areas with old-world charm; airy, welcoming, comfortable lounge area with ample refreshments; pretty and shady garden area to sit in; comfortable, beautifully decorated room with lovely toiletries, fresh fruit, and exceptionally comfortable bed and linens...I could go on!  On a practical note, location very convenient, good wifi included, reasonably priced.  We will return, hopefully soon :)

title: A nice friendly place in the heart of Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A little hotel with a big heart
review: Strategically located in Sultanameht (the old part of Istanbul) this hotel is at walking distance from all the main historic attractions of the city and the best shopping bazaars. It is surrounded by restaurants and cafes and the staff is very attentive and friendly. The hotel has free wi-fi in all the rooms and a nice garden where to sit and relax after a good day of walking around the city drinking some Turkish wine. I definitely recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Istanbul.

title: A lovely small hotel.
review: We found a friendly welcome at the reception desk when we arrived, and it went on from there. All the staff are really friendly and helpful, and they each know just what they have to do and get on with it cheerfully. They are specially good with children. The rooms are full of character and quite different, but each is prepared and maintained to the same high standard. There are complimentary refreshments constantly available in the lounge, and a charming courtyard with lovely trees and flowers. Breakfast is a delight, and just as relaxed as everything else. Nino, if you are reading this, thanks to you and your colleagues for everything! A home from home in the heart of the old city, just a stroll away from top attractions like the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, etc. We'll come…

title: Could'nt fault it if i tried hard!
review: As many other reviewers have noted, this is a lovely place to stay in Istanbul's old city.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet is expansive and delicious.  We checked in early in the morning, after one night at a nearby hotel that turned out to be a disappointment.  The porter from Rose Garden Suites walked with us to the other hotel and helped carry our bags back, and the manager insisted that we have breakfast there even though it was the morning before we would be sleeping at the hotel.  The location is perfect, just a short walk from the Blue Mosque and other major sights.  We were very happy to be able to stay here.

title: Great place for family, friends or just about anybody.
review: Booked the hotel over the net. On check in was met by warm, freindly hotel staff (selcuk) who instantly made us feel at home and gave us an upgrade on the room i booked, the executive superior. It was  spacious, with windows that opened, air con, big bathroom, parkay floor and a complimentary bottle of red wine :) The hotel location is ideal.. A few minutes walking distance from the blue mosque, aya sophia and the bazaar. The terrace garden is great to chill before a night out or a night cap. This is definately one of my fav spots in the old city. Truley thank all the hotel staff that made our stay a memorable experience. Thank you!

title: A great option if you want to stay in Sultanahmet
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: I wish more hotels were like this one!
review: We booked this hotel based on the reviews and location and weren't disappointed at all. The staff are extremely helpful and rooms clean and well appointed. They give complimentary tea and coffee / biscuits throughout the day which is a great extra touch. Especially when combined with a nice little patio garden area where you can sit and enjoy it in your afternoon break. A couple of minor issues for us were - 1) we had a room on the 3rd floor and there was no lift. Wasn't a big deal for us. But potentially something worth noting. 2) we had a large room but there was a large restricted height portion which meant my husband restricted himself to one side of the room and also, the windows were tiny and high up so we had no view of anything outside. If I had to pay anymore than I did…

title: possitive
review: I loved everything about this place. When we arrived we were greated warmly. The room was very big compared to other hotels I've stayed at recently, with a very large comfortable bed. The room and grounds were spotless. The staff was great, Selcuk was always saying hello and asking if we needed anything. The breakfast was great, omelets made, tons of juices, local specialities, coffees and breads. The location was perfect. 2 minute walk from everything - hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, metro. And for being in the center of everything it was completely peaceful and comfortable and safe. I thought the the value of the room exceeded what I paid. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would recommend and stay again.

title: Excellent location and much better attention from hotel staff
review: Great for turism an business. People at reception are always friendly taking care for all details. lovely location in a historical atmosphere. Will do it again.Upon arrival Selcuk got us refreshments and sat down with us to review what we wanted to do in Istanbul and how he could help.

title: Amazing Vacation
review: Great for turism an business. People at reception are always taking care for all details. I.e. last day I had to leave very early to airport and they prepared take away breakfast for me. They made my time there a very good experience

title: Perfect hotel in a wonderful location with great staff.
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great location
review: As a female travelling alone to Istanbul on business I picked this hotel based on previous reviews recommending the helpfulness of staff and warm welcome; I was not disappointed! I was given a welcome tour of the hotel on arrival, and shown to my lovely room with Turkish bathroom. I had to work but had an evening and morning off, so asked for recommendations: the manager was brilliant and gave me a map and different options on what to do. He also booked me a great waking tour for the morning, which was reasonably priced and enabled me to see lots in the short time I was there. I had a glass of wine in the evening and also lunch there the following day, and both times I was made to feel welcome and secure. Breakfast was also great, with a variety of Turkish foods to try as well…

title: Comfortable, central and quiet hotel
review: Staff couldn't be more helpful, and the hotel is in a great location for the historic sites.   We asked for a room with a bath - there was a bit of cultural miscommunication as the room we were given had a Turkish bath which we couldn't use anyway as they had turned it off five days previously because it was only open in the winter.   Room was fine, there was a complimentary bottle of wine and some fruit in the room which was nice.   There was an unpleasant smell in the bathroom: to counter this they placed toilet roll over the drains (which I didn't notice on the first night and caused me to almost flood the bathroom). They also kept putting the bath mat back on the shelf every day after it had been used which was a little bit unpleasant.   Overall, good value for money based…

title: Home like
review: Booked this through internet and it was a very good choice. Very friendly and helpful staff, clean and cosy rooms (newly renovated but in old style). Good breakfast. Nice backyard where you can relax and I guess can have breakfast when weather allows (we were in March - still cold). Many of the historical attractions are in walking distance.   Would go there again and recommend this definitely to others.

title: Lovely Hotel with fantastic staff
review: The breakfast for starters was amazing, when I got back from traveling around Turkey I stayed there a second time and they gave a free upgrade which I deeply appreciated. The service was very home like, the fact that the hotel is very small makes it very cozy.

title: Perfect Little Hotel for City Break
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: well located city central boutique hotel
review: All the positives other people have commented on are true!  The hotel is comfortable, clean, pretty quiet, easy walking distance from the sites, great breakfast and wonderful, helpful, friendly, accommodating staff.

title: Sensational!
review: This was our first stay in Istanbul and we chose this hotel based on location/cost and review and were every pleased with our choice. The hotel is on a multi level and our room overlooked the restaurant and garden. The room was fairly large with complementary wine and fruit. the place has a homely feel to it and the staff are very courteous and helpful. It was a bit difficult to find by foot among the myriad of streets of this area,but it a short walk from all the major attractions especially impressive being the Grand Biazzar.

title: Felt like home!
review: My boyfriend and me had great holidays im the garden house hotel..  The hotel is perfectly located to discover the town..  Nice and helpful stuff and phenomenal rooms..we were welcomed with a delicious fruit basket and a bottle of turkish red wine...  I will certainly come again!! Thxs to Rosegarden Suites:-)

title: Great stay
review: We stayed here with my mom  for 9 days (2-10 february 2013) in 111 room.  What can I say... Hotel perfectly located - 5 minutes to hippodrome, around 10 minutes walking to all the major destinations (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace). 15 minutes walk to Sultanahmet tram station. Our room was very elegant (you can see our photos). We were greeted with bottle of wine and basket of fruits.  All the stuff was very friendly, helpful and smiling. On arriving we were immediately informed about the best ways to get to all the destinations,  we wanted to visit (manager even gave us good city map). Breakfast was super! There were fruits, cheese, breads, cakes, juice, corn flakes with dried fruits; also olivas and pickled pepper, omelette which you can order with…

title: Lovely hotel in excellent location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Home from home
review: We spent 3 wonderful days in Istanbul at the Rose Garden Suites. The location was terriffic, just minutes away from some of the main sights and great restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful, even accompany me to the shop when I realized in the evening that I need to buy toothpaste. The room was lovely and spotless. We enjoyed sitting in the lobby with complementary coffee and cookies. It will definitely be my favorite hotel for trips to Istanbul.

title: Rose Garden Istanbul - Brilliant
review: Perfect location.  Staff were very friendly.  The staff suggested tours that were excellent and good value.  They organised an excellent tour guide name 'z', whose knowledge and personality made the day most remember-able. Serving an excellent breakfast, with complementary water, tea, coffee and delicious cookies.

title: Tareq and Shireen 7 days stay
review: We had the best time in Istanbul thanks too the Ayhan and the staff at the Rose Garden, nothing was to much trouble, restaurant recommendation, how to get around , where to buy the best Turkish sweets. The room was spacious, spotless and comfortable. The location is perfect, just 3 minutes walk  the the hippodrome ( The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace), and the hub of Sultanahmet and from there the tram will take you almost anywhere. We will be back that's a promise.

title: Brilliant
review: Location- historic: very close to the hippodrome ..where blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkappi Palace all together..you just walk from the hotel for 3 minutes and you'll get into those best historical places of Istanbul  Location- as a place to stay in: if you're looking for a sightseeing, historic, traditional trip .. this is definetly the No#1 hotel - - but, if you're looking for the loud stay and sophisticated 5stars hotels with their bars and night clubs.. you shuoldn't come to Rose Graden!  Staff: they are super super friendly , smiling and helpfull .. manager offered us a great help, showing us the map and where -how to go here and there :))) THANX!  Rooms: we stayed at the executive suite - which is spacious with jaccuzzi in the bathroom- luxurious , warm , calm, exactly…

title: Definetly the best.good locaition.so friendly and elegant stuf.lovely classic Turkish style rooms.Highly recomend.
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Good hotel
review: We stayed in Rose Garden couple of times.it has been always the first choice for us when we sateyed in Istanbul. .easy to find from the airport.almost in the center of Sultanahmet.good thing is, it is not right in the city,quiet and peacefull locaition and 2 minutes walk to center.large rooms and each room we staeyed were really pretty.rose wood furnitures,private Turkish bath,large bad.i can highly recomend.

title: A unique boutique hotel, very friendly staff
review: We stayed a couple nights in this hotel in January. In priciple, this is rather good hotel with some imperfections. We liked the room (we got bigger suite for the same price), normal breakfast (nothing excpetional though), good furniture, nice bed. However, some stuff was not perfect - location is not easy to find for taxi drivers (our driver was searching like 10 minutes driving around and asking everybody on the streets, though it was rather late, after midnight already), no elevator to our third floor with rather steep steps, a little far location from th emain street, and not so good sound isolation from outside, especially annoying were cryes of muezzin from the nearby mosque at 6:30 in the morning or so. But I guess that those cryes would be heard at every other nearby…

title: great overall experience
review: Stayed once for 5 nights during the summer with my wife, kids and mum and very recently for one night on a business trip...  the terrace, complimentary water, tea, coffee and cakes throughout the day, and the very friendly staff led by Mr Celcuk make you feel at home and treated in a very priviledged way.

title: A fantastic boutique hotel
review: A really nice little hotel which exceeded our expectations - and we travel alot  - room we stayed in had a great hammam sized batroom  -great breakfast with traditional and european options ( e.g turkish tea and coffee aswell as european options )  - staff very friendly and understanding of our late starts every am  - walking distance to all the major attractions   Only issue was the weather in istanbul in winter - we had 4 days of  0-10deg C plus rain!

title: Istanbul in winter 2012
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Feel at home while being treated like royalty
review: Hotel is in the nice place. Almost all main POI are nearby this hotel. Istanbul is really nice city. But it seems to me that you need be careful here from hotel staff till cabbies. First of all we were offered by bad room, not one we have paid. By mail I made an agreement hotel with to put our room in flowers- it wasn't made for the pity of mine. So my family's event is beggining unright way. Breakfast about- you need to go to eat throught open area-rain,cold. Food is a little special and the same each day. I'd prefer more traditional food, as everywere in Europe. In the evening this is a problem to find hotel narrow streets in- something like navigator will save your legs. Be happy in Istanbul. I recommend to you to order local guide.

title: Great place, great people
review: Rose Garden Suites is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at, and I have traveled a lot in my lifetime. In terms of comfort, the architecture is pretty, the furnishings are beautiful and comfortable, the rooms are very clean, the snacks are abundant, and the food is delicious. The staff and managers are all incredibly hospitable, warm, professional, kind, helpful, and good-spirited, and they really go out of their way for you -- beyond what you would expect at a five star hotel. (For instance, they came and picked me up from another part of town when I had trouble at a different hotel, and they invited me to look at their rooms before making any decision. As another example, one day I asked if they had an eraser, and the next thing I knew, a kind staffer was handing me one…

title: for the second time excellent
review: I have stayed for four nights at Rose Garden Suites and have truly enjoyed it: Nice and clean room, great location, very friendly people and customer friendly service. Looking forward to the next time.

title: Authentic, and very central
review: First in Jun and for the second time in December I enjoyed the hotel and suites very much. The location is near to most major touristic places. The hotel serves a good breakfast. Fresh fruit, bread en just order the egg as you want. The hotel staff is friendly. I get an upgrade when I told to visit the hotel for the second time this year.

title: Stunning Hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent Location and hotel
review: We stayed in the Rose Garden Suites for a long weekend. The room was beautiful, clean and definitely had the wow factor. The staff were polite, helpful and went out of their way to help. The location is amazing. It's five minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Basilica Cistern Underground palace, and about ten minutes to get to the Topkapi Palace. Lots of restaurants nearby, and about ten minutes to the Grand Bazaar. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to friends/family. Honestly, it made our weekend a real success.

title: Very nice hotel, centrally located.
review: Just returned from an 8 night booking at this hotel. Stayed in a traditional queen room with garden.   Very clean and comfortable. Good range of breaksfast.   Staff very helpful and pleasant.   Very close to the local sites.   Overall would recommend this hotel.

title: Clean and quiet hotel
review: We really liked the hotel. It is right in the centre of Sultanahmet and within easy walking distance of the major attractions. We had a large attractive room with a balcony and views of the Bosphorous. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly and more than willing to assist with any enquiries we had. There was only one downside to the hotel and that was the breakfast. There was very limted choice and what there was, was of dubious quality. The choce of 'fresh' fruit was tinned pineapple or inedible, unripe kiwi fruit. The bread was stale and when the boiled eggs ran out, they didn't get replenished. If we put aside the issue of the breakfast however, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Great Choice
review: Stayed here for 10 days in November 2012. The hotel was very clean, the staff were pleasant, the location was quiet (well located to see the main touristy sites but not be bothered by the call to prayer or hawkers in the street that you get closer to the blue mosque).   The breakfast was very nice too - nice buffet with pasties, bread, cheese, omelet station, juice, coffee, fruit, etc.

title: Fantastic hotel in the centre of Sultanahmet!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Friendly, comfortable and well-situated
review: Usually we book our flight and hotel seperately, but this time we booked a combi packet ( flight and hotel ). We got to choose from a number of hotels and finally decided to book this one after reviewing the comments on TA.  The downside of this deal was that we arrived at Sabiha Gokcen airport ( Asian part of Istanbul ). It took us an hour and 15 min to get to the hotel. Since we arrived in the evening we decided to take a cab, which set us back about 120 TL ( 45-50 euro ).  The hotel however was very much to our likings. We got a warm welcome and the staff is friendly and speak fluent English. Our room was very spacious ( see pictures ) with lot of storage space ( if one woud need that ), a mini bar, a safe, complementary fruit basket and bottle of wine ( always a nice touch )…

title: RH
review: We went to Istanbul for a short break early in November and stayed here for three nights.  The staff were very friendly and helpful and even spent some time to advise on things to see and do and when best to do so.  The room was very nice and very comfortable with everything we could need. Didn't really need the window into the shower but hey! I'm not complaining!  ;-)  We found the location ideal. We walked everywhere and managed to see everything on our list (and more) over the two full days we were there (although we didn't stop walking, it seemed, our entire wakened day!).  Both of us are fast approaching 50 and had no trouble with the hills around the hotel (as in much of the city) though they may be more of an issue for those much older.  Can't comment on the food as I…

title: Friendly, helpful, very nice
review: Excellent hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Ate in the restaurant and the food was very good. Excellent room with a huge bed and very clean. The hotel is ideally placed to get to all the historic sites in the city. We walked everywhere quite easily and only used public transport to get to a football match. An advantage of this smaller hotel was we got to chat with a lot of the other residents. Very friendly place which I would recommend to anyone.

title: A nice hotel walking distance to old Istanbul City
review: My husband and I just got back from a wonderful stay at the Rose Garden Suites. The room was very nice with the most comfortable bed ever. In the afternoon there was fresh cake and coffee/tea and water in the lobby for the guests. The restaurant served excellent food at dinner and we also enjoyed their house wine.  Suat, is great.  Informative and helpful. We enjoyed having dinner and chatting with him. All the wait staff at the restaurant are friendly and helpful.  One of the the nicest features of this hotel was the staff.  Everyone went out of their way to make sure that your stay was enjoyable.  I celebrated my birthday during this time, and they got me a cake and candles and sang "Happy Birthday."  Another guest celebrated his birthday on the same day also, and he also got…

title: Quiet, clean and friendly
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: oasis in Istanbul
review: We stayed in this delightful hotel for 3 nights.  From the moment we arrived we were welcomed most courteously. Everywhere is spotlessly clean, quiet, well kept and ordered.There is a lovely terrace where one can relax enjoying tea, water, coffee and cakes any time of the day. Always the staff were obliging, very friendly and helpful. Nothing was ever two much trouble. Main attractions are within easy walking distance.. We do not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would certainly return again.

title: Very pleasant hotel!
review: A calm, very comfortable hotel for our first trip to Istanbul. Warm welcome, friendly staff, brand-new room (an upgrade!) and a good breakfast  made this perfect for us, and the location made walking to many attractions easy. Absolutely no complaints; we would certainly stay there again.

title: Lovely hotel
review: First of all, the location.. It's perfect. A few minute walk from the Blue Mosque. Second of all the staff are very helpful and very nice. The breakfast buffet great. The rooms very clean and comfortable. A complimentary bottle of local wine on arrival was also a lovely gesture. Will stay there again for sure!!

title: Great base to explore the old city
review: Very nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff in the centre of the old town. A short walk from the main tram line. A good choice of breakfast food and drinks. The room was clean and nicely decorated.

title: Splendid hotel!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Location and service make this hotel a good spot
review: We stayed at this hotel in October 2012and it was beautiful! Very nice rooms,breakfast and professional and friendly staff! The location is good for seeing sights. The suits was opened this April, bed and bed linen are high quality and very comfortable.

title: A great place to stay in the old city!
review: Located 5 walking minutes from the Bue Mosque, and other must-see spots in Istanbul, this hotel is of course perfect for a short stay (if you stay a week, say, and do not see other parts of Istanbul, you might be misled what the city really is). This is supposedly a 'boutique hotel': it has the size of one, it is but an nice place with clean and newaly renovated rooms, but does not qualify as a boutique hotel. The real pluses are: the garden (some quiet in a turbulent city and the manager, Selçuk, who actually helped us make of our 3 days a well-organized ad succesful trip.

title: Right in the middle of Istanbul's historic center!
review: I stayed in Rose Garden Suites for one night, during my trip to Turkey with my husband.  In this same trip, I had spent 6 nights at Garden House Istanbul, then 3 nights in Cappadocia and I returned to Istanbul and spent this last night at Rose Garden Suites. Rose Garden Suites and Garden House are 2 different hotels in the same address; but the first has newer rooms. The restaurant and the garden are common areas for them.  Room: We stayed at room 213 with a balcony and a lovely view to the garden. The room had an excellent bed (queen size) and pillows, TV, mini-fridge. The bathroom is also great: good shower, good space and hair dryer.  Restaurant: it is located in the garden. It has a romantic atmosphere due to candle lights in every table. The menu offers different kinds of…

title: Very polite staff, nice room, good area
review: My partner and I stayed at the the Rose Garden for five nights in October 2012. We enjoyed our simple, clean, and comfortable room. After days of sightseeing and shopping, the room offered much needed peace and quiet, which was perfect for a late afternoon/early evening nap before heading out to dinner. Breakfast is quite wonderful at the Rose Garden -- a blend of Turkish and more American offerings. Eating outside in the garden, every morning, was the perfect way to start each day. The hotel's manager and his staff were attentive and helpful. This is THE place to stay in Istanbul!

title: Lovely hotel!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Oasis in the City Center
review: My wife and I stayed at the Rose Garden for three nights in September 2012; we were llucky enough to be in one of the suites (room 212 I think) which was a very good size and beautifully appointed.  The check in process was very slick and a minor glitch whereby the AC needed to be reset was undertaken within our first 15minutes in the room.  The check in staff and guest relations manager were very knowledgable and helpful - in fact all staff were great.  The bathroom to the room included a large jacuzzi bath and shower over it both of which were lovely; only slightly negative is the ceiling could do with a coat of paint but this is hardly a criticism!  We didn't eat in the hotel but it's location is superb and you can be at some of the top restaurants within a 10minute walk and…

title: Peaceful & friendly
review: Rose Garden suites is a wonderful place to stay, that I can highly recommend! It's located in the historic center, and thus in walking distance to at least all the attractions in Sultanahmet (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Great Bazaar, etc.). My boyfriend and I stayed there for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our room, which looked like a miniature harem with it's beautiful exotic design (and btw. had a window between the bedroom and shower, so make sure you don't end up in this room in case you're not going with your partner!).   The breakfast is amazing (the best I ever had at a hotel) and offers a variety of Turkish specialities, coffee, fruit, cake, etc.. Throughout the day water, coffee and little cakes were avaliable in the backyard area, which is very cozy and gardenlike and…

title: Clean and Convenient
review: We spent 3 nights on our first visit to Istanbul in August. The staff were friendly and helpful during and prior to our visit, answering questions promptly before we booked our room, and sending photos of the room on request. The airport transfer both ways was on time and easy. We stayed in a suite which didn't have the same decor as in the photos on the site-some might have been disappointed by this, but we weren't as we 'saw' the room before booking.  The terrace garden is beautiful and a great spot to rest in the afternoon with complimentary sweets & beverages.  The breakfasts were delicious, with an omelette station and plenty of choice.  It was quiet and peaceful when we visited, and the call to prayer was beautiful.  It was a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, and within…

title: A gem in the heart of Istanbul
review: We spent 6 nights in Istanbul with the sole purpose of relaxation and finding more about the city. This Hotel was perfectly placed for the main attractions, the Blue Mosque was about 10 minutes away with the rest of the old city being easily accessible from this location on foot. The Rose Garden suites appears to be part of the Garden Hotel and appears to be its 'Jewel in the Crown', indeed the executive suite that we stayed in (312) was clean, very comfortable and suited our needs nicely. Despite the lack of English the staff appear to be conscientous and hard working and readily approachable. One improvement that definitely needs to be made is an ironing board and iron in each room, and an additional improvement would be an overhaul of the room tea/coffee selections with…

title: A great place to stay
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm.
