title: Simply Wonderful
review: Great location for main sights are walkable, great  staff, most helpful and very clean and comfortable rooms, happy to recommend to anyone.ood transfers to airport, on arrival at airport you need to purchase a visa before passport control.

title: Fantastic Service & Great Food!
review: We spent 5 nights at the hotel in August. The entire staff's friendliness and helpfulness were our first impressions of what we  found to be Istanbul's hospitality. The hotel provides a wonderful central courtyard where guests can relax while sipping complimentary beverages and eating cookies and cakes and talk over their day's adventures. Our room and terrace offered almost a 180 degree view of nearby rooftops and of the Marmara Sea. We ate at their restaurant for two nights. The warm ambiance coupled with a friendly and helpful staff and great menu provided a wonderfully relaxing end to our day, and the breakfast selections were a perfect way to begin the next day. By the way, need a taxi - they'll have one waiting for you.  Need suggestions for a tour in another city -…

title: Genuine care and comfort
review: Upon my arrival, I was warmly welcomed by Selcuk, one of MANY outstanding staff members.  They were all extremely helpful and willing to accommodate us in every possible way. They were able to arrange taxis, direct us on where/how to get around, and even give us a few lessons of Turkish as well!  Just genuinely warm people~  The suite is hidden amongst the many unique buildings and cobbled streets of Sultanhamet.  There's a peaceful essence about the neighborhood.  Great location~  half an hour from Ataturk International Airport.  The room itself was very comfortable; cozy bed, great AC system, clean bathroom, secure safebox, and a cute balcony overlooking the garden...I was very pleased with my room.  The staff was able to provide me a power adapter and the rooms were cleaned…

title: Amazing service in a great location
review: The hotel staff were helpful from the start, even as soon as I landed in Ataturk Intl. Airport. I was delayed at the airport for a couple of hours due to a luggage related mix up and missed the hotel's pick up service. Even after a delay of hours, the hotel was accomodating and helpful, immediately sending another car (as soon as they heard of my delay). Throughout the entire week of my stay, the staff remained warm, kind, and extremely efficient. Most importantly they were always eager to help!   The hotel itself is situated in a very convenient location, of walking distance to major attractions such as the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. I had no difficulty walking around the area. A number of charming restaurants and cafes are also located nearby. The rooms are spacious and…

title: A little oasis in the old town centre
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Oasis in the city
review: We stayed for a week in this gem of a hotel.  The staff were great especially Selcuk who took time out to introduce us to the hotel and indeed Istanbul. We especially liked the garden where we often had coffee, water and perhaps cake. The room was great we stayed in one with a balcony and view of the garden.  Excellent air con.  We had trouble with the safe by that was soon fixed. Breakfast was very nice. I would high recomend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul

title: Beautiful garden and great breakfast
review: This little hotel was excellent, from the greeting until wwe left the staff were 1st rate, the room we had, traditional queen was clean, very spaciaous for Istanbul with a great little court yard. The garden area was magnificent, and for us was the best part of the stay. Close to the main attractions it is easy to wander back and rest in the shade with a cold drink. We have already booked there on our way back through after touring around more of Turkey.

title: Highly Recommended
review: 很可爱的酒店 花园布置特别用心 怪不得叫GARDEN HOTEL 早饭非常丰富 是整个土耳其行程下来最丰盛的一家 水果特别特别特别甜！！！！！！ 花园里有只黑白猫特别有爱 看起来和老板特别好 同行的朋友还被升了套房 虽然在阁楼 但是感觉和灰姑娘童话一样的三角屋顶 很有爱 地理位置很好 爬爬小坡 就到了蓝色清真寺  所以要是忘记什么 累了热了回酒店调整也是很方便的。  A very lovely hotel with beautiful garden layout . Breakfast is very rich ,their fruits are the sweetest in our whole Turkey journey.   there is a black and white cats looks particularly good with the boss of hotel. My friend was also up a suite in the attic, the feeling of the Cinderella fairy tale triangular roof is quite lovely. The location is very good .So if you forget something or feel tired, hot, adjust back to the hotel is very convenient.

title: Rose Garden Suites Istanbul
review: We stayed twice in July 2012 for a total of ten days and everything was great . The rooms are spacious and cool ( especially the courtyard view balconies ) and the  garden is a peaceful world of its own for a drink , a meal ( food is excellent ) or a read  under the huge old walnut tree . The staff have good English and are very pleasant and helpful on all levels . The location suited us perfectly - about a 10 minute interesting walk away from all the action around the Blue Mosque area .The free shuttle pick-up from the airport ( which patiently waited while we dealt with a missing suitcase ) is a brilliant way to get there after a long flight . The surrounding area is very old - town community with some small shops and local restaurants ( Tarihi Cesme and Stone House our…

title: great location, great rooms, fantastic breakfast
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent choice.
review: We booked here on good Tripadvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. The location is good for the old town tourist attractions, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, the cistern etc, and the tram isn't too far away either. Some nearby streets are a bit scruffy but not at all threatening or unsafe. We were in the annexe, and the rooms are recently renovated, and have excellent bathrooms and modern effective and QUIET aircon, so you can have it on at night. Our room had the slightly unusual feature of a picture window between the shower and the bed area, though there are louvres for the shy! Complementary fruit, bottled water, and a bottle of wine on arrival. Staff were helpful and pleasant, please tip the cleaners when you leave, they're lovely. Wireless internet was free if a bit slow…

title: Quirky Property
review: Highly recommended!  This was an excellent choice for my first stay in Istanbul.  I wasn’t too sure about the location because of the reviews about the Sultanahmet area being  ‘too touristy’, but this little boutique hotel is ideally located minutes away from the ‘old town’ attractions and just two blocks from the water.  The room was beautifully appointed ,very large and quite comfortable as well as quiet.  The staff was outstanding.  Selcuk and his staff were awesome.  They could not have been more helpful in arranging dinner reservations, recommending tours and excursions, and making sure your every need is attended.  After a long day of touring and sightseeing, the hotel is a wonderful place to unwind, sitting in the courtyard enjoying complimentary pastries and beverages…

title: Boutique experience in Old City, Istanbul
review: The Suites are very comfortable and great power shower. All the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly and the garden area is an attractive space to relax and have a break. The location is convenient in the old city and in the middle of residential area so it is quite unique and different to normal hotel properties. Very good value for money and they go to a lot of trouble with breakfast.

title: Very nice hotel, OK location
review: A perfect place for the romantic who appreciates Victoriana.  A Turkish bath in en suite rooms and old fashioned fittings.  Good breakfast.  Coffee available throughout the day in garden-patio.  Situated within 5 minutes walk of The Blue Mosque.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  Selcuk (in charge of guest relations) will advise you how to plan your stay to make sure you get the best deals on tours etc.

title: Hotel in Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Perfect boutique hotel in Istanbul.
review: Great Hotel, excellent location, a walking distance to many main attractions in old town.  Service is outstanding with very friendly people.  Complimentary tea, coffee and snacks in the lobby, and always some surprise in the room as well.  The Rose Garden is the best place to come back after a day of sightseeing and noise in the streets.  It´s quite and with excellent staff to help you with everything you need.

title: Fantastic hotel with first class service
review: A great base in the old part of Istanbul for a sightseeing trip. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, the staff were very friendly and the location was perfect to visit all the main tourist attractions. The hotel is not well known by the taxi drivers though so make sure you keep the hotel card handy!

title: one of the best hotels in the area
review: This is an outstanding hotel - excellent location for main tourist sites, very attentive and friendly service from all the staff and beatiful, clean, well-kept rooms. The Rose Garden is an oasis of peace and calm situated right next to the hustle and bustle of the busiest tourist areas. Complimentary tea, coffee and snacks in the small courtyard area - and also cheese and wine reception for guests on some evenings - as well as excellent buffet breakfasts and good evening meals. Staff went out of their way to offer helpful tips and advice, and overall this hotel is highly reccommended.

title: Excellent hotel
review: I  have been  to Istanbul already 5 times and this was the best one i have ever stayed. I choose the hotel due to  reviews published here and on other travel web sites and i booked for 3 days for end of June this year,  I  have  chosen the superior double room with balcony and lovely  garden view and really  got what i see  on the  pictures, and some unusual  things for a city  hotel,  free  bottle of wine and fruit basket, free  tea  and coffee  in the  garden, wine and  cheese  cocktails on weekends ( i got only one  day )  The  prices  are  not very expensive  according to the service and  quality  of the food  you  get there, definitely  will be  back  soonb

title: Great location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Perfect choice
review: Lovely location close to the Blue Mosque with helpful staff. Breakfast was enjoyable although it was a shame the small outdoor section was dominated by smokers so I had to stay inside. My room was comfortable with a huge bed. Complimentary wine, water and fruit was a nice welcoming touch and it was great to have a kettle to make a cuppa. Very nice terrace area with free afternoon tea. Only complaint was that the desk staff forgot to book my transfer to the airport so I missed the 5 euro shuttle and had to take a car for 17 euros. Staff made sure that the driver knew that I had to get to the airport quickly. Wifi was reliable.

title: good location, good rooms
review: This was a revelation. Perfect location. Superb rooms. Truly excellent service from everybody. We will stay again.”

title: Exceptional oasis with oustanding personal service
review: great place for couples, great location behind the arasta bazaar (which is the only bazaar open on sundays by the way) and close to all major attractions in the old city.  good value.  hotel's owner makes everyone feel at home.

title: I felt like at home
review: My wife and i have just returned from 3 days at this wonderful hotel with our 7 month old daughter Lyla.  This hotel is exceptional and one of those rare places where great quality rooms and location are made even better by the most personal service from staff. All of the staff went out of there way to make our daughter welcome and would carry her away for walks around the garden whilst we enjoyed breakfast or a glass of wine.  Location In a quiet corner of the old town within 5 minutes walk of the main sites and great bars and restaurants.  Rooms We stayed in an executive suite which was spacious and very tastefully decorated. The hotel rooms were refurbished 18 months ago to a very high standard. We were provided with a great baby crib and the hotel kindly let us store our…

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Best Boutique Hotel
review: We stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon. The hotel is very friendly and situated in a quiet yet central location - a beautiful oasis in bustling Istanbul. You cannot go wrong staying here!

title: Nice friendly place
review: If you are looking for a small hotel that is quiet but 5 minute walking distance to the main attractions then this is the place to book.  The staff are friendly and very helpful.  The breakfast and restaurant food is wonderful and the garden is a blessing in such an overcrowded city asis the free coffess, tea and cakes :-)  I booked two rooms, one with balcony and a standard room.  The one with the balcony was large and overlooking the garden is lovely, my father liked to sit and read his book waiting for me to turn up late for breakfast!  We also were given one of the two larger standard rooms which was plenty big enough and although on the first floor was still extrememly quiet. The hotel also contacted us prior to departure with a personal email which is rare these days.  A…

title: A little boutique hotel managed and run in a splendid manner
review: stayed here for 4 nights in the end of May. Though it was expensive compares to some of the otehr similar options we had in the Sultanahmet area, it was worth coz they upgraded us to the Executive suite which was largish and also had an openable window. they did insist we pay for all 4 nights just as soon as we arrived ??? but besides this the rest of the stay was nice.   we travelled with our 18 month old daughter and Ayhan, the manager, went out of his way to be friendly with her. they served free evening wine and cheese in the garden restaurant on friday and saturday which was quite a nice touch. the buffet breakfast was good and had hot omelettes and fresh bread alongwith the rest of the cold buffet which is typical of turkish hotels.  the pickup and drop which was free, was…

title: Keen to get every lira out of you. Not friendly for solo travellers
review: I would like to mention as first valuable characteristic of this hotel the great assistance and treatments that the managers and all the personnel reserve to their guests. My husband and I stayed in Istanbul two weeks ago and we were very happy with the choice of the hotel. I made my reservation on the basis of the information found on Tripadvisor and I was just right. The location is great (only at short walking distance from the Hyppodrome, Agya Sophia and the Topkapi Palace) and the area is quite and silent. The kindness of people was not only matter of professionalism (which is undoubted) but we have appreciated very much that people liked their work and consider the guest as people to care of. We will certainly recommend this hotel to people going to Istanbul for business…

title: Rose Garden Suites Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A perfect retreat
review: The hotel has bundles of character and is in a great location, in the sultanahmet district, with easy access to all the main attractions including the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya etc.  The hotel staff were very warm and friendly. I'd happily recommend it.  Istanbul: I Loved it! The Sultanahmet area is very old and magical with wonderful mosques and towering minarets and the call to prayer every few hours was magical. The food was wonderful, very tasty and quite healthy in too.  The people were very friendly and would take the time to talk to you sharing all sorts of local insights making you feel very welcome.

title: rose garden suites amazing
review: My husband and I spent a week in Istanbul recently. The Rose Garden was the perfect place to begin and end each day. The hotel is tastefully appointed and offers a quiet, relaxing place to retreat from the tourist mania that characterizes this neighborhood of Istanbul in the high season. Rooms are more spacious and luxurious than those of other small hotels in Sultanahmet (the bathroooms are especially nice), and public spaces are pleasant and inviting. Wifi is available throughout. The hotel is conveniently close to many of the main tourist attractions, but is also located on a quiet street, away from traffic and noise. There are three buildings that share the same common space, and if I'm not mistaken, the "Rose Garden Suites" refer to the rooms in the most recently renovated…

title: Great hotel at a central but still quiet location
review: The service and the accommodations at this hotel were incredible. The manager of the hotel, Ayhan and all of the employees made you feel as though you were the only person that they had to attend to. Every single detail was attended to by the Ayhan and the staff. The hotel was extremely clean, pretty and inviting. The balcony overlooked the rose garden and the fragrance permeated the entire area. The breakfast was phenomenal. For the adventurous people, they had all types of Turkish dishes, and for the not so adventurous, they even had cocoa puffs. Sadly, while I was there, my mom died back in the US, and they were so kind and willing to assist in any way possible to help me return.  I felt like I was at home!! Incredibly warm, loving people there. I would return in a second and…

title: Excellent
review: We stayed for a long weekend in Istanbul and have chosen the Rose Garden Suites which is just a few minutes away from the major attractions like The Blue Mosque or the Hagia Sofia. Even if located at such a central location it is a very quiet  and peaceful place. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful, we were talked through our stay and were recommended places to visit and restaurants to go to. Using their connections they were able to organize us a great table at one of the top room restaurants. We stayed in an executive suite which was located in a separate building. The room was very nice and spacious and has a nice bathroom with a Jacuzzi. We would definitively go back to this place!

title: This is the best
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Thanks
review: I recently spent four nights at Rose Garden Suites in Istanbul.   It was outstanding from start to finish and in every detail.   First, there was a complimentary transfer from the airport.  Never having been to Turkey before I didn't appreciate how helpful this would be.   Immediately upon our arrival the concierge, Selchuk I believe, spent a significant amount of time with us detailing possible itineraries - many of which we chose and all of which we thoroughly enjoyed.  I highly recommend the dinner cruise - delicious food and a really fun experience.  We had a full-day walking tour with a local guide that was terrific and helped us get our barrings the first day.    The accommodations were lovely, in fact, the entire facility was delightful - particularly the terraced rose…

title: Relaxing in the Garden
review: That is a wooow location. You can smell tradition and luxury at the same time. And probably you can't forget their Attitude they behave like you are their guest.i did not forget.

title: Pretty Good, Not Great
review: Great little hotel which is very well situated for visiting all the sights of the old city on foot. The director and his staff go out their way to help you and are a mine of useful information. All round service was great. Situated in a quiet street with no spectacular view but with a paved garden on several levels which is a haven of peace and a great place to come back to after a hard day's visiting.

title: First time visit to wonderful Istanbul enhanced by excellent hotel experience
review: The Rose Garden is more expensive than some of the comparable hotels in the Sultanahmet (Old City) area of Istanbul, and you get a bit more for your money.  It's a nice hotel, but not a great one.  Plus:  Good location near to the Blue Mosque and other tourist attractions.  It's on a relatively quiet street, so both streetside and courtyard-facing rooms are quiet.  It has been remodeled, so the facilities are new and modern and clean.  It has an interesting design, occupying separate buildings and an interior courtyard, so while it's a bit of a trek going up and down stairs to the various floor levels (and probably wouldn't be suitable for the handicapped), it's a pleasant facility.  The rooms and the bathrooms are spacious and well-appointed, which is very welcome considering…

title: Great Boutique Hotel!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Cosy & Conveniently Located
review: The Rose Garden Suites are part of the Rose Garden Hotel, and are actually a newer building tucked in the back of the main building.  We arrived from Rome after a several hour flight delay and had a free transfer from the airport to the hotel.  Once we arrived the woman working the front desk checked us in with ease and the manager on duty, Selcuk, had our bags brought to our room and offered us a glass of wine and snacks.  He went over many of the attractions in Istanbul, and showed us around the hotel.    Our room was on the 3rd floor of the new building and was wonderful.  It was obviously brand new, and quite large with a king size bed, a sitting area, and a desk.  The bed was very comfortable and we slept quite well.  The bathroom was decent size with a large jacuzzi tub…

title: Charming Hotel
review: This is a small and cosy hotel ... not "great" or "best ever" as other reviewers said, but nice, specially in relation to its price. We opted for a hotel in the old town , to be within strolling distance from lots of Ottoman sites. On a previous visit to Istanbul, I stayed at the Hilton in the modern part of the city ... obviously convenient for business and shopping, but lacks Istanbul charm.  The hotel is divided over two buildings, with a small multi level garden in between, with lots of stairs to climb. It has a simple restaurant, where we only had breakfast .... very good buffet. The hotel has a small lounge, where coffee, tea, soft drinks, fruits and nuts are constantly on offer (complimentary)... which is actually a very nice touch.  The hotel is in a tiny uphill street ,…

title: Amazing hotel in a great location
review: I recently stayed at this most charming hotel and wish I could anticipate another trip to Istanbul to stay there again!  The room was lovely and very comfortable.  Breakfast was the only meal I had in the restaurant but it was enjoyable and a good reason to go back.  Manager Selçuk Topçu was friendly and helpful, really on top of everything, and all the staff were nice and guest-oriented.  MA

title: Boutique style and friendly comfort in a historic neighborhood
review: I stayed here in December 2011 and I cannot fault my stay. The room was very large and beautifully decorated, with a luxurious and spotlessly clean bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is traditional Turkish, with fresh omelettes cooked to order, served in a light and airy conservatory.   I'm looking for an excuse to go back to Istanbul, just so I can stay here again! Just a word of warning though, the hotel is located at the bottom of a very steep street, which you have to walk up to get to the tram stop or the main square, so this hotel might not be suitable for everybody.

title: Pleasant Surprise!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Faszination City, explored from the most wonderful hotel: Rose Garden Suites!
review: This hotel offers great character in a historic district. Pleasant rooms, a cozy on-site restaurant and friendly staff made this place a highlight of my trip!

title: The best hotel ever
review: Excellently located right in the heart of Sultanahmet. Wonderfully appointed spacious suites, pleasantly furnished, great turquish traditional bathrooms! Friendly and caring people from breakfast via housekeeping to concierge! Definitely a place to return to and a safe recommendation to anyone who wants to spend time in the old part of the city!

title: Cosy hotel, friendly staff, convenient location!
review: Rose Garden was the greatest hotel we have ever stayed. I enjoyed a beautiful spacious room with our private hamam in our bathroom. Breakfast is till 10:30 so you can sleep late and get a jammy fresh omelette, fruits, nuts, ham, and cheese and of course Turkish coffee. The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. The manager of the hotel is always around, so you can talk to him about everything from your requests on accommodation to sightseeing tips. I recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to relax just in the heart of Istanbul 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque.

title: Very good hotel at the center of the old town in Istanbul
review: This little gem offers a great choice for staying at the old town of the city. The staff is very friendly, the breakfast of exceptionally high standards with custom-made omelets and traditional Turkish flavours. Rooms have a good size and very strong oriental touch. Price is reasonable and location convenient for the byzantine heritage sites.

title: Just perfect
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Very good
review: We stayed four days in this charming hotel. Location is great: right next to the small and absolutely stunning mosque Sokullu Mehmet Pasa (don´t miss it!), and just a few blocks away from the Blue Mosque. It´s walking distance from the Grand Bazar and everywhere in Sultanahamet but at same time far away from the buzz: beside the muezzin you only hear birds singing. The staff is super nice and honors all that has been said for centuries about turkish hospilitaty. Breakfast is simply superb. Tasty pastries and water available all the time in the lounge room. Free wireless. What can say? We will be back, soon I hope!

title: Fantastic boutique hotel, in a great location  with outstanding staff-book now!!
review: Clean, friendly staff, good room size, nice bathroom and cookies in the afternoon. What do I want more? It was a very nice stay at this hotel and I'm looking forward to come back sometime. The only think I didn't like, was the taste of the "welcome-wine" :-) But that's not really a crucial thing :-)

title: 'Memorable hotel in a fantastic place'
review: A friend and I stayed in the hotel for a long weekend at the end of March 2012 after finding it on TripAdvisor. We were booking our accomodation last minute and weren't sure what to expect.  The hotel is charming. The photos on the website do not do it justice. We stayed in the Rose Garden suites (2 parts to the hotel- garden and the roe garden). The rooms are beautifully decorated and they had provided a fruit basket and wine in the room on arrival. Great parts about the room: Great bed with amazingly soft sillky sheets (slept really well), power shower with a really big shower head, flat screen TV, balcony overlooking the courtyard.  The hotel has complimentary afternoon tea everyday which is a lovely added bonus- and if its sunny you can take this in the patio-ed garden. They…

title: Convenience  for sure
review: A friend an I stayed for 5 nights at the Rose Garden Hotel in february 2012. A warm welcome,  a fruit bowl and a bottle of wine awaited us. Ideally located within walking distance to the tram line and the historic tourist attractions. The breakfast was great - (eggs prepared the way you like it). The staff were eager to help. Free internet access made contacting home via SKYPE easy. The bedroom itself was luxurious and spacious. Great place would like to return there with my family.

title: Great place, nice stay
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Really nice hotel!
review: We have been in this nice hotel at the end of January, with lot of snow and freezing weather. The hotel was warm, comfortable and the staff kind and helpful.  We booked airport transfer to/from hotel, the price was a bit high but essential as we arrived/departed at bad time (late in the night& early morning).  We booked also the hammam through the hotel, gaining a honest price and shuttle bus to/from hotel, finally being very happy of the choice.  Breakfast very varied and abundant, waiters very dedicated to their job, making the overall stay a fantastic experience.  The hotel is very well situated within walking distance to major square and tram-way, making it a perfect place where to start to explore the city.  We received also a free upgrade to a beautiful room, large and…

title: This is amazing
review: The hotel is well situated in the old city, 10 minutes from the blue Mosque in a quiet neighbourhood. The room was nice decorated and big, with modern installation in a wooden house. It was very clean. A bottle of wine and a fruit basket were offered by the hotel. There was also a little living room where good cakes were offered. There was a large choice for breakfast and fresh omelettes. The staff was really helpful and kind and made everything in order that we enjoy our stay in the hotel. We had a free upgrade and got an executive suite in the rose garden house with a beautiful sea view, a huge bed and a jacuzzi! It was very quiet and we could feel as if we were at home. The prices were reasonable, but it might be more expensive at high season... We are really happy of our…

title: Lovely boutique hotel great value for money
review: From the warmest greeting at the door to the 'wow' when walking into the ottoman suite, this is a place that won't disappoint.  Walking into the hotel is like entering a world so different from the noise and bustle of busy Istanbul.  It has a great location and an internal courtyard, superb restaurant, amazing rooms and above all, a fantastic staff.  When you have been to as many hotels as I have, and Ive been to a lot in many countries,  I have learnt that it is always the staff who really make the big difference - that separate a good hotel from an outstanding hotel. This is an outstanding hotel.  I'll recommend it to friends and family without any hesitation.

title: Good hotel well placed
review: We have just spent 3 nights at this hotel.  We were very happy with the standard of accommodation which was much better than expected and was very tasteful and comfortable.  Free wi-fi in all rooms.  Buffet breakfast was excellent with good coffee.  The hotel was situated in a back street approx five mins walk from main sites and was a quiet location. The manager Selcuk was very friendly and helpful and will organise tours for you if you want.  He even went so far as to get a cake for my daughter's birthday at very short notice which was a fantastic touch.  The other staff were also very friendly.   Would definately recommend Rose Garden Suites    General comments on Istanbul - amazing place, surprisingly little hassle, and everyone seemed incredibly friendly.  Felt much safer…

title: A night behind the blue Mosquee
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: rose garden suites sultanahmet istanbul
review: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and after a few days in Istanbul we decided to stay more one night and we choose Rose Garden Suite...It was been a great decision!!The hotel is 5 minutes by walk from the blue mosquee, excellent position for everything, nice very nice place. The room was fantastic and the staff was great..I suggest to everyone, also for the family, to stay in Rose Garden Suite..It's a peace corner in the big city of Istanbul!!!!

title: Very nice and cozy hotel
review: We really enjoyed our stay, great location 5 mıns walk to Sultanahmet Square . Rooms tastefully decorated and very comfortable ,excellent shower.The buffet breakfast offered a great choice.Staff very helpful.Looking forward to staying here again soon.  Edna Morrow

title: Very Convenient; Generous Amenities
review: I can really recommend the Rose Garden Suites in Istanbul. We had a great room and the staff was very helpful. The location is also close to the tourist attractions and we were able to walk to all the places. The breakfast - buffet was also very good.

title: Excellent small hotel, wonderful staff, superb location.
review: We enjoyed our stay here.  We were only here two nights, at the start of our trip before we flew to Cappadocia, and then later in the week when we flew back and the next day embarked on a cruise ship. We stayed in two rooms, the first a large room on the ground floor facing a courtyard and the second on a much higher floor with a nice view of the courtyard and the city.  Both times we were impressed with the amenities - big bottle of water, a bottle of wine, teas, and really lovely rose scented soap in the bathroom.   The restaurant offered generous, tasty breakfasts.  We had dinner there one night when we were quite tired, and it wasn't our best meal in Istanbul.  Fine, but not great, and it really isn't much of a walk to many other choices.   The staff was very helpful and…

title: Great hotel, great staff and beautyful city
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great Location + Customer Service
review: We stayed during the first week of december in this lovely hotel. The location is perfect as it is close to the must see places. Also, the room, the service and the staff have been great. Thank you selcuk, Aslan and the rest of the team for making our stay unforgettable. We hope to see you soon!

title: This hotel is a must !
review: We stayed between Nov 6 - 12, 2011 and would not hesitate to return.  We had the 5th floor suite with panoramic view of the Sea & rooftops along with balcony (be ready to climb stairs).  The room was comfortable 3-4 star rating....if the duvet was changed for a down/feather it would make a big difference....but the view was wonderful. As well there is a fridge kettle coffee tea.   A welcome basket with fruit and wine was appreciated after a day of travel.  Our package had a couple of great items which the staff arranged according to when we would like to have them..A night Boat Cruise on the Bosphorous with entertainment and meal was a great way to spend our first night.  Transportation to/from boat was included.    Then the next day we had a private tour of the old city- Nesime…

title: Nice
review: Fantastic service ! Rooms are great! The staff is so pleasant ! This hotel understands the art of hospitality ! As always a fabulous stay !

title: We'd go back
review: Wife and I left another hotel to come here and we were overall happy that we did. There were a couple things that visitors need to know about the Garden Suites. We stayed on the 3rd floor and at night the other guests would come in and you could hear them pretty clearly as the noise carried up the stairway, no elevator, to the rooms. It also had a tendancy to echo a bit. I was also not impressed with the breakfast buffet. Limited choices, greasy eggs, juices unlike many of the other hotels are store bought versus fresh squeezed.  The hotel is wood, wood floors that have character and nice, rooms are well furnished, although another shower where the drain is placed on the high side instead of the low side, but the shower was great aside from that, great pressure and plenty of hot…

title: Billb
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Terrific Hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel two separate times during our recent trip to Turkey. We started at the Rose Garden and ended up there after almost two weeks traveling around Turkey. The staff was excellent and very attentive to our needs. The location was also great. While we were located in a "neighborhood" it was a short walk to many of the major attractions we wanted to see and we did not feel like we were in an "tourist" area. The outdoor patio was a great place to relax after a busy day walking around Istanbul. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. I would certainly stay here again and would encourage friends traveling to Istanbul to consider the Rose Garden as their "base" in Istanbul.

title: The perfect hotel for your visit to Istanbul
review: This was our first trip to Istanbul and we chose this hotel based on reviews from prior visitors.  I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to find out that this hotel had been recently renovated and provided all the amenities you would expect from a first class hotel.  The rooms were spacious, well appointed and very clean. The entire staff were very helpful whether it was providing directions to the nearby Aya Sofia or providing recommendations to some very good restaurants.  Selcuk and his staff worked hard to make our visit memorable.  I found the location to be excellent as it was only a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and the Aya Sofia.  It was also convenient to the tram system, an aboveground train that had convenient stops close to the Grand Bazaar, Spice…

title: Well appointed hotel, centrally located and friendly, helpful staff
review: From the minute you walk into the lobby and are warmly welcomed by Selçuk, the hotel manager, you know you have chosen the perfect hotel for your visit to Istanbul. Selçuk and his staff do everything they can to make your stay special. The rooms are beautiful and absolutely spotless. A delicious breakfast is served in a garden restaurant each morning, with omlettes made to order. A great plus: perfect coffee, cookies and fruits are available at no cost 24/7 in the lobby. And you find a gift of a delicious bottle of wine in your room when you first arrive. The hotel is perfectly located, close all the sights, you turn right and walk for about ten minutes to the area around the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, etc., and turn left and walk to the Great Bazaar. Don't hesitate to stay at…

title: Feels like home
review: On arrival we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff and shown our well appointed room. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choices including eggs cooked to order. The location meant we were able to walk easily to the Bazaars, Blue Mosque etc and restaurants. We look forward to a return visit.

title: Staff make this place what it is ......
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Good for groups but walls are paper thin
review: My first trip to this beautiful City and stayed at Rose Garden Suites (also known as Garden House Hotel). My original booking was with Rose Garden Suites and I booked this place due to its reviews on trip advisor and due to the decor of the room, however once I arrived I was taken to a room in the Garden House, NOT the Rose Garden Suites. I first thought I arrived at the wrong hotel but was informed that Rose Garden Suites is a new extension and is part of the same hotel and they have similar rooms in the Garden House. The room I was provided with looked nothing like the one on the pictures of Rose Garden, however I would add that it was still a very nice room, very spacious and clean, however I was disappointed with the fact that the decor wasnt the same as Rose Garden Suites…

title: Great location, very helpful, lovely hotel
review: On my most recent trip to Turkey I stayed at the Rose Garden Suites after my first three hotel choices were fully booked for my dates and based upon the glowing TA reviews. I will say on the plus side that the rooms are very large for Istanbul, and the rooms are very clean. My first room was a Rose Garden suite that had some street noise from building construction but the main problem was that the AC wouldn't work, and it was too noisy to keep the windows open. The manager promptly moved us to a 5th floor executive suite in another building that, unlike the other rooms, is very modern. We stayed there for two nights before being moved back to the Rose Garden building into a smaller room on the courtyard side because the manager said it would be quieter. And while there isn't…

title: Excellent stay - satisfied in every way
review: I was staying in Istanbul for two nights to attend a friend's wedding and found this hotel through google.  Reviews on Tripadvisor were all positvie so I booked into here rather than a chain hotel.  The greeting and welcome upon arrival was great and the manager took plenty of time to introduce himself and offer any help I needed.  I had arrived with a suit that needed altering for the wedding that evening and they found me a local tailor, took me there and, importantly, translated for me and this allowed me to spend the day sightseeing rather than doing this all myself.  I didn't have time to take up the offer, but the hotel could arrange guided tours from local operators which is useful.  I ate in the restaurant a couple of times and the food was very good, and eating in the…

title: Fantastic hotel, great location
review: After an terrible experience in another hotel nearby, we moved after one night to this hotel.  From the moment we arrived we were welcomed and made to feel at home. The staff and especially the guest relations manager could not have done more for us. The room was spotless and large - the decor a bit 'over the top' but comfortable and very well appointed.  The hotel has a lovely feel with a nice breakfast room, an outside terrace for dining and a lovely communal lounge with complimentary drinks and free internet. I would thoroughly recommend shortlisting this hotel for a stay in the old part of the city and within easy walk of the Blue Mosque and many of the other sites.

title: A fabulous hotel in a great location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Wonderful hotel in Old Istanbul
review: I have just stayed at the Rose Garden Suites for the second time and I am already looking forward to my next visit!  I now have stayed there while on business (with a business colleague) and on holiday (with my family) and on both occasions the staff have been extremely knowledgeable and helpful.  As a tourist they advised and helped organise trips within and outside Istanbul, and when on business they looked after my business needs just as thoroughly.  A cool drink in the courtyard under the trees after a busy day (and night!) in Istanbul is a perfect way to end the day!

title: The most beautiful place ever i slept in:)
review: The Rose Garden Suites is a wonderful hotel, with beautifully appointed rooms, good amenities, extremely helpful and pleasant staff, and a great location.  Many of the popular attractions are within walking distance, including the Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and Topkapi Palace.  Breakfast is included and provides a wide array of food options, including made to order omelets.  The restaurant is quite good as well and has a wide variety of traditional Turkish dishes.  The courtyard makes for a wonderful morning, afternoon or evening rendezvous.  Complimentary beverages and food is available all day in the courtyard.  It's also a great place to have a glass of wine or Raki (for the intrepid traveler) at the end of the day.  Finally, the staff could not be…

title: lovely small hotel in Old town Istanbul
review: Everything is brand new, clean and very comfortable. you should see that awsome ottoman concept. There is even old style turkish bath in your own room. When you open your eyes in that magnificent rooms, you gonna feel your self like someone who is a resident of the ottoman palace.

title: Stunning rooms, great location, good(ish) food
review: Just returned from 5 nights in this lovely hotel in the old part of Istanbul.  Easily walkable to most tourist attactions and easy access to the above gound tram and subway.  The staff is wonderful..attentive without being intrusive, the rooms are large and comfortable (the linens are beautiful).  The breakfast is bountiful, there is a nice area to "hang out".  There is laundy service and an English language newspaper daily.  Donn't miss this place.

title: Definetely recommended!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Absolutely fantastic !!
review: I recommened this place to everybody who wants to have a quaity time in Istanbul. The hotel has a lot to offer. The location is perfect for major touristic places: Sultanahmet, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque. All within 10-15 min walk. The hotel is rather new, 2 months I believe, so everything is new, clean and the rooms are tastefully decorated. There is wireless internet connection everywhere in the hotel. The restaurant serves traditional turkish dishes and the food is delicious. I recommend the chef´s special chicken kebab. There is a nice garden where you can relax and enjoy the refreshments, fresh fruits and some turkish delicasies all day long (and free of charge too!). The owner Aziz Bey and the organizational manager Selcuk Bey are always present to make sure…

title: A Great Refuge In A Wonderful City
review: Wonderful, airport transfer, meals were wonderful.  Right in the heart of old Istanbul.  Staff was great !!  Wonderful stay !   Thank you !

title: The best value for money one can get for a hotel in Istanbul!
review: My wife and I spent 3 weeks in Istanbul in May of this year, one week of which we spent at the Rose Garden Suites with our family. We originally chose the Rose Garden having met the manager (Ahan) while walking the area earlier in our trip. We were looking for a hotel that would suit our family of 6 in 3 rooms. Happily, we were able to confirm arrangements which resulted in a truly great stay in a well run property. The rooms were newly renovated and the overall quality was superb. Tasteful furnishings, comfortable beds and great bathrooms. The hotel is in a vibrant residential community which is adjacent to many of the  major visitor attractions. The staff were all  helpful and took great pride in ensuring that all aspects of our stay were as enjoyable as possible. This…

title: A clean and quiet hotel in the heart of Istanbul's Old town
review: We have spent a long weekend (2-5 September 2011) in this hotel in Istanbul and have nothing to complain about which happens very rarely. Everything they wrote into their offer was exactly as they promised. Room was clean, quiet, comfortable. TV and air conditioning. A nice graden with roses and a pleasant family/club atmosphere. it is a hotel which is friendly, warm and with its personality. Very well locatad near the historical monuments and the Marmara  Sea promenade. A very good breakfast and a very good restaurant with tasty meals. Reasonable prices. Honest and helfpul staff. Free airport transfer (we bought a weekend package) and free /complimentary fruit, cakes, tea, coffee in the garden restaurant, every afternoon. Also complimentary water, coffee and tea in the room.…

title: Excellent service
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice hotel in a very pleasant city
review: This is where you want to stay if you are looking for great atmosphere and ditto service.   Around 10 minutes walk from the tram and very close to The Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar this hotel is centrally located in the old city.  The staff is very kind and service minded, and you really feel that they are there for you!

title: A lovely Hotel with a Wonderful Staff
review: We booked a suite direct with the hotel for a four night stay. The Hotel matched the price given by the cheapest tour operator and included an airport pick-up. The pick-up was not essential as taxis appear to be metered and regulated, but it is always nice to have a smooth transfer to the hotel in an unknown city.  The hotel itself  is in  the old town and the area is a complex of small narrow streets. Don't be put off by this as the outside is a little daunting.  The staff in the hotel are very pleasant, have good English and helpful. There is an introduction to the tours available (isn't there everywhere) but no pressure whatsoever to buy these. As the transport system is very cheap, and I mean cheap, it is very easy to negotiate the city and its sights yourself.   The hotel…

title: great  little  hotel
review: We had a wonderful stay at Rose Garden Suites in Istanbul. The room was unique and beautiful. This is a very charming boutique hotel situated in the old city within five to ten minutes walking distance from all of the major tourist attractions. In-house dining was excellent and the hotel offers a very generous breakfast buffet, as well as all-day free soft drinks, coffee, teas and juice. However, what makes this hotel truly special is its staff. An extremely helpful and friendly staff is attentive to your every need. We were very impressed with a young lady named Ozga who befriended us immediately and ensured we had a very informed and pleasant stay. She is an extremely professional, courteous and friendly person who always had a warm smile. If she is not a general manager, she…

title: If and when we go back, we will definitely stay here
review: One  of thew  best  located  hotel  with  a  perfect  garden  in the  center  of old  city.

title: Lovely Atmosphere
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: We loved this hotel and we'll go back!
review: By staying at Rose Garden House Suites not only you would have enjoyed of perfect services but you would be able to feel the historical roots of istanbul, as this Hotel is situated in historical part of the city very close to Ayasofya and Blue mosques where should be considered as a surprised in Istanbul urban pattern. Hence by figuring out the identity of Istanbul , there would be possible and easy to reach to other parts of Istanbul  such as Taksim and Kabatash just by using the tramway and metro. i have to add that the personnel of Rose Garden House Istanbul professionally knows how to make a safe and hospitable atmosphere for the guests.

title: great hotel!good place!
review: Perfect place to enjoy old Istanbul and main sightseeing destinations, which are within walking distance. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. A cozy and sweet boutique style, family run hotel. We enjoyed our stay here and will go back again soon.

title: Great location and nice place to stay in...
review: Really  nice   and  quiet  hotel  comfortable  rooms  and  great   breakfast    I  loved  the   Garden  it's  a  great  place  to relax    The   people  are  helpfull  and   provide all  the  necessary  informations  to  make  our  trip  enjoyable  Ayhan   (  Host  of  the property )    great person  no one  could  be  more  helpful

title: A warm ,romantic and friendly place to stay in the heart of historical  part of the city.
review: The choice has been made by my girlfriend and I would say that it was a great decision. Location of the rooms is a bit down and you need to walk 23 steps (this is the exact number) and we booked the cozy room on the roof and we really loved it.  In the room, there was a large Jacuzzi and a double bed. At first we thought that we might have a problem with the temperature of the room but due to good air condition system in the room, we didn’t have any problem with the temperature. The breakfast was really nice and there were lots of selection.  Staffs were very friendly and helpful. We got all the necessary directions from the one of the staff, named called Ayhan. He was really a great expert about the city and sights to see. He had recommended us a place called Sabirtasi in…

title: good hotel!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: great hotel!!
review: Are   very  well  located  in  Sultanahmet  area  and within  walking  distance  to  all  museums  and mosques,  There  are some  steps  to get in to the  rooms  from the  entrance  but  if you  are a normal  person   and  can walk   1 -2  miles  in a day   these  20  steps  are not a big  issue The  room  we  stayed  in   called  Superior  double room  which  looks  to a nice  courtyard  with  roses, it  is  a  luxuary   double  room  and  the  bathroom  is   all  covered  marble   which  is really  nice and  clean   Overall   our  stay  was   really  good  and  the  staff  was  perfect  and  they  helped  us to   organize  some  cruises,  and booked  the  best   places  for  dinner    I  can  strongly  recommend  this  hotel  if you are  looking  for  an  average  priced …

title: Fantastic hotel!!!
review: Rose  Garden Suites,  what  a  lovely  place,  a  peacefull  garden  in the  middle  of  old  city,  i  knew  that  it  was  close  to  all  major  sights  but  did  not  imagine  that  the  Blue  Mosque  was  on the  corner of  our  room. We  booked  and  Superior  double  with  balcony  and  after  two days  they  mentioned  that  they  have  a  penthouse  on the roof  and  we  loved  that  room  411  is the room  number  and  this can be best  room  if  you  are  on  honeymooner  like us.  The    breakfast  was  in a  lovely  garden  and  also  they  have  a  terrace  garden  where  you  can  relax  and    have  free   fruites  and cookies  in  the  afternoon,  We  spent  in total  6  days  and  loved  the  hotel.Definitely  can  recommend  to  the  people  who are  looking …

title: Good location, friendly staff.
review: A great luxury hotel for great value of money. A manager Ayhan was very friendly and all the staff was always ready to help. The room was wonderful! New refurbished  and well decorated, very cozy and comfortable. Breakfast and dinner were delicious and were serviced at the garden, it was very romantic, we liked it! Good location, just in a walking distance to all the major attractions. We will return there for sure again and again, thank you for all!

title: Good Location but some improvements to be made
review: I think this hotel has only recently opened as at the time I was there, the entrance courtyard was being finished and access was via stairs from the adjoining Garden House hotel. I expect it should be finished within a month??  Breakfast and outdoor tables were provided at the Garden House hotel for the reasons stated above. Nevertheless, the Garden House hotel has a nice breakfast/outdoor tables area.  Breakfast was nothing to write home about but did have the usual cereal, cold meat, cheese, bread, drinks, fruit. There were also some additional Turkish meze dishes. I would have liked to see a variation in menu though. Didn't have dinner at the hotel but there was a basic but tasty cafe in the street behind the hotel (Ziya Baba - down the road and turn right) for a…

title: Delightful oasis in old Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: great staff
review: We stayed four days in this lovely place, just a short walk from sultanahmet square, Topkapi palace, blue mosque, hagia Sophia. The staff were utterly friendly and helpful.  Business manager Ayhan most efficient and took real care in making recommendations and in solving practical problems. Breakfast in garden terrific. Room decor perfect Turkish de luxe. Only warning is perhaps stay in original building if you have dodgy knees as there quite a few steps to get to suites.

title: Good Experience
review: I stayed at this hotel with my  friend for the first time. it has a perfect location. It is in heart of the historical places. Anyway the hotel staff is very hospitable and helpful. we spent good time during our holiday. i advise you to stay in this hotel :)

title: Nice,cosy,and warmful Hotel:)))
review: I stayed in this hotel with my wife.Hotel is located in the heart of city.Staff were so polite.Breakfast was delicious.I will definetely come back there.

title: Excellent
review: We   would like  to   thank  you  for  your   review .  All  these   positive  reviews   encourage  us  to  improve  our  service.We   hope to see  you  next  time   in Rose  Garden  Suites,    Sincerly   yours  AYHAN  AKKILIC  MANAGER

title: Hospitality, warmth and great ambience!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: excellent hospitality
review: On my recent trip to Istanbul I stayed at the Rose Garden Suites, opened recently by the management of the Garden House Hotel (where I have stayed earlier).    The hotel is located on a relatively quiet side street with rooms overlooking the street as well as an interior patio.  The hotel is in the process of being completed, but is very very charming nonetheless.  When completed, I am certain that it will be a fantastic stop for travellers to Istanbul.  The rooms in the hotel are very spacious, well appointed and the beds are really comfortable (comfortable hotel beds tend to be a rarity!). The bathrooms are very well done.   The Rose Garden Suites at present share staff, dining facilities and the patio with the Garden House Hotel - so it was good to reconnect with old friends…

title: wonderful city perfect location
review: Dear    Sophie,  We  would like  you  thank you  for  your  positive  words  to  us. It   is  very   important   as  we  are  a newly  opened  hotel in the middle  of  many  hotels  and  try to do   our  best    for  all  our   guests,  we   hope  to  see  you    again     soon.   Sincerly  yours  AYHAN  AKKILIC  MANAGER

title: New definiton of the comfort in the Old city!
review: All I can say it would be really not enough to describe how good it was. First of all, I have to say that Mr. Ayhan ( manager) was super helpful and without him, our time in istanbul wouldn't have been the amazing time that it was:) The hotel is nice and has amazing garden with roses. Very nice location at the city center of the Old town.  I stayed 3 nights here. I m very pleased to stay here. Very kind staff, good service, good location. I had a suite, extremely clean, thanks to the daily care of the staff, nice bathroom, with marble basin, spacious shower cabin. I felt like I was at my home. I will definitely stay again here when I go to Istanbul.

title: outstanding experience
review: i was travelling few countries in turkey..istanbul was first step...before i go to istanbul i booked my hotel .i wasnt sure how it is gonna be..first experience ..but when i arrived hotel i noticed it is gonna be nice ..very good location amazing place ..turkish people are very friendly specially personel they always ready to help you..service and rooms are very comfortable..i wont forget that days...and istanbul i love you..........

title: Friendly & Supportive Staff, nice room, walked to major attractions
review: I had a great opportunity to find out Istanbul with some friends of mine and It's with a great satisfaction that I go back to my country after 5 days stay at Rose Garden Suite Hotel in Sultan Ahmed. The Hotel was really a pleased services,really clean and really caring about clients.My friends and I had no complains during our stay there.The food is really of high quality and the view from the terrasse it's just amazing. Due to my unforgettable experience there that I recommend  to foreign travellers to live the experience to the Rosa Garden Suites Hotel near to Sultan Ahmed Squar which is historical places in Turky. J. Richards from London

title: excellent!!!
review: I would recommend staying at the Rose Garden Suites, previous name Garden House Hotel.  The manager, Aylan, was my contact from the time I made the reservation until we departed. Upon request he arranged transportation to and from the airport, greeted us upon arrival and helped us plan activities and good places to eat during our short stay.     Located in the center of the Old City, we easily walked to the Grand Bazaar and other major attractions.    We loved our room that had a comfortable bed, complimentary breakfast, and nice shower.Upon returning to the hotel we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff and cookies in the dining area. We used the free WiFi to keep in touch with our families at home. Good experience.

title: Welcoming, comfortable and perfectly located for the best Istanbul has to offer.
review: good and nice people there!!! perfect maneger ayhan!!!

title: Unforgettable experience - both accommodation and hotel personnel
review: Great location and superb rooms. The Hotel, Management and staff were great. The new Rose garden Suites are part of the Garden House Hotel and are a good indication of the commitment to providing top quality accomodation and service. Every staff member was helpful and friendly and made sure every requirement was met. The manager (Ayhan Akkilic) made sure we were able to make the most of our stay in Istanbul, with excellent advice on where to go and how best to plan our days and gave some wonderful recommendations for dining out. The hotel was welcoming and relaxing to come back to after each days sightseeing. A free mini buffet runs all day  and the breakfast offered a good choice.
